The doors provided no insulation whatsoever to the hallway noise. Even neighors doors closing and people talking at normal levels, it sounded like there was no door on my room at all. Bathroom lighting was dreadful at the mirror. Great shower though with two heads, one on the ceiling. It's a good property, but I should have known... I'm too old for this place. I moved to the Andaz after two nights.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we're definitely going back!”
Reviews.Author: lissaonthego
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego is effortlessly cool. The customer service was fantastic. We got to check in a little early and the front desk agent even accommodated a last minute room type request. She asked us what type of music we'd like to have playing our room so that when we first walked into our room we were greeted with a little top 40. Our room was a pretty standard room with two queens, but there were little things that reminded you you were staying at a Hard Rock. Little Hard Rock branded pouches and CDs and little guitars in the corners of the pillowcases. A lot of convenient outlets. We didn't really spend a lot of time in the room though. The location was absolutely perfect for us. It's right across the street from the convention center at the edge of the Gaslamp district. It's within walking distance of a ton of great restaurants and local shops. Since we were guests, we were able to get a somewhat last minute reservation at Nobu, the Japanese restaurant at the hotel. It was crawling with A list celebrities. I thoroughly enjoyed staying there and my friends and I are definitely staying there when we go back next year. The lobby was just a parade of celebrities and had kind of a club feel to it, but once you were up on the room floors it was quiet - you couldn't hear a thing. The staff was professional and fun. Because of all the big events going on in and around the hotel, there was a lot of security. I can't wait to go back. It was my first time staying a Hard Rock Hotel and I can't recommend it enough. The whole experience was about the music and being a fan of music and entertainment. So much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: annar76
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel was a little glitzy for me.....chrome, videos, music, etc. I had a great visit. Every employee I came in contact with was superb. Housekeeping was excellent. The rooms were awesome, very comfortable and attractive. Food on the expensive side. Location great.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average hotel... very unique and fun!”
Reviews.Author: funnygirl1149
Reviews.Content: I arrived in San Diego early and no rooms were available, but I was put on a waiting list and was called immediately when my room was ready (approx 1 hour later). The only bad thing about that was I was tired and there wasn't really any indoor lounge area where I could sit down and wait for my room to be ready except up by the pool, so we just walked around downtown. But overall the check in, check out and valet services were very quick and easy. The hotel is very unique and the room was really nice - the room was a bit pricey, but it was nicer than a regular hotel. The pool was small, but the lounge area around the pool was super nice! I stayed with my bf and we both had a fantastic time. I would definitely recommend for adults (I wouldn't stay here with kids)!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and wish we could visit more often.”
Reviews.Author: trey013
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the memorabilia throughout the hotel. That was really cool. The room was great the view from our room was pretty good. We could see the ballpark ( which we also got to see a game between the Padres and D-Backs ). First major league baseball game I've ever been to. All in all it was a great experience. Thanks, Mason

Reviews.Title: “NOT a family hotel...or if you are looking for a quiet place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: MortgageMike72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 28th to July 31st, hoping for some relaxing fun in the sun and a vacation away from our kids. What we got was a party pool that looked more like college spring break than a nice resort pool. The area was TINY! Maybe a dozen lounges/beds to sun bathe in. So disappointing. There is a bar that is open-air and open to the public right next to the pool. Total party atmosphere with hip-hop jams. LAME! Total lack of privacy. Is this VEGAS or San Diego? We were were awoken in the middle of the night every night to hollering in the hallways from the party-goers returning from the bars. While the rooms were extremely clean and probably they cleanest we've ever seen, the bathrooms were located in the middle of the room, right by the bed (in the Kind suite) which is a bit disrupting for your partner who may be sleeping. This was the wrong choice for us but the location was pretty good as all the shopping and restaurants were at the doorstep to the Gaslamp, right outside. When we checked out, the lady didn't even ask how our stay was!?! I would have said, "If I wanted to go to Vegas, I would have gone to VEGAS!"

Reviews.Title: “Treated like rock royalty and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: chelehys
Reviews.Content: We held a Board of Directors Meeting there one year and knew we liked it... so we turned around and held our Annual Staff Retreat at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly, welcoming, helpful, and every detail was rolled out to a tee. As a meeting planner, I have learned you can't always depend on the hotel lay out the plans you've set. With the Hard Rock San Diego, I didn't have to worry at all and was able to enjoy and participate in the meeting! Thank you Hard Rock San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TheDude5
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed during the whole week of the Comic-con 2011 and it was great. The service was wonderful, the valet and front desk assisted me with all my questions. It was located close to everything that I need and was in walking distance. I had a great time and we truly love staying at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Rocks!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: deniseobr5
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The staff was beyond the best ever. They went out of their way to make sure I was taken care of. Even though I was there for work I was there for 9 days and it seemed more of a vacation then work. I was a little worried about noise as I had read some reviews stating that it was loud. I will say I am a light sleeper and I never heard any noise. It was relaxing and peaceful. I stayed in the Black Eyed Pea Suite and it was great. The shower had 2 shower heads and I could of stayed in there forever. I will stay there every time I go to San Diego. One more thing when I checked in I was brought to a VIP area, the bartender noticed I had a long flight and made me the best drink at a time I really needed one. It could not of been any better. Thank you to the Hard Rock Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: DC-Logan
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a business meeting at this hotel. Before arriving we were concerned as it is not your typical business meeting location. We checked in on the last day of Comic Con and despite the crazy crowds and noise, the hotel treated us very well. Private check in with a cocktail and then off to our room. We were placed in a king suite near the elevator and we thought this might be noisy, but the room was very quiet despite being near the elevator. This part of the city is very busy all the time, but the rooms are quiet. The suite was very nice; with a sitting area on one side and bedroom on the other separated by the bathroom - very cool layout. The staff was always professional, pleasant, always helpful and friendly. Had room service for breakfast each morning; always arrived quickly and food was outstanding. You also have to try Nobu the Japanese restaurant in the hotel. We ate three three times over our 6 day stay; it was outstanding. There is also so much to do in this area of San Diego, great shopping, restaurants, and next to the ball park, so we took in a ball game one afternoon. The only con was that the internet connection was very slow throughout the hotel - which is hard when you are there on business and need to stay connected. Hard Rock made our stay more fun than we expected!

Reviews.Title: “no complains”
Reviews.Author: kc0718
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. I only stayed one night with a friend and we just stayed at the pool all day and partied at the club at night, so it was great to not even have to leave the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “One night turned into two!”
Reviews.Author: FreddyNP
Reviews.Content: I really didn't expect much from the Hard Rock Hotel when my friend told me we were going to stay there. But my expectations were blown away when I got there. The hotel looks great and is in good shape. The hotel staff was incredible friendly and ready to help. The concierge my friend and I so many fun suggestions that we decided to spend another day in San Diego. And I have to mention the rooms are very comfortable. I didn't want to get out of the bed and I loved the TV/movie options (I'm a big TV person, gotta have it). The only downside was the restaurant. It wasn't bad, just not impressed by it.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place where you really experience the life in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Lonelytraveling
Reviews.Content: A vibrant place where the nightlife in San Diego is.. For fun loving people.. Hard rock hotel is the place to be! Great place with great service too.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated!”
Reviews.Author: rndiver1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 11:00 p.m. on a weeknight to find the restaurants closed in the hotel. Room service was available for a ridiculous price. The closest place to eat was a Subway Shop 2 blocks away. You do not want to walk around in this area at night. Alot of street people. The room was average, small and the bed was hard.

Reviews.Title: “A little loud but great service”
Reviews.Author: KendraHoward
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to relax and be close to everything then come on during the week. It gets a little packed and loud on the weekends especially if your room is close to the pool. The service was great and the rooms were really nice but it's more of a place for if you want to be in the heart of the Gaslamp and go out at night instead of a relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “It makes you feel like home!!”
Reviews.Author: RaMonFuEnTeS
Reviews.Content: I appreciate the stuff who appreciated me, and I appreciate the HRH members who are taking the time to focus on me out of thousands that stay and returning my emails... Really means alot to a customer, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, great staff”
Reviews.Author: StaceyArch
Reviews.Content: Everyone went so far out of their way to be genuinely friendly -- even down to the handyman repairing a door in the hallway. The atmosphere is top notch as well. Overall a great place, would love to stay there everytime I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: CharmedPiper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a 3 week tour of the West Coast USA. On arrival we discovered that we had made an error with our booking, however this was quickly resolved by Tisha on the Reception Desk with absolutely no fuss or hassle. In fact she gave us an upgrade to a suite for free and did not charge us resort fees. She was extremely pleasant and helpful, in fact we found all staff to be this way. Our suite was really nice and we had a great 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait for another mini vacation here!”
Reviews.Author: stephmessner
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel room, last minute, through Hard Rock's website. I felt extremely lucky to get a room at all that weekend-- up until the day before it had been booked solid. I now know why! I'm a San Diego local, and decided to get a room there for the iMAN event-- an event hosted by iTAN, the largest and fastest growing Sun Spray and Spa salon in San Diego County. Checking into the hotel was hassle-free, and quite pleasant. The bell hop was extremely courteous, and provided us with any additional help we wanted or needed. The room was gorgeous! Perfect to get ready with the girls, and eventually to crash out in. The bars-- 207 and Float-- were amazing! I wish I could remember more of that night to go in depth about how awesome they were :) The next morning, I went down to the pool at 8 am, even though it technically opens at 9. The personnel working there didn't bother me, in fact, they brought me water! Checking out of the hotel was extremely easy; all I had to do was fill out a piece of paper and drop it off in a box. So easy! Even though I live in San Diego, staying at the Hard Rock made me feel like I had a mini vacation to Vegas! I loved it and I can't wait to get away on another mini vacation soon!

Reviews.Title: “Staying Classy in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jdbronco
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this party with friends as part of a bachelor party. This is really the perfect place base for a trip of younger people looking to party and go out on the town. As mentioned, the location is wonderful at the foot of the Gaslamp District and one block from Petco Park. As a group I had a chance to check out both the studio and standard suites. This is a fairly new hotel and my first impression was the small size of the rooms. The suite tries to mask the lack of square footage with a very open floor plan that I felt was too open. The hotel shines with contemporary bathrooms and upscale toiletries. Even with our erratic schedule housekeeping kept up with my room and I was never wanting for their services. They also placated my hotel pet peeve of stacking a pile of pillows that are all equally soft on the beds. They gave me a nice mix of soft and firm. The TV's have a user-friendly input for connecting mp3 players, laptops, etc. to the TV. Guests receive free entry into the clubs/bars on property before 10 PM. Staying here was a fun experience but I don't think I'll be back unless they can discount the price. Even with a Jetsetter sale the price was steep. If it is just a room you are looking for I'd head to the Hilton next door. Their loft suites are about the same price and are four times as large. Maybe not as trendy but you get the same location. The little things the Hard Rock does makes it fun and everyone I dealt with was very friendly and want their guests to have fun. What's more is that they give you a free download mix that is regularly updated. Pretty cool! Thanks for a rockin' trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MarcB83
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Beautiful property very well maintained. Can't miss experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hard Rock, San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: HikingGal1961
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hard Rock Hotel just a week ago or so, was my first experience with a Hard Rock Hotel. I was very impressed. I have been raving about the service, the pool with its bedding, (yes bedding) pillows and great music, the King Suite room, the overall vibe of the hotel, and embiance to all my co-workers and family. This hotel was like no other I have experienced. Check in was even a breeze and very SERVICE oriented. The staff was so friendly! They even asked me what kind of music would I like in the room and set that up before entering! Really? Wow. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Flashy, fun design, cool layout, decent size”
Reviews.Author: evenjailnot
Reviews.Content: Fun energetic hotel, well designed, theme rooms, great bathroom which was fun to play in

Reviews.Title: “Good, OK, Nothing Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Waytar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, room was OK but not great for the price. Hotel location is the best part of the experience being right at the start of the Gaslamp district, across from the Convention center and the tram service if you need it. Staff was friendly and helpful especially the Valet staff, they seemed to be the hardest workers at the Hotel. (For $35.00 a night valet service, I hope they would be). We had 2 days when we went out for the whole day, 8 hours or more and our room had not been cleaned by the time we returned. Better Hotel for younger people that enjoy the night life.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: labarkley
Reviews.Content: Position of hotel is fine at one end of the main street. All you can see is the conference centre though. We stayed in a Silver Rock star suite. We were disappointed the decor was very worn, the floor was peeling away and had been painted on, not fixed, furniture was chipped. Wardrobe space was tiny, the room is basically a square with a blocked out square in the centre so to get anywhere you walk in a circle. The bedroom has a sink and a bath in it. Shower was seperate as was the lavatory, which contained the only full length mirror! weird. The room was dull. Then we found we had no hot water, plumbers came. One of the TV's did not work either. The mini bar prices are outrageous, why should you pay 18% service charge to pour your own? The pool bar is horrendous, we couldn't get served at 6pm when there was about 20 people in it. It is scruffy and uncomfortable, covered in concrete and empty pizza boxes. The downstairs bar is amazing, with very friendly staff. We returned at midnight on our first night to be refused entry by security. we showed them our rock star privledge keycard, but couldn't get in. The lady on reception apologised, but we'd had enough. We checked out the next day

Reviews.Title: “rock starring it”
Reviews.Author: jamespilliner
Reviews.Content: What a unique cool hotel this turned out to be. I didn't book anything i just found the pictures on the web and drove up to the hotel which is beautiful upon entry. Everyone from the valet, to the front desk to the concierge, to the baggage chap were outstanding and so cool. All the staff seem to be young, energetic, helpful and they have a great attitude (we saw our baggage chap walking around the reception area playing a guitar when there were no new clients arriving, such a cool fella he created a vibe of his own). The rooms are fantastic too and the emphasis on it being a rockstar's hotel is something different and inherently special about the hotel. Rooms are edgy and fresh, they play your choice of music upon entry too to continue with the rockstar theme, its shnazzy. Anyway, absolutely recommending it looking to stay downtown, its a short stroll to the best nightlife in downtown and has a Nobu in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT Hotel, perfect location, better for the young & restless!”
Reviews.Author: kamvissi
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the second time at this hotel, like last time an excellent experience. Room is large, luxurious with awesome bathroom, comfy bed, flat screen tv and a balcony! (room 735). Hotel is best for young people that dont mind the loud music and occasional parties in and out of the hotel. Perfect location at the beginning of the gaslamp quarter next to all the great restaurants (try the Gaslamp Strip Club where you get to BBQ y own huge steak!)

Reviews.Title: “Great place, cool vibe.”
Reviews.Author: ArgusTracker
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooftop bar is outstanding. Staff is friendly (especially valet staff) and restaurants are nice. However, if you are a family or traveller looking for "peace & quiet" this is not your hotel. This hotel is fantastic!!! We went as a family and knew what we were getting into....it was a blast!

Reviews.Title: “W.O.W.”
Reviews.Author: pbh4935
Reviews.Content: It's funny how a preconceived notion can be so completely off base. There is not one, single complaint about this hotel. Not one. I was expecting to be driven insane by rave music, scantily clad 20 somethings squealing for attention on the 4th floor dance floor with the cast of jersey shore fist pumping to the trancelike beats. Nope. Clean, crisp, comfortable and the best customer service I have ever received. This is my 3rd trip to the ESRI Conference in San Diego and we have stayed in some nice places with adequate amenities and proximity to what you want to go to. But the Hard Rock is impossible to beat. The location is perfect, the views are wonderful and the staff is the absolute best. My suite was wonderful. I could not be happier and will not stay anywhere else upon my return. Thanks for an amazing time. And thank you, Sara, for possibly being the perfect front person for the San Diego Hard Rock. You guys truly Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location :-)”
Reviews.Author: klee_baker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for two nights at the end of June 2011 as part of our Honeymoon road trip. We travelled down to San Diego from Annaheim, and got there at about 1130am - check in was not supposed to be until 3pm. Thankfully, the staff at the hotel were happy to check us in early. At the check in desk we were asked what kind of music we enjoyed, which made sense once we got up to the room and the TVs were set to play music based on our preferences (a nice touch!) I really liked the room - we had a room on the third floor that consisted of a big king sized bed, a separate sofa/lounge area (with TVs in each area) and a bathroom & shower. The only thing I did not like about the room was the fact that the toilet door, and shower wall & door were both see through. Granted they were not 100% clear, but there was still enough to see who was inside of each room and what they were doing! I'm not sure if this was deemed to be trendy, but this was my main dislike about the rooms! The hotel itself was only a block away from Petco Park where the Padres play - we went to watch a game on our first day there. It was also extremely close to a number of bars and restaurants on the main streets of San Diego. The decor of the hotel seemed nice - I liked the memorabilia as you get with other Hard Rock locations. We ate at Mary Jane's once on our stay and this was a pleasant visit. The portion sizes were huge though and we had to ask for a container to take our uneaten food back up to the hotel room. We did not drink at any of the bars - 207, although loud when we went past seemed very empty (This was a Thursday night). We visited the pool once on our stay, but the atmosphere was not quite as relaxing as I'd have liked - really it's like a party pool with lots of young, hip adults drinking in the pool etc. This didn't offend me, but I could understand why it would put of any families with younger children, or older guests who would be staying at the hotel Overall though I'd still recommend the hotel - it was a pleasant stay and I'd happily stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “What an Awesome Time!”
Reviews.Author: CSF18768
Reviews.Content: Anytime I go back to San Diego, I will stay at The Hard Rock Hotel. Everyone...and I mean everyone - from the moment we parked at the valet to check-out were friendly, helpful and were genuinely concerned if we were having a great time. The rooms were very nice and the view from Room 1250 was spectacular. If you are coming to San Diego, CA, stay at The Hard Rock.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not nice crowd...”
Reviews.Author: carpenoctemBerlin
Reviews.Content: I can really recommend the Woodstock suite. Beautiful view, nice design and good value for money. Unfortunately there were many unbehaving young people at the pool which made it impossible to enjoy the pool. After two hours security came but that was after sunset. It is maybe the Hard Rock brand but this hotel attracts people which will spoil your vacation...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to party and relax at the same time”
Reviews.Author: Gabegsi
Reviews.Content: I had my bachelor party at the Hard Rock San Diego. The hotel and the staf fis amazing .The pool pary was unbelievable.The people were beautiful.The bars of the hotel are great Everybody has to experience that vibe. Can't wait to go back again : )

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel, not for families”
Reviews.Author: localbeans
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in the hotel but my husband and infant daughter were with me. Be careful about what room you get. Here, the suites seem to mean that they are not overlooking the courtyard/club. All other rooms are. We were initially in one of those loft rooms and even on a Thursday it was terrible. The courtyard turns into a club and the noise level is tremendous. It's like there is a party in your room - it is SO loud. I finally decided to upgrade to a suite and that was not handled well. For 4 hours my husband was told it was "about to happen" which meant he wasted most of the day waiting and wasn't able to leave the hotel. If they had been honest and said "we'll move you at 2" he could have at least left the hotel. They provided a pack n' play for our daughter with a nice kit of Johnson and Johnson products which was a nice touch but this is clearly not a hotel geared towards families. I was excited about the pool but it's a party pool. I wouldn't have been comfortable bringing a child into the pool. Not because it wasn't safe but because the other people there are in a party frame of mind. At many other hotels this wouldn't have been an issue. Friday and Saturday night there were parties ALL OVER the hotel in private rooms and therefore a lot of drunk people all over the hotel. The suite rooms are definitely worth the upgrade and the sound proofing is far superior to other hotels. Additionally, the fact that you have to use your card in the elevator is really annoying. There seems to be an expectation from other people using the elevator that you will use your card to let them up. If you are in your 20's (or a 20's frame of mind) this hotel would be great. If you are traveling with a family. It just may not be the right fit.

Reviews.Title: “The best in San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: Acdman
Reviews.Content: This was the most fantastic hotel I have stayed in. From the moment I walked in till I checked out it was exceptional service from the entire staff. The atmosphere, ambiance and all around look and style of the Hard Rock SD was way beyond my expectations. When I walked in my room the TV was on playing cool music on up on the screen had a BIG greeting saying WELCOME ARMANDO "LASTNAME"..that was so cool

Reviews.Title: “Gibson LP in my room! How Cool is that?”
Reviews.Author: LRG280
Reviews.Content: Just a really fun place. Stayed in a Hard Rock king suite for 1 night. Nice room, unique decor, very comfortable bed. I took advantage of the Gibson guitar loaner program, really cool! We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Great location in the Gaslamp quarter, short walk to lots of Restaurants, bars, Petco Park, and the convention center. Really enjoyed our stay here and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: RDG-Aggie00
Reviews.Content: This the hotel for a good time around fun people. Pool scene is the best in San Diego. And location is perfect for a Padres game or hanging out in the Gas Lamp. Just so you know, this is not the place for children or a quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: mojo247
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hard Rock Hotel went out of their way to make sure I was treated like a rock star...An excellent place to stay in San Diego. Even if you stay somewhere else, go in there and check out all the great stuff on display--everything from Stevie Ray Vaughan's guitar to Jimi Hendrix' sombrero...even the payphone out of CBGB's is in there! Way cool. And the margaritas at Mary Jane's are top notch.

Reviews.Title: “HARD ROCK IS WHERE IT IS AT!”
Reviews.Author: SherryyyBabyyy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Hard Rock this past weekend and it was the most amazing hotel! Every employee was professional and helpful. The rooms were nothing but comfortable and very clean. I will stay here time and time again! Thank you again Hard Rock for making our trip amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A lively place”
Reviews.Author: Kolozsvar
Reviews.Content: The choice of the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego was a great choice for our conference, involving more than 425 participants. The setting and location were great, service was perfect, and the accommodations were clean and well laid out. To put it mildly, the sojourn at the hotel was anything but staid.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mrZayas
Reviews.Content: I love the rooms they are awesome and spacious comfortable bed worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: katt981
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock on June 10th - June 13th. The hotel was amazing. We had the king suite with a balcony overlooking Petco Field. The Gaslamp area is so fun with all the options for dining and clubbing, but be wary it is pricey! I Loved our 'custom' music that we had in our room and the two large flat screens. The bathroom setup was a little 'funky' to me... the room was a rectangle - you enter in the living area, then in the middle was the shower on one side and the toilet on the other side (both enclosed with etched glass doors of course) and the sink in the middle of them. Then you passed through there to get to the bed and balcony. You would have a problem if anyone has 'digestive' issues, because you can definitely hear everything. I would stay here again just for the INTERVENTION Sunday! It was 'OFF THE CHAIN - CRAZY GOOD!' DJ's spinning, dancing, drinking... Although the weather got a little drizzly, it didn't seem to affect the party atmosphere! I would ask for the package and get a room that faced the rooftop pool. the breakfast place had great food and the choice to 'grab & go' if you didn't have time. The rooftop pool/bar (location of the Intervention Sunday), great views and lots of room just to mingle if you didn't want to get wet. The dance club 207 was so fun, contemporary music and great DJ's again! We didn't get a chance to try the sushi place, so I don't have anything to say about that. There is a room charge for the wireless, kind of like the same fee you pay for in Vegas and such. We had no problem connecting and getting Wifi

Reviews.Title: “Bachlorette's Love the Hardrock”
Reviews.Author: OneSeattleGal
Reviews.Content: Hardrock San Diego is designed for young people who want to a blast. I went down with 5 of my friends for a bachlorette party and we had a complete blast. The staff went above and beyond to make you feel like you were a rock star. From the bell hops to the resturants to the room, everything was amazing. Pros: Large Rooms Amazing Staff On site food and Clubs are a blast Cons: Pool is small and charges for the best locations at the pool on weekends Staff at the pool not nearly as good as the staff throughout the hotel Not a good place to bring your kids

Reviews.Title: “Great Wings and Pina Coladas”
Reviews.Author: casimir11
Reviews.Content: I had a blast at Hard Rock Hotel San Diego. I slept like a KING and partied like a QUEEN. I ate chicken wings at god knows what time. They we're so delicious and spicy. I lifted weights in the gym while watching Def Leppard, I drank a Pina Colada by a blue stone fire. I went to the Sunday pool party called "Intervention" and it blew my mind. High heels and bikinis everywhere. I had a huge grin on my face the entire time I was there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: WadeKoehler
Reviews.Content: I organized a meeting at the hotel and from the initial contact through the last day of the meeting, they staff at HRH SD was fantastic. Very friendly front desk and concierge staff, great location and excellent rooftop bar. The guest rooms are very modern including incredibly fast wireless internet in my guest room For a great vacation or business meeting I would highly recommend the hotel. In fact, I already plan to take my entire family there next year for vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Perfect Location, and Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: olsenmarion
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our six year old daughter for two nights in June. I had booked the room through hotel.com. However, somehow I messed up and managed to book the room for a week past our arrival. So, they did not have a room for us when we arrived. They quoted us $400 a night for a suite and said there wasn't anything they could do about our hotel.com issue as it was an outside vendor. Understandable. We weren't ready to pay $400 a night so the lady at the desk asked us to hang on a moment and she'd talk to her manager. She came back and offered us the same suite but at the studio rate of $295 a night. We took it. She was very kind and accommodating. I had also printed off a coupon for $75 hotel credit for each night of your stay. She still accepted the hotel credit coupon and applied that to our bill as well. They put us in a beautiful suite on the top floor in a nice quiet corner. The view from our room looked right into Petco Park and we loved walking to restaurants in the area. We would definitely stay here again! We are now moving to the area and hope to find a condo in the same area of town (East Village).

Reviews.Title: “Location + facilities + vibe. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: littlecitygirl11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for a combo work + play trip and was not disappointed. It had the same cool vibe as the Hard Rock in Vegas with a little more chill, which was great considering I spent about 5 hours per day working in my hotel room. The rooms were modern and spacious, the pool small but well-appointed and surrounded by a hip bar and bar crowd to match. The location couldn't have been better - we walked to the boardwalk, restaurants and bars. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed in a long time”
Reviews.Author: thelittleitalian
Reviews.Content: Arriving late in the evening, a guest might expect slow and indifferent service from the staff but not at the Hard Rock Hotel. I was greated with a smile and the staff answered the many questions that I had concerning the hotel and the convention that I was attending. Throughout my stay there were many opportuniites to interact with the staff, front desk, housekeeping and the concierge. The concierge was very helpful when I asked about my early morning flight. He indicated that I might want to arrive earlier than usual for my 6:30 am flight. I asked why and he indicated the same statement, arrive early. When I did arrive for the filght an hour and half before the filght was to leave the San Diego airport was packed with travelers. I was able to get to my flight, with about 10 minutes to spare, if I had not used his advice I might still be in San Diego. Great place, great people, great food and a great City. Thanks for a great experience. Greg Della Franco

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel - ROCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: getrich2011
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived I was treated like a VIP, at check in they gave me a choice of music to listen to once inside my room - awesome! My room was super nice, like a living room with a bar, large screen flat panel TV, hook up cables for ipod, wifi. My room view was of the street below,made my room bright and airy. My balcony had a door opened wide to outside allowed fresh air in from outside, as opposed to other hotels that are always closed tight with recycled air. Room was clean & spacious, Bed super comfortable, staff was efficient, courteous and friendly. Amenities awesome, pool, cafe -great food,were all great, niteclub had great music and even better crowd. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome business/meeting destination”
Reviews.Author: jeffmcsweeney
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we met immediately with Alisa who really took care of us. We reviewed the meeting rooms we were using then she asked about our off-site event. We shared our reservations and she immediately offered the hotel. "If anything goes wrong give me 30 minutes notice and we'll take care of you." WOW! Even though we did not need to take her up on the offer my boss's concerns were immediately alleviated and the whole event was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Drunk Raging / Raucous MTV-style Party Environment”
Reviews.Author: DCReviewer43
Reviews.Content: There was a raging/raucous MTV-style party taking place at the hotel when I arrived. There were drunk guests in the halls and elevators. One man in the elevator was so inebriated that I feared he was going to vomit on me. Another man yelled at me because I would not use my key card to allow access to a floor. My requested room was not available. I waited hours for an available room to check-in. My room's HVAC system was not functioning. There were multiple billing discrepancies which included: * Incorrect room rate on my final night * Duplicate parking fee on final day. I had only one rental car. * Two incorrect charges from the mini bar. I was told that it appeared I that I took two candles. Nope, I did NOT take any candles. You were warned...don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experince”
Reviews.Author: andrew_lewellyn
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hard Rock in San Diego, and I must say it was a one of a kind experience. The staff was unbelievably helpful and accommodating. Upon walking in, I was greeted instantly. I arrived at like 10pm, so I was ready to get checked in and get to my room. By the time I received my key, the packages I had sent before me were at my door and Dave (Bell Hop), was getting them in the room and showing me the cool features of this hotel. He also took the time to understand why I was there and recommend some activities for my free time. Although I was only there for a few days, I never wanted to leave! The entire time I felt welcomed and informed, and would recommend this hotel to anyone for any time of occasion.

Reviews.Title: “i have never been made to feel so welcome and so special.”
Reviews.Author: seremonkey
Reviews.Content: From minute one of walking in and asking Julie B (receptionist) what sort of deals she could do for myself and team mates (4 in total from the British Forces) to the moment we checked out the next day our expectations where not only meat but far exceeded.We where quite literally treated like the only customers they had, which was far from the truth as the hotel was very full. If ever i have the chance to visit San Diego again i will without hesitation be booking in to the Hard Rock Hotel. if this seems like a glowing review its because i honestly can not find a single fault with the Staff, rooms, food or ambiance of this fantastic Hotel. Well done Hard Rock San Diego, you made 4 British Servicemen feel very welcome and very special.

Reviews.Title: “Rock'n it at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: sandiegosantorini
Reviews.Content: As always, whenever there is a big classic rock concert in San Diego, the first place I check to stay is the Hard Rock. Even though we could take a cab back home (since we live in San Diego), adding a night at the Hard Rock keeps the party going. And we can always count on great service, a great room and usually a great deal, too. It's our way of getting to feel a little bit like a rock star!!!

Reviews.Title: “The customer service was excellent and very helpfully at at times”
Reviews.Author: F1ip
Reviews.Content: The employees were very friendly, and helpfully at all times of the day. The only bad thing out of the trip was the shuttle service to the begging of the marathon race, other than that inconvenience everything was excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and experience”
Reviews.Author: ccallaway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel, as it was the host hotel for the RocknRoll Marathon I was running in. Upon arrival (which took no time as it is located right near the airport) we were greeted and helped right away. Our room was the nicest room I have stayed in, and throughout the days the staff cleaned it so it looked like the first day every time. Our hotel over looked "Float" and the pool, and at night the music was loud but as soon as we closed the window it was quiet, which was good for me as I needed to be in bed early for the race. The beds were extremely comfortable!! Every little detail of the hotel has something to do with the music theme, and I would recommend this hotel to any traveler. I will be staying at Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas for my upcoming trip, and I hope will be as awesome as the San Diego Location. As far as the location of the hotel, it is right by a bunch of great bars, restaurants, and shopping and the water!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay with an incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: jem12875
Reviews.Content: Great, fantastic, wonderful! They really know how to treat their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: scc_86
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here for a business conference held at the hotel . Arrived on a Sat evening and place was bustling and loud. Check-in was a breeze. They informed me that they had given me a room that was away from the action and should be quiet. Never heard a thing but some other guests at the conference did say that the music from the club was loud in their rooms on Sat and Sun nights. Room was nice...very clean...dual-head shower was a nice touch. Location was great...minutes from Petco Park and numerous restaurants and bars. Short hike over the convention center stairs brings you to nice bayfront parks and walking/running/biking trail. Hotel gym was okay...bigger would have been better. Service was outstanding through entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “It rocked”
Reviews.Author: Bill_wheat
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, it was great. It was my first time staying at a Hard Rock and first time in San Diego and it wad an awesome trip. The pool on Saturday afternoon was killer.I know the intervention party on Sunday is supposed to be the best but we had a blast on Saturday. Lots of fun folks , some tasty drinks and awesome tunes but it wasn't too crowded. The location of the hotel is perfect , righ by Petco park and plenty of other restaurants and bars. The food and drink area little pricey, but you can't beat the atmosphere . Some of my friends were at the Omni across the street, but they ended up hanging at the hard rock.

Reviews.Title: “Most Epic Mid Week Party Ever”
Reviews.Author: Mike735
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hard Rock San Diego before so when my 30th birthday came around there was no question as to where I was going to stay. I reserved a Rock Star Gold Suite and it was perfect for the pre-party as well as the after party. The pool was awesome and the servers were very patient (we had a group of about 15 people and after the drinks settled in we were a little loud). She was also pretty hot. The entire staff was really attentive and they were also polite, even when they had to cut off one of drunk friends in the group. I will be staying here on my next trip to San Diego, that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Memory I will never forget!”
Reviews.Author: bfenton01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hard rock hotel on our anniversary at the end of our family vacation. My boyfriend proposed to me in front of the hard rock hotel may 27th and with the help of a couple wonderful staff members managed to pull off the most wonderful proposal i could have dreamed of. thank you hard rock and your staff for helping him pull this off. Alex and Dave rock!!! He proposed with a cinderalla proposal glass slipper and all. :)

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Experience”
Reviews.Author: mommasc79
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel is situated right in the Downtown Gaslight District. The location allows you to walk to a wide variety of eateries and shopping. The best part is if you are a baseball fan Petco Park home of the San Diego Padres is literally right next to Hard Rock. The Hard Rock experience is one that I will never forget; every touchpoint within the hotel is well executed with details that remind you that you are in a rock and roll hotel from the guitar pic employee name tags to the room amentities to the cucumber and orange water that is serviced. If you like to workout while traveling the fitness room is state of the art with a wide range of workout equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Alie1975
Reviews.Content: A unique experience, Definitely will return. The service, the people, the location, the unique rooms, the vibe I give it an A+++++.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock in the heart of the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: AHSwift
Reviews.Content: During a quick business trip to the San Diego area, I had to change my plans and stay overnight. I chose the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego because I am a fan of the Hard Rock franchise, the location is great and I wanted an experience for the money. Hotels in downtown San Diego aren't cheap (not exactly New York's Time Square prices, though), but for the rate it's worth it to stay where there's a nightlife. I've stayed at the Hard Rock Las Vegas, which sets the bar for the Rock-themed hotel experience (not including the casino). The advantage of HR San Diego is the location and the amenities. The pool and bar are above average, and both have uncompromising views of the cityscape. The hotel is across from the convention center, which is a huge advantage for certain times of the year, like the annual, famous Comic-Con. (Not to mention, one of the best, cheapest fish restaurants is directly across the street -- Tin Fish. A local legend. 20 steps across from the front entrance.) I stayed in the Suite, which I chose for the view. It's a great room for couples -- but, if you want to save money and can skip the view, stay in the standard room. There are higher level suites with balconies available, which have views of the cityscape and bay. The Suite had 2 flat screen TVs, your choice of genre rock music pumped in, a nice amenities bar & fridge and a stylish bath & shower area. On the property, there is a cool diner named Mary Jane's. The food is good, but don't confuse this with the legendary Hard Rock restaurant. There is a Hard Rock San Diego restaurant located about 6 short blocks away, around the corner and up 4th street. That was the only disappointment -- I always hoped the real HR restaurant would be in the hotel. (I think this is because the HR restaurant was relocated from La Jolla a number of years ago, and likely pre-dates the HR Hotel.) There was a moderately-sized convention going on in the hotel during my stay, and I got no sense that the place was overcrowded or too noisy. This may be different during Comic-Con. I know that there are other hotels on the far side of the convention center that specialize in large business meetings, and guests get the sense that the place is overcrowded. Not so at the HR Hotel. Last, but not least, the best advantage of the HR Hotel SD is the location. Guests can walk out the side entrance of the hotel on Fifth Street and find an abundance of restaurants and shops along the Gaslamp. (Not to mention the Brewer's baseball stadium on the other side of the hotel.) If you are staying in downtown SD, the Gaslamp is the scene, and there are many Gaslamp events throughout the year. Given this location, if you are willing to spend a little extra for the environment, the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego should be your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not the "Relaxing and Restful" stay we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: LinzDiane
Reviews.Content: I guess we knew when booking the room this hotel would cater to the younger crowd and tourists. That was what we were looking for in choosing a location, we're in our early 30s. The location is fantastic, the staff was very friendly and accomidating, and the room was clean. However, we did not expect Party Central until 3am everynight. We asked if we could get a room as high as possible (tip from prior reviews), it didn't make a difference what so ever. This place is loud all night. If it's not people yelling up and down the hall, the party you can hear loud and clear through the thin walls, it's the darn train next to the building that will keep you up all night. The beds/pillow were really uncomfortable, we had to ask for a new pillow every night, nothing worked. We had hoped to lay out by the pool during the week, it's a small continuation of seating for the bar. Don't be deceived by the pretty pictues, it's really not that nice, we're using the pool at the Omni accross the street. We tried to enjoy the bars, but at $14 per drink, it just wasn't worth it. We went accross the street and had a lot more fun. The locals laugh when you tell them where you are staying, i guess it has the reputation of "Tourist trap." Next time we are in town we will stay in the Gaslamp, but save a little money and stay accross the street.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & Energizing all in one!”
Reviews.Author: lbaleme
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hard Rock hotel for reputation it has amongst our friends. We wanted a place that is close to where the Padres play, check, and is the epicenter of the social universe in San Diego, check! The Hard Rock Hotel has great service, and great food. It's hard to find both in one place, Hard Rock has both. The rooms are very nice as is the service throughout the hotel. The in room beverages and snacks are extremely expensive and for the price of a suite, alcohol, mixers, and snacks provided in room should be complimentary. I recommend this establishment to anyone for any reason, business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Jcruella
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and found it very convenient, just accross the street from the Convention Center. But the best part was the outstanding interaction I had with ALL of the staff there. Everyone, from room service to valets, front desk to restaurants, were sincerely nice, accomodating and informative. I've never been so pleased!!!

Reviews.Title: “We could have stayed anywhere but chose the best - Hard Rock Hotel/San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jojopuco
Reviews.Content: Our fantastic stay began with an efficient, friendly check in staff. We arrived too early to check into our suite but our luggage was securely stored until the room was finished and inspected. We were asked our music preference at check in . That way the music that we liked was playing in our room when we entered. We had lunch at Mary Jane's restaurant. What a meal! The food was delicious! There were 8 of us and each ordered a different meal. The presentation of the food was fabulous and the portions so generous that each of us took food to our rooms/suites. Once we went to our suite, the luxury factor became apparent. Within minutes, our luggage arrived with a most friendly and knowledgable bellman. He gave us a thorough tour explaining the amenites as well as electonic features provided by the hotel. He asked that if there was anything we needed or if we had any questions to please call him through the operator. He assured us that his only wish is that we have the best stay possible. We also appreciated the security feature of having to use your room key in order to use the elevator. Check out was a breeze. A matter of minutes and we were done. We will definitely stay at the Hard Rock Hotel/San Diego whenever we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect service, there's no other choice!”
Reviews.Author: travelingmadness
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock to attend a conference and was thrilled with everything, from the speedy check in to the awesome service I received by Cuz in Mary Jane's the first night I arrived. I'd taken three planes to get there and seeing his friendly face at the end of a very long day was exactly how I wanted to start my week. I traveled alone and felt perfectly safe and welcomed at 207 and Maryjane's at all times of the day and evening. The hotel is situated perfectly, across from the trolley that runs along the waterfront, to Old Town, to Gillespie Field, and even as far south as the border but that's not all. You're also at the gateway to the Gaslamp quarter (literally) with many MORE amazing and funky restaurants, bars, clubs and boutiques. I kept telling myself I would definitely come back on vacation with family to really explore the area and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Hard Rock again. My room overlooked Tin Fish Restaurant and the trolley stop across from the Convention Center. I was also a two block walk to Petco Park for the local Padres ballgame. I did hear the trolley bell occasionally, but from what I heard from others at the convention, my room was desireable on party nights at Float. I guess in rooms overlooking that area, things did get a bit loud. Convention rooms were comfortable, centrally located, and all equipment we needed, from sound systems, to meals, to screens and projectors worked as promised. Also, a tiny detail, I love the one touch call for everything I needed in my room, Ground Control was all I needed to contact other rooms, ask questions about service and facilities, or check on extending my checkout. I didn't use the pool, but loved Float as a place to hang out in the late afternoon for a pre-dinner drink and a bit of sunshine. SO comfortable and relaxed. I can't imagine a better place to stay in San Diego, whether it's for work or play! As a solo traveler I truly appreciated the safety and the comfort of eating at the hotel and the area. Awesome experience. Hard Rock ROCKS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel in Gaslamp!!”
Reviews.Author: xX2012Xx
Reviews.Content: Self contained, u will not need to leave the hotel!!! Great food, amazing drinks, excellent nightlife...all in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel is one of the coolest and friendliest that I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: deedlesmom
Reviews.Content: The attention to detail was outstanding! Every staff member I came in contact with greeted me with a smile. The valet that helped as I was leaving, growled at me for trying to put my own bags in the car. It was hilarious! I would definitely recommend the Hard Rock Hotel to anyone traveling to San Diego for its convenient location in the Gas Lamp District -- so much to see and do, I wish I could have stayed longer! Everyone at the conference felt the same way as I did!

Reviews.Title: “No better place to be”
Reviews.Author: SongMD
Reviews.Content: Amanda was very helpful in making sure out trip went perfectly. she was able to accommodate all our requests. Hard Rock is definitively the place to be at for the night life. Bar 207 and Rooftop lounge were both amazing with great music. If you are young or single and want to have a great time, then come here, if all you want is sleep, then go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TxGirl_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls night out. Location was perfect and everything was literally down the street. The lobby was a little loud and it was difficult to hear the person behind the counter but no biggy. As a guest at the hotel, you can get into the bar downstairs as well as the rooftop lounge before 10pm. These were nice perks and we enjoyed our time there. Fish, our bar tender at the rooftop lounge, was fun and took care of us. The room was fine with 2 comfy queen beds-standard room size and view of the pool/hot tub area. Pool was on the rooftop and looked nice but we did not use it. The shower was awesome and spacious but no tub if that is important to you. One negative was the valet parking... we left Sunday at checkout time and it took aboout 15 minutes (maybe longer) to get our car. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding, ooh rah!”
Reviews.Author: robertemoreno
Reviews.Content: this is the first time staying at this hotel and can not say anything bad about it, being in the miltitary i was treated very well. all the staff there was very helpful in answering my question no matter how silly they were. once again i like to thank everyone at the hard rock hotel in San Deigo for making this Marine very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: relaxingone
Reviews.Content: We had the best time. The staff was very friendly and made us feel welcomed. Rooms were very modern but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mix of fun, excitement, and rest!”
Reviews.Author: AddieMurdock
Reviews.Content: Our room was just right, the service was excellent, and the experience wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: KBizzle14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego for a Bachelorette Party. In addition to having an amazing time because I was with my closest friends, the rooms and staff at the Hard Rock were top notch. Rooms: the double shower head was amazing. The beds were incredibly comfortable. We had an incredible view of the pool and the Amazing Race Wedding. The Staff: Every person we encountered was sincere, courteous, and over the top accommodating. I would definitely recommend the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego to anyone looking for an upscale, hop place to stay in downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I like being Rock Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: kjekramer
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Hard Rock Hotel for a bachelorette party with a group of friends. From the minute we walked into the VIP green room, we were treated like rock royalty. Checking in while having a cocktail started the weekend off right. The service was great and the room had a uniquely cool feel. I will definitely come back to HRH again and bring my friends. The only negative thing I would say, is that I had to pay $70 for overnight valet parking (2 nights) and thought that was a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar accomodations!! I'll be staying here EVERYTIME!”
Reviews.Author: Waaooo
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, I have stayed in many a hotel, but I have to admit that my stay at the Hard Rock SD was one of the best stays that I have had. I came with a few friends and from the moment we entered, we were treated with amazing service. The hospitality was great, room service was fast and very friendly and fun, and the pool area and bar service was exceptional. We were able to access the green room and the service there was incredible. It was a nice lounge to take a break away from the craziness with very friendly and accommodating staff. Amanda and Eli 'served' us and they were some of the most friendly people I have met and made my stay at the Hard Rock one I will never forget. I also got a chance to go to the Spa. It was relaxing and the service I had done was flawless. I believe the woman's name was Christina? She was great!!! Thank you for a great time! I will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: MrsDodge79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. The atmosphere was fun and upbeat. I was able to book a suite. Because I was there in business, I was not able to take advantage of the spa, but judging from the rest of the place, I can only imagine how great it is. Every employee I encountered was pleasant and went over and above and seemed to throughly enjoy their jobs. I was able to check out Float (the pool bar) and loved it! It was a great place to relax on a weeknight and take in the fresh air. My only complaint was the fact that there really was no desk to work at, but I don't believe that they are really aiming at the business traveler. I was able for a short time to work at the couch with the coffee table pulled closer. We ate at Mary Jane's every morning and loved it! Room service was fast and the food was great. The only other thing I can say is location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “The best place I have ever stayed in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru_100_100
Reviews.Content: First, the location is perfect. It’s across the street from the convention center, and at the beginning of the Gaslamp District. You have the best restaurants, bars and shopping area all in walking distance. The hotel is very chic-modern, from the moment you get to the lobby, to the rooms upstairs. The service (hotel personal) is excellent ! Very friendly and professional. When it comes to food, you have the best of both worlds. Starting with a modern twist to the classic dinner, but with great quality food at decent prices. Then you have your upscale restaurant (what i consider the best in sushi anywhere)...Nobu !! An elegant, but nice place to hang out at the bar, or eat good food. To top it off, you also have a pinkberrry (if you don't know what that is, well, where have you been living ? LOL). If you like the night life, it has a bar/club downstairs at the lobby; or the rooftop bar/lounge. Both places seem to be the place to be at in San Diego. There were long lines outside just to get in ! I also spent a couple ours at the Spa. WOW...it was relaxing. They also have the pool upstairs. Its more of hang out for a young crowd, but there were still kids playing around. Now the room...well, it’s not the typical hotel. Very boutique hotel….comfortable, luxurious, and modern ! Hard to explain, but you can see the pictures of there website. Overall the place was perfect…and so was my stay !!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: g_lattie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, services were excellent and staff are friendly and always show concern for the guest.

Reviews.Title: “NICE hotel and great service but FILLED with drunk young people... would you expect anything else though?”
Reviews.Author: Momof3letmebee
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a long weekend at the Hard Rock San Diego. Let me say that this is a top notch hotel... the hotel is very modern, the rooms are very nice, the staff is well trained and extremely helpful and polite. Everyone (with the exception of one Valet- who was an idiot) was great. The staff is very young so it is impressive that the service was so above standard... it renews your faith in the younger generation in some ways. Having said that, as a family of five with children under 12, we'd probably never go back here. We stayed at this hotel because we had a room there free of charge through an art auction company who was holding an event at the hotel. The hotel is filled with young drunk people 24/7. I will say they've insulated the walls very well because other than hearing them come down the corridors, we heard nothing from the adjacent rooms even though there were 20+ people going in and out at all hours. I'm not sure what happened in one of the elevators on Saturday night, but on Sunday they had stationed an elevator attendant on each lift because of an "issue" that took place the night before. I'm happy the hotel responded appropriately to whatever that event was and took steps to correct it by staffing the elevator... but weren't surprised there was an event given the large number of young partiers staying at the hotel. If I were 20 years younger (I'm 42) this would be the place I want to be, but I'm too old to worry about getting puked on or bashed into by someone unable to walk without assistance. Sigh. Despite the fact that we are not the target demographic here... I have to say that overall we had a very good experience. The staff treated us great even though they were probably completely confused as to why we were staying there with 3 kids. The pool was a bar scene from about mid day well into the night but despite that, the security staff went out of their way (A gentleman named Alaska in particular) to make us feel welcome and specifically told us if anyone had "any problems" with the kids there swimming to just let him know and he would "take care of it." We felt welcome and were treated very well by the staff- I can't say it enough, the staff really is well trained and did a great job throughout our stay. The hotel location is the BEST we've ever had in San Diego. You are a city block from Petco Park, across the street from the Convention Center and on the corner of the start of the Gaslamp district. There are a lot of homeless around and quite a lot of unsavory types... I've been to NYC and DC and couldn't believe how much cleaner and safer those cities were compared to downtown San Diego. (That is a city of San Diego issue, not a Hard Rock hotel issue, however.) City of San Diego needs to do a better job with getting uniformed officers on the street down there... tons of cops in cars, but they need them on bikes/horseback/foot like the other big cities do to really police that area better. (We had no problems, however, there was a random shooting--husband shot his wife- in the gaslamp quarter six blocks from the hotel in broad daylight the weekend we were there. Also- the coceierge at the hotel adamantly advised against riding the SD trolley light rail near or after nightfall.... it just isn't safe, she said.) Our first room had a window looking out toward the convention center. We moved to a slightly larger room for $30 more which had a sliding glass door with a rail (not really a balcony, but you could open the sliders and look out) and the room was MUCH nicer with a small sitting area, couch and two TVs rather than one. Pay the $30 more for the room with the sliding glass door... it is nice to take in the city and well worth the money for the updgrade. Food: The food at Nobu was gross... how does anyone eat there? The breakfast at Maryjanes was good but VERY expensive. Room service was also pricey, but good food and we were hungry so no complaints there. Overall- we enjoyed our stay but I would only recc this hotel to someone single and under 35 looking to drink, party and meet people.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed ... and not sure why”
Reviews.Author: GreedyIan
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something special from this hotel and it just didn't deliver. The room was okay - nice tv, ipod docking station, small bar to drink the $40(!!!) vodka or munch the $4(!!!) chocolate bars. My room was on a lower floor overlooking the street, which although not of the harbour, the view was a good street view with large windows. But was the room better than a Sofitel or Westin or equivalent? The answer is no, just smaller if anything with no bath. The hotel tries so hard to be trendy it fails - the downstairs bar is just full of suits straight from the conference centre across the road, the restaurants are overpriced (and except Nobu have no reason to be), the spa is (yet again) very expensive. Location is perfect, valet parking is expensive, internet (if not in your room rate) is very expensive. The resort fee adds to the price ($17 a night for what?). I like nice things and don't mind and can afford to pay, but I like to feel like there is value for money - which this hotel does not provide. The Gaslamp district has an array of restaurants and nightlife and entertainment a lot more entertaining and better value than this hotel provides.

Reviews.Title: “Class-act, customer oriented, and just great!”
Reviews.Author: OCBusinessTraveler
Reviews.Content: Well, kudos to Amanda for making it right. The Hard Rock Hotel San Diego is a very desirable, but a little pricey hotel to stay for business or leisure. Everything was above my expectations. However, I was left with a bad taste in my mouth with their $17 "IN FEE" which covers in-room internet, the gym use, and the business center. I wasn't told about the "IN FEE", so I felt that it was sorta sneaky to just pad it in your folio. I left a very positive review about my stay, but shared my concern about this "IN FEE", and didn't really expect to hear back from anyone. But I was wrong. Amanda Hess, their Rock Royalty Manager emailed me, and when I told her the details, she credited the amount. Kudos to how a hotel should be run. I've been a life-long Marriott customer, and will now look at The Hard Rock before defaulting to the Marriott properties. I would highly recommend The Hard Rock Hotel San Diego, as they go above and beyond any measure to satisfy their customers. As a first time customer, they've earned my business for the foreseeable future! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anaducks
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great we stayed in one of the suites very roomy and clean. But make sure when you check into your room you check for any damages and report any that you see right away. When we got into our room I noticed a hole in one of the lamp shades I did not report it and was charged for the damage.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!...Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: TopNotch415
Reviews.Content: I want to thank you for the excellent service I received during my recent visit to your San Diego property last month. I will reccommend Hard Rock to all my friends and colleagues!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: gotz_to_travel
Reviews.Content: I have family in the hotel business and they recommended the Hard Rock San Diego. And man, were they right! The Hard Rock is a fabulous hotel, in a great location with a fun and exciting vibe. Even on an otherwise quiet Sunday afternoon, the music was pumping at the poolside bar and the staff was fun and friendly. It is at the entrance to the Gaslamp District and i found many great stores and restaurants easily accessible by foot. I was even able to squeeze in a workout at their state of the art gym (adjacent to the spa) before leaving. I will most certainly be staying there again on my next trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for two nights in April 2011. The suite was clean and functioned well but seemed a bit small compared to the description. The only issue was noise. My room faced the pool/nightclub area that comes alive on Friday night. This made it hard to rest until 2am. I guess that it is to be expected when "Rock" is in the name of the hotel! Great location and we loved having NOBU for sushi right in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities. Top-notch staff. Great food. Some trashy clientele.”
Reviews.Author: biker_dan
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Hard Rock San Diego. The conference facilities (for that matter, all of the hotel I saw) are attractive and flawlessly maintained. The rock memorabilia made wandering the hallways an adventure. Our conference lunches were served in the Woodstock outdoor space. Food, service and location were excellent. On Sunday, our conference registration coincided with the Sunday Intervention party. Because of this, the hotel was full of security staff. All of the security people I encountered were very polite and some were downright entertaining. All staff I talked to were polite and professional. The downside of the Sunday Intervention? The clientele. Large group of attractive, young, inebriated, loud, foul-mouthed young adults. One of my coworkers described it as Jersey Shore West. To the hotel’s credit, they kept the revelers away from our conference area, although you could hear the music and loud people everywhere on the lower floors. Overall, a flawless place for a conference. Just stay away on Sunday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with rockin' service!”
Reviews.Author: NEBowen
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great ambiance and staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly. Always willing to lend a helping hand. We ate at Maryjanes for breakfast every moring, and every morning the staff went above and beyond, by making our 17 month old daughter special pancakes with mouse ears! After checking in we walked to Petco park and caught a baseball game! This was our 2nd time staying at the Hard Rock and it will be the ONLY place we stay when we come to San Diego!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: nikkia_77
Reviews.Content: I had an awful time at this hotel. The Valet dropped my key in the street and almost lost it , I found it and the parking is 35 dollars per night and there is no self parking. The spa was terrible, I booked my trip with the spa manager and it was poorly planned for by the manager, The massage therapist called in sick on one of my friends treatments and they called my home phone to let us know she could get a facial instead. an hour and a half before the treatment ( We never got the call since we had a 5 hour drive to san diego and we were already at the hotel . They did not offer discount or anything for the inconvenience until we complained to a manager I was handed toilet paper to put in the bathroom myself. We had to use the mens locker room because there wasn't enough room in the women's locker room. The treatments were less than mediocre for the price that it is I expected more! The pool was newly renovated and we were promised that it would be open and it was closed for 2 hours which was during the time period that we were able to use it cause we had our spa treatments when it was supposed to open.Then the security at the club was extremely rude and lied about his name when we asked him. We paid money to stay in a very nice hotel and expected to be treated a whole lot better than we were. When we called a manager to complain about the security we were told that there are 2 sides to the story and given a complimentary drink to solve the problem and my friend was stating that this is the worst hotel she's ever stayed at and another lady walking by said I agree.The staff was unfriendly with the exception of the bell service. The worst part is after the whole experience I complained to the manager and all he could do is send me a form letter and offer an upgrade if I choose to return. When I complained about the form letter all he can say is sorry you feel that way. Talk about poor customer service! I will make it my goal to let everyone know that this was The Worst Hotel I've Ever stayed at and worst customer service I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: sborenstein
Reviews.Content: We brought our 15 mo baby nervously but the room and hotel,mid week, was quiet, clean, and safe. The staff was helpful and very friendly. We stayed in a king suite and had plenty of room. to avoid charges we brought our own pack n play and microwave. But they can provide them on request. strongly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLP1989
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights April 25 to 29, 2011. The hotel is located in great location, close to everything. San Diego is so easy to get around. I would highly recommend renting a vehicle. The hotel has a big name to live up to. The room was a nice size, but awkwardly set up. The bed was really comfortable. The room lacked amenities like enough towels, no bathrobes, no dresser to unpack my clothes. The valet parking was $35 a night, which is a little outrageous. However, the service was good and our car was always brought to us quickly when we needed it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: MalibuDep
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Woodstock suite. Beautiful room with a great balcony overlooking both the pool and Gaslamp Quarter. Service was impeccable. Ate 3 times at Maryjanes. Food is terrific. The rooms are very comfortable and spotless. This is one of my top 3 favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel San Diego, simply rocks.”
Reviews.Author: kimbo182
Reviews.Content: I attend many events but by far my favorite place to work and play is the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego. Not only is it the most well-designed property it also provides the ultimate experience for its guests. Every guest is treated like a Rock Star throughout this property and there is something for everyone. I will only stay at the Hard Rock in San Diego for business and/or pleasure, really it is the only place to be. Try Nobu for the most amazing sushi, or Mary Jane's with its Rock Star portions or my fav, the downstairs bar at Float.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: flygirl35838
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and I have to say that this hotel rates as one of the best overall experiences I have ever had. Every staff person I had any contact with was wonderful - courteous, helpful and went out of their way to make my stay perfect. My room was immaculate and beautifully appointed. A perfect location - within walking distance to numerous outstanding restaurants, parks, shopping, etc. etc. No need to have a car. I can't say enough about my stay - I love music and this hotel with it's emphasis on all music genre -- was, well, just fun!

Reviews.Title: “This place "Rocks"...”
Reviews.Author: Jesse-Dena
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right in the mix of all the Gaslamp District has to offer. Early check-in was a breeze. It literally took about 90 seconds. I think it took longer for us to decide what kind of music we wanted playing when we walked into our room. (They program the music from the front desk - nice touch). The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly/helpful - especially the concierge crew. They were able to give us several discount coupons for the area attractions and made some great recommendations for things to do. Mary Jane's (one of the restaurants onsite) has killer breakfast. No complaints about Hard Rock at all. We'll definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: lindag1023
Reviews.Content: We had amazing service during our entire stay. We met 4 exceptional staff members - Juan, Katie, Fish & Mike - these folks were personable, professional & added to our overall experience. My husband & I loved our room - we have never slept so good on vacation! And the shower set-up was awesome. We woke up every morning and used the fitness equipment , beautiful state-of-the art machines! The entire facility is immaculate and well maintained, obviously well managed!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to get any sleep, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Amille112
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and the beds were comfortable but I didn't get any sleep in them. The club music and patrons are so loud you could hear the music in our 7th floor room. We called for a room change and received attitude in return. We almost missed our early morning flight after 3 days of barely sleeping at night, I even bought earplugs that were no match for the music. Also after a night of tossing and turning if you don't remember to put the "Do not disturb" sign on your door, the maids come knocking at 7:30am. Don't stay here if you're expecting relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: michaelh6580
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in San Diego, this is THE place to stay. The rooms are beautiful - we stayed in a king suite. We were on the top floor with a full balcony that overlooked the Gaslamp District and PETCO Park. Our room was incredibly clean, comfortable, and spacious. They even had our favorite music playing as we entered. Our intent was to explore the Gaslamp District, but we ended up never leaving the hotel. Stop by Float for a beautiful rooftop experience and look for Fish - he's the guy that sounds like Tone Loc (need I say more?). Nobu was incredible for sushi and has an excellent happy hour. 207 is a great place for drinks and if you need a late night snack, be sure to check out Maryjane - the burgers are AWESOME. We would definitely stay here again. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful - they made us feel like rock stars. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The right place if you are young and energetic”
Reviews.Author: ukjingai
