Rooms are fantastic and comfortable at the same time. if you are into the nightlife there are tons of options as well. I was there for a charity event. The event staff from the Hard Rock provided a classy atmosphere and the same service I have received at very upscale destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: caligirlt1
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very friendly and prompt. The room atmosphere was very welcoming and amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a letdown, but I would give it another try”
Reviews.Author: serenityseekerFL
Reviews.Content: SO, I should start out by saying that I stayed at the hotel immediately next door to this several years ago, and I found myself spending my evenings in the Hard Rock bar wishing that I was staying at this place. I had stayed in the Hard Rock Tampa before and had adored the experience so I had a lot of high hopes for this trip. While the rooms were well furnished, I found the general decor to be very dark and did not make me feel welcome in my room. Also, the chair, while cool in design was abysmal in function. Some the things in the snack bar had been there for ages, firmly coated in dust. There were many good things about the hotel. The food was pretty good and given is sufficient quantity (though I would not recommend either the cinnamon vanilla french toast or the hashbrowns). The room service was quick and the staff was very friendly! The quality of bath products that were supplied was very good. The bed was fine and had plenty of pillows! The shower was spectacular and soothing with great acoustics for those who want to rock out while you are in the shower. The nicest part of the stay was the fact that they take you to the airport in a towncar for $15...slightly cheaper than a taxi and much more pleasant. So, I was not entirely disappointed with the hotel, it just was not the hotel I expected given my previous experience with Hard Rock Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “This place absolutely rocks!”
Reviews.Author: mf90230
Reviews.Content: From the moment that you arrive the staff is professional, genuinely pleased to see you, and exceptionally friendly. The rooms are beautifully designed, spacious, and comfortable. I would highly recommend staying at the Hard Rock in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock San Diego Really Does Rock!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer064
Reviews.Content: So many great things about this hotel. . .it's close enough to the airport to be a super cheap cab ride and it's right on the edge of the Gas Lamp so shopping and restaurant options are everywhere. The rooms are just funky enough to feel cool, but not uncomfortable -- in fact the beds gave me one of the best night's sleep I've had in a while. But what really set this hotel apart for me was the service. I'm on the road 60-100 days a year. The service provided by absolutely everyone at this hotel was exponentially better than I've experienced anywhere! The staff functioned as a team, and everyone's can-do attitude helped anticipate and avoid problems, as well as come up with great solutions to any concerns. Try a burger at MaryJane's and have a beverage at Float. Fun, funky, memorable, and definitely a place I'd go back to in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: hollyberrym
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel - the people were great, the service was great, our room was outstanding (the Black Eyed Peas Suite) and the food spectacular. It was a perfect location. I wanted to give a particular shout out to Robbie, the concierge. Every restaurant he recommended was a 10 and he even shipped wine back for us that we got in Temecula. It was one of our best getaways ever.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock hotel was definitely one of the better hotels that I have EVER stayed”
Reviews.Author: Michaeldlt67
Reviews.Content: The idea of having a high end, quality hotel, with great service and remarkable amenities, interlaced with a perfect bar/club in the lobby, there is truly nothing to say but good things about the Hard Rock hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel -San Diego would be my choice of stay for visits to the West coast.”
Reviews.Author: blehew
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled when I walked into my room. The room was trendy and comfortable and the view - was spectacular! The ability to open the lower portion of the window to hear the street traffic and get fresh area was a pleasant surprise. The food - both room service and at Mary Jane's was tasty and affordable. Oh, and the huge cookies provided at one of the breaks were delicious! I would look forward to another stay at Hard Rock if I am ever in the San Diego area again.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Rob987654
Reviews.Content: Great room, great service, awesome location. Meeting at the convention center and it was so convenient. Took my wife and we truly loved the environment at the hotel. Made for a hard rockin' time.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a rock star..treated like a celeb”
Reviews.Author: Fann_12
Reviews.Content: What an awesome time! From the moment we checked in the experience was great. Every member of the Hard Rock team genuinely made us feel welcome and special. Rain in SoCal...didn't dampen our stay in the least. The hotel had everything needed for our stay, great location, relaxing spa, comfy room, tasty dishes at Mary Jane's and of course a great choice of adult beverages at 207 - most important was the fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SharAs_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hard Rock for the weekend. It was a nice stay. We were able to check in when we arrived at 7:00am, which was AWESOME. We were asked about where we wanted to be in the hotel and that was very spectacular. The staff were nice and considerate. I will stay at Hard Rock again. I loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, but the hotel was just average for us”
Reviews.Author: BobGParkCity_UtahUSA
Reviews.Content: Really great service in a great part of SD, but the hotel was just average for me. It seemed dark and loud and It just was not the right fit for me.

Reviews.Title: “It rocked”
Reviews.Author: mcstock
Reviews.Content: Great check in, great people, great music. The total experience rocked. Loved the atmosphere, loved the quiet in the hall at night. I slept when I needed to, I worked when I needed to, and I partied when I wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “A Hip and Unique experience!”
Reviews.Author: Melvino
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock in San Diego is a happening place in a great location. It's location is right on the Gas Lamp; close to restaurants, bars and night clubs. It has a very unique ambiance. The customer service was excellent; everyone cared! A must place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,helpful staff and relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: niall2108
Reviews.Content: A different style of hotel, using a modern approach focussing on music and musical memorabilia for which the Hard Rock Cafes are well known. The ambience is energetic but not too much "in your face". The rooms were spacious, modern and well equipped with a variety of musical channels available. The location at the bottom of the Gas Lamp district and close to the Convention Centre is ideal for the business traveller yet relaxed enough and close to the nightlife for the pleasure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Staff make the difference!”
Reviews.Author: Judy_K97213
Reviews.Content: All amenities are pretty standard for any nice hotel, but staff are outstanding! Every Hard Rock Hotel employee that I met was cheerful, friendly and helpful. Those I did business with were exceptionally caring and interested in making sure my needs were met and that my experience was top rate. I train people in customer service so I know how hard it is to find and keep staff who are sincere and talented - but HR/San Diego has done their work so well that I'm delighted and impressed, and very pleased with my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at great hotel”
Reviews.Author: m_erdmann
Reviews.Content: Ideal for fun weekends in San Diego - perfect location, vibrant bars, very nice rooms and hotel has great amenities included gym, pool, and a great variety of restaurants..

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock made our trip rock!!”
Reviews.Author: mommy1013
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to San Diego for a business trip. The conference was at the hotel so I was able to stay at the hotel as well. The service was very good. They were worried about our wait at registration that we were upgraded to a suite!! During the conference the staff was very friendly and made sure our needs were taken care of. Every evening I went up to the room and it was always cleaned. They made our experience rock!! This hotel is in a great location for individuals who like to have fun. There were plenty of clubs, restuarants and shopping places. One suggestion if you are driving..Valet service was expensive. There is a public parking deck next door. Paying $13 versus $35 was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, overated”
Reviews.Author: Dennisrw22
Reviews.Content: Booked for 25th wedding anniversary. Up graded from a studio to a larger room. A very ordinary room for what we paid. Mood lighting was dark, hard for wife to put make-up on. Hallways too dark. For the $211.00 internet price, $30. upgrade and $34.00 per night to park, I probably could have stayed at the Hotel Del. Disappointing. There is nothing special about this hotel. Yes the service was very good. Wouldn't recommend. Also close to train yard- freight trains blowing their horns all night. Don't stay at this hotel if the Padres are playing next door. Traffic bad-also the $34 parking per night.

Reviews.Title: “felt like a rockstar!”
Reviews.Author: iluvkb24
Reviews.Content: Had to go to San Diego to attend a conference. Decided to make a weekend out of it. Definitely had a great time there. Loved the room and location. Had a couple of drinks at bar 207. Best part: the view of the pool from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service !!!”
Reviews.Author: j0hnnym10
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I had a great stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego. the staff was outstanding !!! We travel extensively, and were blown away by the attention to detail, quality of service and overall atmosphere and vibe. I will definitely send friends and family to hard Rock Hotel San Diego !!!

Reviews.Title: “Greet Meeting Facilities, Remarkably Friendly Staff, and FABULOUS Location too!”
Reviews.Author: RipplesGuy
Reviews.Content: I confess I was a bit nervous when I learned the location of the conference I was scheduled to attend: Hard Rock Hotel just sounded really loud and sure enough there was music playing in the lobbies and elevator waiting areas. Instead of garish decor with a "loud party" atmosphere, I was delighted to experience this as a cozy boutique hotel that is across the street from the convention center (other hotels in the area are the typical monstrosities found near large convention centers). In addition to easy access to the convention center, this property is located at the entrance to the historic and hip gaslight district which San Diego is well known for. So many restaurants to choose from within a few blocks, and plenty of shopping as well. I could see into Petco Field (home of the San Diego Padres) from my room, and I can imagine that game days might impact the ambiance, but I was thrilled with the area around the hotel. MaryJane's Cafe, located in the hotel, was a fun and funky place to grab a quick bite ($4,.20 burgers on Wednesdays after 4:20pm!), and I heard great things about the other eating establishments. (I hopped up the block to the Broken Yolk both mornings for UHMAZING breakfasts and ginormous diet Coke's). The front line staff were super friendly and helpful (I was up at 4am both mornings because I'm from the midwest, and the late night shift cleaning the floors were as good about making eye contact and greeting me with a warm hello as the desk staff and bell stand staff. Exceptional. I also had some interactions with management, and they were just over the top. Fitness center had 4 treadmills, 3 ellipticals and several weight-training machines. And it was available 24 hours (great for us folks from the midwest and east coast who are up insanely early!!). I would not have thought I'd be the kind of guy to stay at a Hard Rock Hotel, but I'll be back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a business conference.”
Reviews.Author: JLHaynes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for the first time for a business conference. The hotel staff was very efficient, food was excellent, the bed was comfortable and the bar at the pool on the roof was excellent. I heard one conversation of having a bit of noise from being over the first floor bar and I had to be quiet because I was down there having a good time with some others. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Gaslamp and Conv Center Locale”
Reviews.Author: JasminedogLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights to attend a conference at the SD Convention Center. The Hard Rock is probably the best situated boutique hotel nearest the main entrance to the Convention Center. It is at the entrance to the Gaslamp district with all of the restaurants in close proximity to the hotel. Check in and check out was professional and personal. Staff are young, friendly and put the guest first. My king bed room was compact but nicely furnished with a platform bed, innovative wet bar with 2 bar stools, a flat screen TV embedded in the customized desk, and a spacious bathroom with shower (but no tub). My room overlooked the lobby canopy and faced the convention center. Hallways were dark brown, lit by flourescent lights and seemed cheap compared to the room furnishings. The small rooftop pool was sufficient for laps and was surrounded by about 8 queensized loungers for sunning. The small pool deck was adjacent to the bar making this area very loud with music, drinking and socializing. Not really an environment for family kiddie play on weekends. The gym was decent in size and had a variety of aerobic and weight machines. Guests could access the sauna inside the Spa but only by paying a fee and only when the Spa was open. The hotel and Gaslamp district in general are party central on weekends, so those wanting to sleep early best avoid the area. The ballpark is about a block away and makes for a busy and active place on game days. Plenty of bars and restaurants in the area, and public light rail line stops in front of the lobby entrance. Overall if you are an adult single or couple, then this is a highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This one of the BEST hotel experiences of my life!”
Reviews.Author: JasmineAlexis
Reviews.Content: The moment we pulled up, the staff was very attentive at curbside. The entire staff was amazing and very helpful. We truly enjoyed our room as well. I didnt want to get out the bed to do anything it was comfortable. The two night clubs were great as well because it gave us options! HARD ROCK HOTEL in San Diego is awesome and will recommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great service, but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: NHL25
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with exceptional service, but the noise level is too high. There is a night club on the first floor that plays music at a very high volume. The crowds attending the club are very load outside the club and when they return to their rooms at all hours. There is a train is just across the street and it goes by several times a night blowing the horn each time. I like the hotel, but will not stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Service was impeccable”
Reviews.Author: Xisor
Reviews.Content: The ViP and Green Room service was awesome. Above and beyond. Christian made me feel extremely welcome and attended to everything quickly. Frankly, I was caught off guard with such high quality service. I have raved about this experience to friends across the country. Thank you Christian and The Hard Rock of San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great European Vibe and Super Chic”
Reviews.Author: flounder73
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel SD was amazing. It's located in a great downtown location close to the convention center, petco park, gaslamp district, and shopping. Check-in was great. The young lady was very courteous and even better she was able to set the music genre that would be playing when I got to my room (Classic Rock baby!). As an added bonus, I was given a code for 10 free iTunes downloads...Rock On! The main hotel areas are very clean with lots of song lyrics from artists posted on the walls as well as music memorabilia in display cases. The elevator, to my suprise, was key card access so that you couldn't go up to the guest rooms without a key. Now the pièce de résistance was the room. Very chic/european styled room with lots of great little Hard Rock touches including a pillowcase with a guitar embroidered on it. As I mentioned before, classic rock was playing through the TV which was integrated into a great modern entertainment center with from AV jacks to hook up whatever your heart desired to the TV. The most impressive thing about the room was the bathroom. Not only was is super swanky with a glass enclosed stand up shower with 2 heads (rain, regular), it had to have been the cleanest hotel bathroom I've ever set foot in. All the glass for the shower enclosure was spotless...WOW! The bars downstairs serve up any drink you desire...but you should definitely try the raspberry mojito. All in all it was a great stay and I only wish I could have stayed longer. I highly recommend staying there if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Rockstar Experience”
Reviews.Author: ColinJManning
Reviews.Content: Every last detail at the Hard Rock was amazing!! From the initial check in, to the bars and restaurants, to the amenities in the room, to our fast and easy check out, every detail was superbly executed. Coming back in 3 months with 5 more couples and cant wait to indulge in everything Hard Rock once again!!

Reviews.Title: “From the first warm greeting to the check-out goodbye, this experience rocked.”
Reviews.Author: jwereley
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego was one of the best hotel stays that I have had. First of all, the staff was very friendly, genuine, fun and always ready to serve. For example, when I needed help with getting rental car information, the gentleman at the service desk gladly helped me even though there were about 10 others needing help at the same time. I still felt like I was getting special service. Secondly, the whole hotel facility was great. The rooms were well decorated. I loved how they played the music of our choice in our rooms. The hotel really did revolve around the same theme; Rock. I was at the hotel on business with my company and we used their conference facilities and also enjoyed their food service. The servers were very friendly and the food was amazing. Overall, my whole stay at Hard Rock Hotel was spectacular and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in really the nicest suite in my...”
Reviews.Author: spilkyca
Reviews.Content: Stayed in really the nicest suite in my life. Rockstar suite 702 has a huge wrap around patio deck that looks directly into both the pool and club. I had some issues with the tv working on he boze sound system. The shower was amazing, water comes horizontally and from all sides, jacuzzi tub lights up and was

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a rockstar”
Reviews.Author: karlalopez
Reviews.Content: Great location, the convention center is across the street. Shining clean, quiet, nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Even I felt cool at Hard Rock San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ShoelessJeff
Reviews.Content: This is a review based on my one night business stay at the Hard Rock. As I always do I have broken my review down into the Great, Good, Bad, and Ugly. I will also offer some bottom line-type comments. Ready? Here goes . . . GREAT * DESIGN - okay, the design environment of the Hard Rock San Diego (henceforth referred to as HRSD) is very 'manufactured' and we know it but this hotel is an excellent mix of chic and sophistication where business people, partiers, and vacationers blend seemlessly - nobody feeling out of place. I loved the giant screen backdrop to the registration counters as well as the unique design of the rooms - backlit trim and unique furniture and bar designs help make an otherwise standard footprint room unique. This holds true to the rest of the building and common areas as well - dramatic lighting, 3D prominent song lyric quotes, and eclectic design all mean that you will remember the HRSD long after your stay. * LOCATION - Whether you are in town for a trade show or to have fun, go ahead . . . just TRY to top this location. The hotel is just across the street from the convention center on one side, and almost under the iconic arch that signals the beginning of the gaslamp main drag on the other. And to yet another side . . . you are a pop fly's distance from Petco Park. GOOD * TEMPERATURE / SOUND - I mentioned the unique design of the rooms. But, that's not all. I found the room temperature controls to be excellent while running more quietly than most. And . . . I had to unfortunately participate in an impromtu conference call from my room in the early a.m. and found the room to be highly sound proof. I didn't hear toilets or TVs from other rooms and nobody had to hear me talking about TPS reports and mission statements from their room. * SHOWER - The shower was fantastic with two dual-angle shower heads. Use either or both. * SERVICE - As noted, the hotel's chic design is all very manufactured. But, the HRSD is NOT just a mediocre hotel dressed up with a 'gimmick' . . . I still found this to be a highly effective business class hotel with excellent service, friendly staff, and a great business center. And, you won't feel 'price gouged' here either. They offer free internet access in-room and in the business center - this really saved me with that conference call I had to take part in. BAD (room for improvement) * ACCESS - The check in / out times of 4 pm / 11 am seem a tad restrictive to a HRSD guest who may be just trying to enjoy a few days of leisure. In most cases where I encounter late check-in times, I have been able to check in early but that was not the case at the HRSD - and it looked like they were far from booked in-full. The front desk person(s) did offer to call me via cell when they had a room ready so this may have been an isolated incident. * LIGHTING - While the room's illumination options are multiple - and very cool - even with all going to once you may find the room poorly lit at night. They do offer a cool bed backboard flexible snake light for late reading. UGLY * Based on the great location at the foot of the gaslamp district you may hear some drunken revelry and the occasional crackling police p.a. in the small hours. Of course, if you're one of those drunken revelers this shouldn't bother you. BOTTOM LINE * You will not regret your decision to stay at the HRSD - the overwhelmingly positive reviews here in a negative world speak volumes. * As a guitar player, I love to see all of those artist-signed and used axes. That and the hotel stylings make the HRSD a nice departure from the hotel norm. * The most important hotel review question is this - "in a similar circumstance, would I stay there again?" - that is an easy 'yes' for me. Feel free to contact me with any Q's

Reviews.Title: “This rocks!”
Reviews.Author: rayu66
Reviews.Content: If you think of Hard Rock and a Hotel, this is the place to be. Located great near the famous gaslamp quarter and close to the water and convention center. A highlight is the bar at pool level, espciall at night time with open fires and a really cool atmospehere. The rooms (e had a standard one) could be a bit bigger, the bathroom is big with a huge shower.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed and friendly, but noisy and cold”
Reviews.Author: ECrowther
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a suite on the eve of a conference held at the hotel. Service is friendly and efficient, and the Hard Rock theme is cool, but the decor is very modern and cold (we like a more traditional, warm atmosphere), so the room does not feel at all cozy; there is no tub, just a shower, with tile on the walls and floor of the entire bathroom area that makes it a bit hard and cold; lots of electrical and medical outlets, nice TV/audio equipment, well-appointed. The PROBLEM: while the windows are thick and entirely blocked out all noise from the game at the stadium right outside our window, noise within the building carries right into your room - voices, doors, etc. - and there is a loud fan over the toilet that you cannot turn off and is a bit annoying. This hotel must be fun for those who want the Hard Rock experience, and I might recommend it to those folks, but it just is not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lhylden
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for both business and pleasure and everytime it is quite enjoyable. They treat everyone like a Rock Star! Just be advised it's insane on Saturday nights, if you're looking for a quiet, relaxing evening, this might not be your best bet. But if you're looking for great nightlife, stay at the Hard Rock! And really fun rooms too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service amazing Security staff”
Reviews.Author: kristinz32
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego but decided to stay downtown for the night. We had service that was above and beyond. We even got free drinks while we were checking in Our room was clean and fun with a great view. The beds were super soft and even had Hard Rock detail on their pillows. The security staff was GREAT!!! They all took care of us. There are 2 things that I didn't like. The main knocked on our door at 8 am. Really?? 8 am at the Hard Rock? WAY to early. The second this was, we got charged for something out of the mini bar. We didn't touch the mini bar. Other than those two issues we had a great stay here and would come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel experience! I can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: colette2003
Reviews.Content: I felt like a rock star from the moment I walked in. The staff was very friendly, the hotel looked amazing, and when we got to the room it exceeded my expectations. We loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Rocked our "Staycation" get-away”
Reviews.Author: lml420
Reviews.Content: I originally booked an overnight Gaslamp birthday evening for my husband at another hotel, but switched at the last minute thinking that my husband would much rather stay at the Hard Rock. It was a longshot, but I called 2 days before our evening and they closely matched my reservation price for a basic room at a hotel a couple blocks away. I went to the hotel at 1:30 (even though check in was at 4) and asked if the room was ready. They told me that it was and when I was asked if I wanted to upgrade our studio room to a suite, I explained it was my husbands birthday and wasnt sure if I could manage the extra expense. They told me that they wanted our weekend to be great, so the upgrade would be a birthday present from them! AWESOME! We were very impressed with the cleanliness and decor of the room and loved the atmosphere. We ate lunch and breakfast the next morning at Mary Janes Diner and both of us enjoyed both meals and are looking forward to going back in the future. We did go to the pool, and there was only room for two on a long couch with no room by the pool or the jacuzzi. The DJ was playing great music and everyone was having a great time. We waited quite a while for someone to come over, but no one ever did. After about 15-20 minutes, we left. Later that evening as we were talking to friends, we were told that it was the last weeekend of "Intervention", and understood that was why it was so crowded. The bed was super comfortable and the flat screens and sound system was really nice. Overall it was a great experience and I would recommend anyone to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego. It is in the heart of the gaslamp and after partying along 5th Ave., we were within walking distance of a number of great bars and clubs. Thanks to the Hard Rock Staff for a great experience and now I look forward to booking a future room in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location right at the start of the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: Leckpennvalley
Reviews.Content: You could walk to the ocean, cruise the Gaslamp or walk to Petco Park. We took a $12 cab ride from the airport and did not need a car at all. Rooms very modern with flat screens, wifi and upgraded ammenities and mini bar contents. Nice large roomy bar connected to the lobby. Drinks were pricey at $7 for a Newcastle but had a nice vibe. Pool was a very cool setting on the 4th floor with huge outdoor couch area near the pool bar and several cabanas around the smaller rectangular pool. Service was top notch and very friendly. No real problems that I can think of. I was there on business but am thinking about taking the wife back for a weekend trip. All in all it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: robertblathan
Reviews.Content: For some fun, I decided to spend my birthday weekend at the Hard Rock in San Diego. I have stayed their multiple times before, and always in the same room, a Hard Rock Silver Suite. The room was great, and the service from the first email informing me of the amenities and staff service I could expect was spectacular. Upon arriving, I was checked in with a complimentary drink to get the party started, and received top-notch service at all of the bars and restaurants in the hotel. I enjoyed the stay so much that I made a reservation for New Year's Eve 2010. I know that if I stay here, there is no doubt my New Year's will be a great party.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel all the way around!”
Reviews.Author: mirandasamona
Reviews.Content: Beds are amazingly comfortable. Great service throughout the entire hotel. Fun atmosphere. Might not be a great hotel for younger children, definitely a party scene by the pool and at night!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to party in SoCal...”
Reviews.Author: TravelHamster
Reviews.Content: This was the best place to base ourselves for 3 days in downtown San Diego. The pool place cranking tunes on the roof all day, drinks are reasonable and theplace is just really cool. Within striking distance of all the best bars and clubs and a really good place to party when you are in San Diego. They got our booking wrong and we only had 1 bed as opposed to 2 but they were straight up with a 2nd bed so that was fine. Food round he pool was pretty terrible but that sums up America (massive generalisation I know but the fried Calamari was terrible!)

Reviews.Title: “Lots of atmosphere-suitable for a pleasure trip”
Reviews.Author: Jan B
Reviews.Content: Expensive but everything was very good. I was traveling for business and got a deal through Petco Park Hotels web site for the first 2 nights. I Had to stay one additional night, and change rooms. That night cost double. For business travelers on a budget strict budget the Comfort Inn Gas Lamp Convention Center is a fantastic value. The hotel restaurants and bar is a bit pricey. I couldn't find any beverage vending machines. It might be because they supply beverages in the room but they are too are expensive. There are no convenient stores in the immediate area. I would definitely stay at the Hard Rock, again, but for pleasure not business. There is no free airport shuttle but a cab one way is about $13.00 not including tip. Not too many of the hotels there have free airport shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock San Diego was an excellent place to have fun in San Diego and experience a bit of everything”
Reviews.Author: KLK14
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at the Hard Rock in San Diego. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful and we enjoyed the hotel, pool and being walking distance to everything. We also enjoyed the fire pits at night near the pool and the great sleeping room.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' time at Intervention, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: SFDa5id
Reviews.Content: I was planning a going away party for a friend who is moving and we picked the Hard Rock for a place to stay and for their Sunday pool party Intervention. The party was amazing, great dancing and everyone in good spirits. The room was perfect as well. Everything was clean when we checked in and the view was onto the pool area. The location is great for going out in the Gaslamp area. The service was beyond compare. The concierge was able to help my friends who hadn't bought tickets in advance to get into the pool party which was sold out. They treated us like rockstars (we're not, we're a bunch of lawyers and engineers). The guests are on the younger side and the atmosphere is about having fun. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend who is looking to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Feel Like a Rock Star”
Reviews.Author: RussianStandard
Reviews.Content: Amazing! Everything was perfect. I arrived very late coming from Vegas by car, so everyone knows how tired I was. The valet parking guy was very friendly - he took out all my luggages. After check-in, we went to the room he explained all the stuff starting by where is the ice machine to how to use the entertaiment system and in-room service. Already now I felt very comfortable here. Unfortunately after one day my TV wasn't working anymore. I left a message at front desk and went out for dinner. During my absence they tried to solve the problem but it didn't work. Next morning, I talked to the front desk and there offer me to move my room. Due to Labor Day the hotel was fully booked and I got a suite. Just great - that's a great service. On weekends it's very crowded, but that's what I like. Some big parties on pool level and clubbing in 207. My room was clean and modern whit a great view, overlooking the pool and gaslamp quarter.

Reviews.Title: “My kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: jicabo
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better location in downtown San Diego than the Hard Rock Hotel and if you haven't visited downtown San Diego in a while, it is worth the trip. The HRH is right next door to Petco Park, within walking distance of everything worthy that in the Harbor and the Gaslamp district and also within a short cab ride of the great restaurants in Little Italy or Mission Hills. When there for business on weekdays, I always feel that I am in the true "center" of San Diego when I visit the Hard Rock. When I do stay over on a weekend, I find the propeprty can be a much wilder than weeknights but I don't hesitate to have my 12 year old son join me who loves the whole HRH scene not to mention the big screen TVs in the room and the great room service menu. The service at this hotel is outstanding and I always feel that everyone who works at the HRH goes out of their way to provide excellent service. One recommendation: Ask to stay on the east side of the hotel which is away from the noise near the pool and the entrance. It is much quieter. I learned this early on during one of my visits.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a VIP”
Reviews.Author: pup77v
Reviews.Content: From the time we pulled up to the valet to the time we checked out the staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was in very nice condition, the mini bar was well stocked along with the snack tray. We stayed in a Woodstock suite so we had a nice balcony with a view of the pool and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute best service”
Reviews.Author: Ted1985
Reviews.Content: This place was great. The Float rooms are awesome. Service was great. I would reccommend this place to anybody. The Staff was perfect everything you could want in a Hotel. Room service was fast and friendly. The room was well stocked with Drinks and bed was very comfortable. Decor was great. Awesome televisions with different music that you could put on them. And the sound was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!!”
Reviews.Author: jakeandginger15
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is in a fantastic location right in the middle of the Gaslamp quarter in San Diego - also extremely convenient to the Convention Center. I had a king suite for my 5 night stay and each day it was kept impeccable by their great staff. The room was large, trendy and comfortable. The Hard Rock's team did an excellent job of making us completely at home and taken care of during the stay. All the extra details they put into their rooms and service truly make it stand out from all other hotels. Nobu and Mary Jane's restaurants are not to be missed. Float, the bar out by the pool, is a great time as well. Will definitely recommend and return any time I'm in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Good Service!”
Reviews.Author: LoveBug1013
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted with a very friendly front desk staff member. She was very helpful and was able to get us a room on the top (12th) floor facing the bay. I thought this would be perfect since I read a lot of complaints about noise and figured on the top floor it shouldn’t be as bad. I was wrong, the music could be heard until after 2:00am, and then the noisy drunks were running up and down our hall yelling and being loud until after 2:30am. The noisy drunks, I cannot blame on the hotel, because you will find those at any “party” hotel. I just wish that I would have realized what a party hotel this was before we booked our vacation here. Other then the noise and lack of sleep, this is a very nice hotel. The lobby was clean and open, it felt very welcoming. Our room was very clean and quite spacious. The bathroom was quite large and had a lovely rain shower, however, you must note that the products in our bathroom were not Aveda, that I could tell, they were their Spa brand, again not a complaint, just a note. The hotel is in a great location. We were able to walk up and down the streets in the Gas Lamp district to find shops and restaurants. We also walked to Sea Port Village, about a mile walk, not bad at all. It's also a nice little walk over to the Convention Center and from there you can get to the marina to take the ferry over to Coronado. So, the location really is ideal! I really did enjoy this hotel, but I do not plan on staying here again because when we go on vacation, we want to be on our own time table, not on the hotel’s, meaning, if we want to go to bed at 11pm, then we should be able to, but you cannot do that here, too much bass from their clubs prevent that from happening. I would recommend this hotel to my friend’s who like to party all night, but I would not recommend this hotel to my friend’s who have young children and/or do not like to party all night. I am glad we stayed here, I do not regret it at all. We had a good experience, overall but I am saying I would not recommend this hotel to a friend because we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best anniversary present ever”
Reviews.Author: tstauf
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for my anniversary to surprise my wife and she was surprised and very impressed. Every staff member we dealt with had a positive and warm attitude. The concierge took care of all the requests we had. FLOAT was awesome. The room was very modern and I now have been in the best shower of my life. I will be attempting to build one just like it in the near future. Thanks for great memories and a wonderful weekend Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “A great vibe and limitless options - the heartbeat of Downtown San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Luzerner_Dude
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hard Rock was incredible. It began with a Friday afternoon check-in and quick workout in their state-of-the-art gym. We then had a brilliant sushi dinner downstairs at Nobu, and clubbed the night away at both 207 and Float. Saturday afternoon, it was off for the two minute walk to Petco Park and the Padres vs. Rockies ballgame. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to be spoiled”
Reviews.Author: stormyiz
Reviews.Content: Expect nothing short of exceptional treatment from the moment you arrive at The Hard Rock Hotel San Diego. The valets are fantastic, as are the bellmen...and the front desk staff...I am sure you get the picture. From the time we pulled up until we were settled into our room no more than 15 minutes had passed. We were given all the details on how the room "worked" and then Alex our bellman offered to get us ice from the floor above. I can't say enough about the staff or hotel itself. If you feel like being spoiled for all other hotels in San Diego then a stay here is MUST.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - nice rooms and amenities”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer08
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor, service, and amenities. Nice rooms, reliable WiFi, nice poolside bar. Very nice fitness facilities. The location of the hotel excellent - right at the entrance to the Gaslamp District, and walking distance to the harbor and baseball stadium. The only downside to the location, especially for the noise sensitive, is the very load train that passes by (and whistles) several times during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay with EXCELLENT customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: kennethj67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed EVERY minute of our stay. Customer service was WELL above excellent. Everyone treated us with a smile and helped us with our local activities. Christine was the BEST as she helped us with some really nice places to eat at night and they were on point. We had a suite with a very large balcony that my wife just adored. The only draw back with the room was space to put our clothes and there isn't free parking by the hotel and we had to pay valet $35 a night. Other than that I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Rockin Birthday Trip and Hotel Stay EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Roger40_10
Reviews.Content: The very first thing I noticed was the ease of access to the Hotel. I drove right in front and was greeted by friendly and smiling valet service. The buildings location, decorum, proximity to fine dining and events facilities was PERFECT. Petco park, The Convention Center and the Gaslamp District were all visible and walking distance from the Hard Rock Hotel. The staff was enthusiastic, courteous and very helpful. Check-in and out was a snap! Wake-up calls were on time and the technology and services on-sight were above and beyond expectations. All in all I would highly recommend this Hotel to all my friends and family. LOVE IT! LIVE IT! HARD ROCK IT!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of Vegas in Downtown San Diego!!!”
Reviews.Author: pico1973
Reviews.Content: An upscale hotel in downtown district that gives you the feel that you are in Vegas and ready to live up the night life. Very friendly staff ready to help you in any part of the hotel. I was impressed by the choice of music you get to choose as you walk into the your room. At night this hotel transforms to the place to be for all party people. Great restaurants, bars, and night clubs. I would recommend visiting Float a roof top bar with a great view of downtown and fresh air. A great place to stay and party like a rock star!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for us, location fab, staff v helpful”
Reviews.Author: v777
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with 2 teenage children, all loved it. Great experience and will def do hard rock hotels again!

Reviews.Title: “"Rockin" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigAlFromSoCal
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Well appointed rooms with great styling. Booked a room that put us on the rooftop next to the pool and bar with our own patio and two sofas. Great room and great location. If you're looking for a fun place in Gas Lamp, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock San Diego Rocked our Socks Off :)”
Reviews.Author: Natalie5250
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Hard Rock San Diego - I've stayed at many other hotels in San Diego and this was by far my most favorite experience. We were there for a bachelorette party and we had a blast - I would recommend this hotel for any occaision; the staff is extremely accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel truly rocked!”
Reviews.Author: esp55
Reviews.Content: After booking our stay at the Hard Rock a few months ago I began to fear that we would not fit in because we are definitely not party people but as soon as we got there my fears were allayed. The hotel is superb! The facilities are modern but warm and comfortable. The staff is spectacular - my husband and I kept commenting on how helpful and friendly everyone was! The hotel restaurants are excellent, be sure to go to Nobu's HH for a culinary experience! And the location... perfect! The Hard Rock is in an ideal location - Petco Park is next door and about 300 restaurants are within walking distance. We will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego and hope our travels bring us back there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Service Around”
Reviews.Author: CDCA
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of resorts/hotels and this had to be the best service in a very long time!

Reviews.Title: “I'm now a disciple”
Reviews.Author: sadNyc
Reviews.Content: The place rocks - literally. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The linens were awesome. Staff - super friendly. Robbie - concierge - super helpful. San Diego wasn't bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandiegofan11LISA
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hard Rock Hotel in san Diego made our trip! The swanky design and friendly staff made it unforgettable!! They were so personable and caring down to the smallest detail, and made us feel like real rockers! Hard rock ROCKS and we will definitely stay there again next time we are in San Diego. If you stay at the Hard Rock make sure you go to Nobu Sushi downstairs, it is the BEST sushi you will ever eat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Hard Rock SD”
Reviews.Author: IkefromCT
Reviews.Content: I book all my stays based on trip advisor and was a bit skeptical based on some of the negative items posted but I will give you my honest opinion. Arrived on the Sunday of Comic Con. Even with thousands of people in and around hotel room was ready at 4:00pm check in time. Room was clean and well stocked. I was aware of the charges pertaining to in room items for purchase but we didnt use and were not charged for them. The room was an okay size as we dont spend much time in room when traveling. People did complain about bed frames sticking out but they are padded now and I will say I didnt bump my ankles once. Read many horror stories about pool but we could not confirm them. When the pool is not available (usually on Sunday night) you can use the pool across the street at the Omni. TV, Internet and A/C worked well. The location is excellent with everything within walking distance. The zoo, Sea World, beaches and airport are just a few minutes drive away. Had no problem with valet as others have posted. It was $35 a night to park car but this is in line with other hotels in area. There is public parking garage that is close but still would have cost $20 a day to park there. All interaction with staff was pleasant. I would recommend this hotel to all. Only advise I would give is to try and get room on upper floor as on the weekend the bar rocks and I am sure you can hear it on the lower floors. We were on 11th floor so it was no problem for us. Also if Dodgers are playing Padres things will be a little more crowded but this is not a deterrant. It just livens things up in and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: frankd815
Reviews.Content: Room was a little pricey, but I had a complimentary upgrade to a suite. The room was amazing. I will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay rocked; it rocked hard."”
Reviews.Author: mjwood12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top of the line. The room was absolutely fantastic, designed beautifully and elegantly. They had our choice of music playing on the TV when we walked in and that was awesome. Everything was personalized, from when I called the front desk, to my name on the TV. When we needed some suggestions on where to go in San Diego, the concierges were extremely friendly and top-notch. They took care of everything for us when we wanted to rent a car, and they provided us with some great tips for where to eat in the city. Going to the hard rock we had not idea about the clubs and parties that existed there on the weekends, and we're not normally clubbing people, but because we got in as VIPs thanks to our stay there, we decided to go to the club there on Saturday night and to the pool party there on Sunday, and we had a really great time at both places. It was our honeymoon, and we had an absolutely fantastic stay. We booked on hotels.com so we got the room for a bit cheaper than it normally would be, but it was well worth every penny, even if we paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for in a hotel....and more!!”
Reviews.Author: Zaley44
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel was incredible. Everything single thing was 5 star from the moment we walked in, to the moment we left. The price of our stay was very reasonable. Our room was beautiful, with an amazing view. Every detail has been thought of in the room...and some we never thought about. It's located in Gaslamp, with an easy stroll to Seaport Village, the Convention Center, or Horton Plaza. The service at the hotel was stellar. No matter the time, a friendly person was there to help you with anything you could need. Over the years we have stayed at many of the downtown hotels in San Diego, and the Hard Rock Hotel is by far our number one choice.

Reviews.Title: “This is by far the best hotel in san...”
Reviews.Author: Dspann
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in san Diego it truly Rocks

Reviews.Title: “The San Diego Hard Rock Hotel made my Comic Con visit all that and a bag of chips!”
Reviews.Author: McKenasCole
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock during the annual mayhem and chaos of The Sand Diego Comic Con. Though assaulted by hordes of costumed conventioneers, celebrities, and paparazzi, the Hotel staff remained calm, friendly, and professional. The room was ready on time. Valet and Baggage staff on the money. And room service not much more than 30 minutes even at the dinner hour. The rebranding of the in-hotel cafe didn't cause any hiccoughs in their service and added a great bit of fun to our visit. The pool was ringed with bikini clad ladies in tattoos and yet when my 9 year old son felt it was the right moment for a cannonball -- nobody caused any ruckus. The location couldn't be more prime for a convention stay and NOBU is not to be missed. To satisfy your inner Sneaker Pimp, don't miss a short walk up 5th Ave to The Attic 2 and Sportie LA. Next time I'm SD bound, the Hard Rock will certainly be my five-star crash pad. :)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible is the word that comes close to what my experience was like at the Hard Rock.”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1993
Reviews.Content: The expreience is incredilbel. The "Float " suites are awesome. They put you right in the middle of the action. My suggestion is to stay the weekend through Sunday to get the full experience of the Hard Rock. You want to get away...this is the place. You are mere steps, literally two or three steps, from the party just outside your room. Let me tell you , the party doesnt stop until the sun comes up when they change the scene for the next venue and then the party starts up all over again. Really no need to leave the hotel unless you feel like you cant handle the "Rock" and care to peruse through the Gas Lamp district. Return visit...a definite!

Reviews.Title: “felt like a rockstar”
Reviews.Author: KrisSD1
Reviews.Content: We arranged a suite for our wedding night at the Hard Rock Hotel. I've never stayed there before but heard good things. I have to say that I was impressed and happy with our choice. The staff from the front desk girl to the room service staff were friendly, attentive, and helpful. We had a great time. We really felt like rock stars during our stay, an experience I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Professional staff, cool hotel with nice modern rooms... and clean”
Reviews.Author: mishu22
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay at the Hard Rock. The pictures on the internet made the rooms look so great. When I got there, they looked just like the pictures. I was able to check in early. They have my favorite music playing when I get to my room and everything was modern and up to date. The two TVs were great. Everytime I called to the front desk, the people were so friendly and got me everything I needed in no time. The rooftop pool and cabanas were nice. It was also nice to be able to do my business in the computer room. The room was very clean. The valets were friendly and very helpful. I was not sure at first if this would be family friendly, but it does a good job of balancing a famliy friendly environment with a young fresh vibe for those that want to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming party atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: krystina83
Reviews.Content: Had my babyshower here at the pool area on a Saturday. We rented one of the Float suites for $350 and a cabana for $1000 min purchase in food/drink. My 3 year old was not kicked out of the pool area even though everyone was partying, I think that was due to the fact we were guests of the hotel and in VIP, but he was never even confronted. My son had a blast shooting guys in the pool with his water gun. I was the only pregnant girl there, but it was all good. Waitress was cute but b*tchy. My girlfriends enjoyed champagne in the hot tub, my husband & I had virgin pina coladas. Float is one of the few bars in SD with a blender, FYI. Our assistant was allowed to fully decorate the cabana before our arrival with baby shower get up. Needless to say it couldn't have been better. I'm so glad no one got kicked out of the pool. I understand HR is an 'adult' hotel, but they really don't discriminate against the under aged guests. Only funny thing though, the VIP host quoted me 1k for the cabana, and my husband 1.5k over the phone. Sly dog! Can't be mad at that, he's maximizing profits, but if you want to reserve bottle service at Float have a girl call!

Reviews.Title: “That's Rock'n Roll”
Reviews.Author: slomann
Reviews.Content: All credit to Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego. We stayed there for one night (all other nights sold out) in July. That was a great experience. Our son turned 13 while we stayed there and it was his choise to stay at HRH - he chose it over Disneyland and Universal Studio. And he was thrilled. The great staff upgraded us to a Rock Suite and they even gave my son a birthday present. The hotel is great in all senses and I would recommend it to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect a Hard Rock Hotel to be....”
Reviews.Author: latecheckin
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two day stay at the Hard Rock in San Diego. The place is Uber-Chic and totally styled like you would expect a Hard Rock hotel to be. But wait... I am getting a bit ahead of myself. First of all, I would like to mention the way the reservation was handled. It was professional and they even asked what type of music I wanted playing in my room when I arrived (which it was). Between making my reservation and actually staying at the hotel, I received several emails (albeit automatically generated) reminding me of my stay and options to book a spa visit, question what is going on in the area, etc. I have never had this kind of attention from a hotel, and I for one... liked it. Okay, so I arrive and the line to get valet parking was kind of busy, so I parked across the street in the public parking and save myself some money ($21 per day vs. $35 per day at the hotel... although no in/out priveleges). When I arrived, my room was ready and clean. When I checked out the room, it was very stylish. There was a HUGE screen TV and some interesting architectural items like a small little "Peek-a-boo" window behind the mini-bar that looked straight into the bathroom... specifically in to the shower. Given that this was a single King bed room, I would imagine that they figured out that either one person was staying here or, at least, two people who knew each other quite well and would not mind watching each other shower. Again... totally cool... and totally Hard Rock. Just a couple other things about the room. First of all, no tub. Shower only [albeit with a terrific "rain" shower head]. Apparently rock stars don't like to soak. AND... the room, although totally "techy" has no DVD player. Disappointing. I brought Netflix DVDs with me to watch and when I couldn't find a DVD player in the room I called the front desk ("chic-ly" called "Ground Control" at the hotel) and asked about a DVD player. Yes, they have them, but at a cost of $100 per night! Too pricey for me. Now I am not the usual Hard Rock "demographic" as I am close to 50 years of age, but the Hard Rock staff made me feel comfortable nonetheless. The hotel is about a block away from Petco Park so if you are going to catch a Padres game, the location is PERFECT. The only complaint I had, and it is not the Hard Rock's issue, was that the people across from my room were very, very noisey and loud... usually until 2 or 3 in the morning. They were apparently there for a Bachelor/Bachelorette party and well, it was the Hard Rock so they were partying like... well, rock stars! It made getting to sleep and staying asleep a little challenging, but I made it through. Which brings me to my final point. If you go, and you really should, request a room on a higher floor. There is the 207 Lounge on the first floor and they party there quite late into the evening/early morning. I heard them quite a bit and I was on the 8th floor, so I can only imagine that it would be pretty much unbearable on a lower floor. But in any case, the Hard Rock lived up to its expectations as a cool, hip, trendy location. The staff appears to be well trained and the rooms well designed. Overall a good experience and one I would imagine others would enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Rock'n”
Reviews.Author: Leigh6
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed with our recent stay at the HR. From the point of checking in there were errors with our reservation, which took far too long for 'ground control'/management to fix. Just a few of the problems; we checked in at 3pm with an infant & they booked our room incorrectly. They told us it would be an hour for them to fix. Went on a walk & dinner and returned and still our room was not ready. Finally after several phone calls to Luke the manager on duty who was no help we decided at 9 pm that we would stay in the wrong room for the night & switch rooms in the am, on the weekend HR has a club on the main level. We were on the 10th floor and the music was so loud it sounded like someone was dj-ing next door, rooms smelled of smoke, for over 24 hours the room next to us room service sat in the hallway (with cigarette butts & uneaten food),...I could go on with more, but I have better things to do then revisit a nightmare of a stay. We will never stay at another HR & would not recommend this hotel to our friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 4th of July”
Reviews.Author: brianthielen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hard Rock San Diego a few times and every time has been a blast! This trip was no different. The service is always exceptional and everyone at the hotel is extremely friendly. They really go out of their way to make sure you are completely taken care of. My room was towards the top of the hotel and had amazing views of the San Diego Padres Petco Park and the Coronado Bay Bridge. Gorgeous! Intervention was so much fun! I can't wait to go back. I definitely encourage anyone who is going to be in downtown San Diego, especially near the Gaslamp District, to stay at the Hard Rock. Amazing hotel!

Reviews.Title: “You Rock Stars”
Reviews.Author: morenoconsulting
Reviews.Content: What an amazing stay the service was impecable from the greeting at arrival by valet team, the guest service agents. My suite was ready upon arrival which is hard to get when you arrive early. The room was very clean and we had a great view of the pool area where intervention took place on Sunday...Wow what a great party.... Room service breakfast and late night snacks were amazing, Mary Jane's meatloaf and smashed potato amazing....Nobu always amazing..... Great new bar scene, very happy to see the old outta there...GREAT JOB My new place to stay in SD, will be back often....THANK YOU for a great family retreat

Reviews.Title: “June Gloom but awesome time at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: winflack
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Hard Rock recently and had an amazing visit. Check in went smooth. There was no wait and the girl that checked us in was super nice. We found out that she is from Oklahoma, so it was kinda cool talking to her. We were given the introduction by a nice young man. He took us to our room on the top floor and showed us how to operate everything. He was super nice, I ran into him a few more times during our stay and he would always greet us and ask how things were going. We were in a suite. A pretty awesome sweet. I believe it was called the Black Eyed Peas Suite. It ran about 330.00 a night. I am very glad that my wife's company was picking up the bill. I loved the shower with the two spray heads. One normal and the other coming down from the ceiling. The decorations were pretty awesome. Loved the contemporary feel. We slept very well in the beds and found the reading lamps very cool and useful. We had a view facing downtown and the Gaslamp area. It was cool to look out at night and see everything going on. Everything is so lit up. If I looked over the balcony and too the left I could see an aircraft carrier in the harbor. If I looked to the right, I could see part of Petco field. There were games going on two of the nights we were there. It got loud when they scored. Not too loud. We kept the balcony doors open most of the time we were in the room except for when we were sleeping. When the doors were closed, we really didn't hear much except for an ocassional siren or horn. After a couple of days, I tried to get a pool view suite but since there was a huge conference in town, there were no rooms available. Got to check out the pool area a few times. Never swam. We hung out for a bit and did some people watching. There were several parties going on during our stay. If you want to party like a rockstar then this is the place to be. Seen a few celebrities in and around the hotel. It was pretty awesome. Didn't check out any of the restaurants in the hotel but they do have a yogurt place connected that was fabulous. We did try to eat at Mary Janes one night but they had already closed. FYI, there is a convenient store/deli around the corner that was very handy. We really had a great time at the hotel. Loved the location, Loved the staff, Loved the visit. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fun even without Sun”
Reviews.Author: sasspistol
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled to San Diego from Los Angeles just to go to the Hard Rock to see Dave Navarro on July 4th. Although the weather was AWFUL...the pool/spa/party scene was so much fun!!! Everyone at the hotel was super cool and welcoming, and our suite was impeccable! The only bummer was the $35 valet charge overnight...but I guess you get that at every hotel. I will say they had a killer BBQ that was delicious!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rocked out on the Fourth of July”
Reviews.Author: TRIPPY_HIP
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Perfect location is you want to see how beautiful San Diego really is. The staff is great. The pool is fun to hang out at night or day. A little but pricey but i am a firm believer in "you get what you pay for". Hard Rock Hotel rocks!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a Theme-Rockin!”
Reviews.Author: brucer1
Reviews.Content: Not a place for familys-more lookin for action or a romantic place.Pool scene is busy(dinky size) Get there early for seats.Cant believe they didnt plan a bigger area.Drinks & food are very good--even the late night room service hamburger & firies. The staff is very friendly.Rooms are small--upgrades are recommended.Great beds,clean rooms with the layouts a little different.The hotel really jumps on weekend with the clubs scene on the street level & special stuff in the upper pool & bar, If your set on peace & quiet-maybe avoid weekend.Location is great--PETCO (one block)light rail(across street)convention center(across the street,waterfront & Corondo Island(good walk)Fun city with good waether.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Everything you need in...”
Reviews.Author: dustin82
Reviews.Content: Great location. Everything you need in one location, whether you want to party or relax in the room. My room was on the 4th floor and opened to a patio and we could walk past the patio about 100 feet to the nightclub/lounge and pool. It was such a great time, I can't reccomend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Living the life of a Rock Star!!”
Reviews.Author: Lwillits
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked into the hotel, the staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was comfortable. My husband was attending a conference held there and by his review the hotel met all of their requirement perfectly. Whilst he worked I played. The concierge gave me excellent direction as to what San Diego had to offer. The hotel driver, Ciengan, made me feel like a Rock Star. He chauffered me around town for less than the cost of the local cabies and came every time I called. Outstanding staff and a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Energizing hotel”
Reviews.Author: rs9gv
Reviews.Content: I am a 34 year old professional who enjoyed my Hard Rock experience. I was there for a medical conference. I love the Hard Rock in Vegas and was equally impressed with this San Diego property. I stayed in the basic room overlooking the pool. Beds were very comfortable, lots of cool features in the room (large flat screen, personalized music already playing when you walk in, dual head shower, plenty of water/ liquor/ beer/ snacks). You must visit Nobu and get the yellowtail with sliced jalepeno appetizer- do not pass this up!!! Every employee was friendly. Mary Janes has a great breakfast and was a nice way to start the day. Be sure to visit the pool and enjoy poolside drink service and great appetizers. Great booths to lounge in by the pool. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock lives up to there name!”
Reviews.Author: djvacation
Reviews.Content: Go for the experience and you will love the service. I had some needs that had to be addressed during my stay at the Hard Rock. All of the staff members were really 'in tune' to help me address my needs and make me feel like a total VIP. I would recommend this hard rock again and again. smiles

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: mpk115
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the San Diego convention centre. The room has a nice flat screen TV and a superb sound system. No coffee maker, but has a nice selection of drinks. It was slightly expensive compared to other places and you will have to pay for the internet (but have a good offer of $17 resort fee which includes domestic calls and entry to fitness centre). I won't recommend it to family but great place for party animals. I would like to go back for holiday for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Service and Great Management”
Reviews.Author: lormarie
Reviews.Content: We loved this Hotel. From the time we walked in the atmosphere was sheik and open. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We had a wrap around balcony in the Woodstock suite and loved the views of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “love it!!”
Reviews.Author: 56003George
Reviews.Content: Great location and service. Room were very nice and clean!! wich is very important for us. Room service was fast and excellent...

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: TeshaSD
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Hard Rock in San Diego! We live in San Diego and think this is the best hotel downtown by far. The level of hospitality was outstanding. Ryan Zylius and his team took great care of us!

Reviews.Title: “Back at the HR”
Reviews.Author: Lainerbopper
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the HR. Room service was quick and super friendly.. Front desk was quick and very nice as well. The pool was a fun atmosphere but the pool was soooooo small. I enjoyed having a club in the same hotel which was fun and the bar staff was nice as could be. I would come back anytime I can. Just tell the sun to come out!

Reviews.Title: “Cool room, great location”
Reviews.Author: TripAway7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a convention, but I'd prefer to come back for a holiday. Cool room, large flat screen TV, easy to connect iPod or other player, lots of power sockets, large comfortable bed. Plenty of space in the bedroom and the bathroom, and well laid out with desk area and comfortable chair. Not really suited for families - no coffee/tea maker, and instead 3 different types of vodka, a well stocked minibar, and a tray of candy that was hard to resist. Didn't have enough time to check out the bar or even the pool, but Mary Jane's coffee shop is fine. Great location, beside tram, across road from convention centre, and close to ferry to Coronado beach.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: joeyclement
Reviews.Content: Great time, excellent staff and service. It was not too loud or party-party for my family with 2 young kids. Dynamite location too!

Reviews.Title: “They will nickle and dime you to death”
Reviews.Author: pezor1
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed your hotel, but you charge so much money for everything. For three days, I was forced to pay 17 dollars for gym service and wireless internet service that I did not use. There was no coffee maker in the hotel room…and when we did want coffee, your hotel charges $10.00 for a pot of coffee, $4.00 for room service and an additional 19% mandatory gratuity. You charged $3 dollars for candy bars and an outrageous $35 dollars for parking. Now, do you seriously have to charge so much for everything… I truly did like your hotel but I will never stay there or at any Hard Rock hotel ever again. It seems like you want to nickel and dime every guest at your hotel…not good business, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: ericg68
Reviews.Content: First of all you should know the hotel has required fee for using the internet and phone that is added to the room rate, EVEN if you don't use the internet or phone. Why don't they just add the amount to the base room rate? Second some of the staff have attitude. The pool bar "owner" gave us attitude even as we spent $2,000 on our bar tab. Threatened to have us thrown out because we were throwing balls in the pool area. Doubt I will stay here again. The prices are high, I feel cheated with the added cost, and I don't like the staff attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have picked better!!!”
Reviews.Author: katrinabrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock for 4 nights in May for a Convention. The location was unbeatable - less than 2 blocks from the Convention Center and right at the entrance to the Gaslamp District. We also could walk to Seaport Village in just a few minutes. The service was outstanding...maybe the best service I've ever had at a hotel. The rooms were very clean, and the beds soooo comfortable. Both restaurants, Nobu and Mary Jane's were good and reasonably priced. I was forewarned by Tripadvisor about the hotel nightclubs being very busy on Friday and Saturday nights, and I was pleased with Hard Rock's security - they kept everything orderly. It must have been prom night and I did hear security come to a nearby room several times to quiet down the occupants. I also loved the outdoor bar near the rooftop pool - very cozy and relaxing. The only negative thing I can think to say about my entire stay was that the drinks are very overpriced and weak at the pool bar (probably the same at most touristy spots). I highly recommend this hotel unless you really want to be away from it all. My group was all in our 40's, 50's, and 60's and no one had a complaint....but I would have swooned with pleasure if I would have stayed here in my 20's!!! All the beautiful people and the atmosphere felt surreal and movie-like in the lobby, but just comfortable in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: P_Girl_10
Reviews.Content: I never read reviews because I like to judge for myself, but this experience was so bad, I felt the need to write one. I was expecting a fun weekend with the girls. I was so disappointed! This was by far the worst experience I have ever had. The guest service was horrible and the rules are ridiculous, especially if you want to get into one of the hotel bars. If you're a guest there you shouldn't have as much trouble as we did just to go in and grab a drink. We picked this hotel because we thought it would be a fun, but it was just beyond horrible. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: jennifer111477
Reviews.Content: I was anticipating a lot of noise, little sleep and mediocre food. What I got was extremely quiet rooms, wonderful sleep and excellent food. I was in San Diego for a business meeting and this was the site the organization chose to host the meeting. It is a beautiful hotel with great meeting facilities and a catering staff that is just amazing. The food was wonderful - we had a reception with heavy hors d'oeuvres that was just delicious. It was on the roof-top near the pool so we could savor that cool breeze. The rooms are spacious although I have to admit they have strange chairs and the stools at the in-room bar were not comfortable (I was using my computer on the bar). The WiFi is $15 a day, which is a little pricey in my book. But the location is superb - right across from the San Diego Convention Center and in the Gaslamp Quarter with lots of restaurants and clubs. We had breakfast at the Hard Rock's coffee shop and it was good. And we came in one night to find the lobby booming music and people lined up outside to get in - obviously a preferred place to be. But, upstair, it was quiet. One thing I liked is that you had to have a card key to use the elevator, which kept people from roaming the halls. There were no doors slamming or people yelling in the halls. The service was unbelievable - it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Were these my friends or employees???”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreGirlsrock
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hard Rock for a week of fun! The ladies at the concierge desk were great! They made us feel like they really cared that we were having a good time and enjoying ourselves. The valet's outside were excellent! The entire staff made us feel like we have known them for years! The bed OMG that bed and those pillows were so comfortable! The shower was amazing! Beautiful view, great location in the Gaslamp area. thanks everyone for making my vacation great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: beachpug1111
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay at the Hard Rock over the last couple days. The lobby, rooms, pool area etc have a really cool rock style I haven't seen at any other hotel Ive stayed at. My brother stayed across the street and was jealous when he stopped over to our room. The rooms were very comfortable and well set up. Super comfortable beds, big flat panel tv, and little touches like Rolling Stone magazines and Aveda bath products really set this apart from other places. After coming back from sightseeing each day we stopped for Pink Berry frozen yogurt and then hung out at the 4th floor pool and bar area. What a great way to unwind before getting ready to go out. The hotel is right in the Gaslamp Quarter and within walking distance of the seaport tourist area. There are a ton of restaurants, bars and shops right down the street. We enjoyed some great dinners and had a lot of fun going out. Our only issues were outside noise. Passing trains woke us up but I'm sure it would be the same if we stayed at any of the other places in the area. The nightclub was also very loud. We liked the music, just not while trying to sleep. The hotel staff provided outstanding customer service and moved us farther away from the noise the next day. Everyone who helped us was great, even the valets! We just got home to NJ and miss the Hard Rock already. I will definitely stay there next time I travel to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' but not up to par”
Reviews.Author: landa46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight at The Hard Rock for an evening away from home. There was an internet special that I wanted to take advantage of; however when I called to book the reservation, the operator said she wasn't aware of that deal and tried to up-sell me. Upon arrival, the valet guys were just hanging around with a full valet! We had to drive around the block and come back, which we still had to wait because they hadn't moved the cars. When you pull up the hotel it doesn't have it's own driveway so you're actually on a street. The internet special gave us a credit to use while we were there. Unfortunately we were misinformed on where and what we could use it on so we missed out, which sucked. When you get up to your room, there's music playing (you pick the genre ahead of time). The rooms are modern and cool--a little bit like a glorified dorm room but still has the party vibe. We had to be transferred to 3 rooms because the first didn't have a bathtub, the second the tv with the music didn't work and the third had a broken remote but we didn't want to have to keep switching so we just dealt with it. The breakfast restaurant they have (MaryJane's) is just like a diner- appearance and food quality. Some of the booths had their own tv's with music videos showing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a one night stand”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaKara
Reviews.Content: Rock star treatment at check-in by Christian? Check. Ridiculously big "studio" room? Check. MaryJane's perfect chocolate malt shake at 1 am? Check. Relaxed hubby? Priceless. We visited Hard Rock San Diego on April 9, 2010. The purpose of the trip was to thank my husband for being such a rock star through my cancer and IVF treatments, and to get in a tiny staycation before my hysterectomy on Monday. (I'm 34, story of it all here: www.casadefrias.com). In short, it's a perfect place for a one-night stand. VALET Upon arrival, the very professional, friendly valet staff made us feel welcome right away. They even got some waiting cabs to go around the block so we could move into the valet lane and get out of traffic quickly. Some people may say it's a tad pricey, but as a local I can say it's in line with what most places charge downtown. When CHECK-IN We were second in line, and checked in within 5 minutes.
