Props to Christian for his kindness and efficiency in getting us a great room on a high floor with a killer view of the bay. ROOM This is where it gets ridiculous. We booked Hard Rock's smallest room, which they dub a "Studio Room." Now I've traveled a lot (both in the States and international), and I know what a studio room looks like: 6-18 inches between the sides of the bed and wall, a bathroom you can barely turn around in. This hardly fit that bill. The room was overly spacious for 2 adults. They don't overstuff the room with unnecessary furniture. The bar and fridge are smartly tucked in the corner. The large shower easily holds 2 people (and there's no pesky tub to climb over). The bathroom is roomy enough that we were both able to get ready at the same time. DINING While we didn't eat at the sushi place (we couldn't, they were booked solid with reservations for the night), we did eat at Mary Janes, the throwback diner, twice. The first time was just a shake with fries/rings combo (get the dipping sauce, it's divine). The next morning we went for breakfast, and the Tijuana Benedict (pork) was inventive and delicious. Overheard at Mary Janes restaurant during breakfast: Dad, "You really want berries on that?" to which the child replied, "Oh, what do I know, I'm 6." FINAL THOUGHTS From the moment you walk into the spacious, airy lobby, to when you leave, Hard Rock San Diego is a rock star experience.

Reviews.Title: “These tips could really enhance your stay”
Reviews.Author: LBelle511
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived on Tues evening and were booked for 2 nites. The front desk girl who checked us in asked us if we wanted a room with a balcony? Since I have never stayed there, I said yes. MISTAKE. It was a mistake due to the weather conditions for San Diego were cold, rainy, and windy for the days we were staying and there was really no need for the balcony whatsoever, as there was no one at pool or any reason anyone would even need the balcony with the upcoming weather conditions. When we arrived in our room 12th floor (their highest level) we had rm 1259. It is a corner room with very little space at all. The bathrm was very tiny and had no ventilation or fan whatsoever, and the door from the bathrom into the bedroom was located less than a ft. from the bedside. There was only a shower, so if you are in the mood for a bath , or have a lady with you, I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS RM,,or you will be going downstairs to change it. The lighting was florescent and with the red walls, it wasnt the place for a girl to do her makeup at all. Thankfully there was a mirror located by the minibar in the front room, very awkward, but it saved me. The entire room may have been 600 sq ft.,that is with a queen size bed and 2 very uncomfortable sofas that looked more like fancy leather futons. The floor to cieling curtains looked great, but the electronic curtain/drape openers werent working...not one of them, so we didnt really fight at the blinds to see our great view and THE BALCONY<O JOY! I had an 80minute massage at their spa. The spa was very quiet and clean and pretty basic with not alot of frills, but nice just the same. The massage I would give a thumbs up. The ISSUE I had was the spa is located on the 3rd floor (which is on the same floor as other rooms are) and when I got off of the elevator, I could see no sign as to where on the floor the spa was, so I went searching. On 2 seperate occassions, we went into the 207club. The waitstaff is superfriendly and attentive. Our 2nd trip in , it was late afternoon and it was absolutely freeeZING and windy out.. IN SPITE of the frigid temperatures that were clearly cooling down the entire place, they left the door open. We were there for over an hr and could nt believe no one closed it..it was absurd and was certainly freezing up their waitstaff, as we were chilly ourselves even while wearing long sleeved coats. Just had to write these few things in hopes of letting everyone know these little quirks I encountered. Definately think twice about the room s with balconys ,,unless the weather is perfect and you are flying solo,,cause these rooms are like a highend efficiency suite,,and when I am staying at the hardrock,,that totally is not the vibe Im looking for.. hope this helps out

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: LAtoooNy
Reviews.Content: Best location and best service in all of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fab !”
Reviews.Author: xVMNx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We found the hotel on new, up and coming blog site we have been using called http://casualconnoisseur.blogspot.com/ and the review was spot on in regards to our experience with the hotel. Its in a great location just across from the convention centre and harbour and around the corner there are loads of shops, bars and restaurants to entertain you as well as being handy for Seaworld and the Zoo. We stayed at the hotel at the end of November and although it was quite busy, the staff always took the time to make sure we were ok and offer assistance. As it was a special occasion, the room we booked was a Hard Rock Suite and it was massive. It had separate lounge, bedroom, bathroom and balcony. For the price it was fantastic. We treated ourselves to a dinner at Nobu to celebrate and it didnt disappoint. We were worried we wouldn't be able to get in at the last minute, but the hotel staff made all the arrangements for us - no problems . Maryjanes was, as mentioned on the blog we used, great for breakfast and the happy hour was well worth a visit - stuffed ourselves silly and had lots of yummy cocktails. We can see that 'in the season' or if a large event is on, the hotel could possibly get a bit swamped, but it is huge and with the large amount of staff and facilities so I'm sure they could cope, no problems. Its a very quick drive to Sea World and the Zoo, and with our car parked in the multi-storey across the street - thanks again http://casualconnoisseur.blogspot.com/ for the tip !, they also advised of the free wifi, which we used quite a bit. Well worth a visit, we dont think you will be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Don't Leave Valuables in the Room & Lock Your Luggage”
Reviews.Author: GiveMeSun86
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a nice atmosphere and catered to the business traveler wanting to let loose. The rooms were decorated with modern features but they didn't have practicality in mind while designing. For example, there were no plug-ins around the vanity area so I had to stretch my hair dryer to stand in front of the mirror. The worst problem by far is that I left my flat iron sitting on the vanity to cool on the second day of our stay. After we returned that night we noticed that the room had been cleaned which usually isn't an issue. We checked out the next day but quickly returned after realizing that I did not repack my flat iron into my luggage. I spoke to them in person and to multiple people over the phone everyday for one week today to try to remedy this situation but have yet to receive a phone call back from anyone. Since it's not in Lost & Found I guess it's not their issue. We will see if they decide to replace my $100 flat iron.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Party hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_the_Beach088
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for a weekend with a girlfriend/co-worker before a work meeting for some fun in the sun. The Hard Rock is in a great location with a fun party theme. We hung by the pool (which was very small) and had cocktails tannned and mingled. The rooms were nice and clean with a large TV and sound system. The rooms were a little loud as we could hear people in the hall way but stay during spring break at the Hard Rock was not very surprised. One negitave we found was the hotel seems to nickle and dime you with fees, drink min by the pool, etc. Not a huge deal but not the best value in Gaslamp district. I had a great time and would go back but do not recommend this hotel for families or people who would like a quite vacation.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A FAMILY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: scoobeepsk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with my 12 year old son and 8 year old daughter went to San Diego for a wedding and I wanted to stay at a fun hotel close to everything. The hotel staff was friendly and the rooms were nice, but it was not a good environment for the family. During the weekday, the hotel appears to be a nice quiet hotel, but once the weekend nights hit be ready. The lobby is packed with non hotel staying people attending the night club which is located right at the entrance to the hotel. There is a line that goes around the exterior of the hotel and my children were a little scared when going to the elevator, since a lot of adults with drinks and loud music was a little intimidating. On one of the elevators, someone had spilled a drink and the smell was awful. In addition, the people was packed with young adults not swimming, but flirting and was not situation to take children swimming. The night club music could be heard in the elevator from the first floor to the seventh floor. luckily, I was staying on the 12th floor. I do not think I will be returning to this hotel with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: indycheeseburger
Reviews.Content: My husband I just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and I have to say that I will NEVER EVER stay in this hotel again!! The service was terrible and the noise on the 7th floor was unbeliveable! The partying in the hallway started at about 11:00 PM and was still going on at 4:30 AM when we checked out. We call the front desk sever times to complain and was told that security was being sent up. However, either security never arrived or if they did they simply couldn't control what was taking place. To make matters worse when we arrived downstaris to check out at 4:30 no one was around. We had to wait 10 minutes before someone finally appeared to help us with our check out. We were at this hotel for a very big conference and we will make sure the the committe that is responsible for booking hotels is aware of all the problems with the hotel staff and the noise that this hotel is never booked again for this conference. I would not have expected these problems with a hotel that charges close to $300 per night! I will never go back to this hotel, EVER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great property - great service - unique experience”
Reviews.Author: SDT_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was simply wonderful and the hospitality was great. The outdoor pool and bar area is very nice with fire pits and great bar service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and environment...”
Reviews.Author: VRUM
Reviews.Content: It is located in the heart of San Diego gas lamp district, it has a fresh and modern look to it, it may be a bit too loud and crowded for older ppl especially on weekends, on the other hand it is a haven for party animals with it's beautiful pool and patio on the roof top.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: cferguson9
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and have seen my fair share of hotels and this one was great!! We were upgraded to a junior suite upon arrival for our weekend stay. I had never been to SD and this was the perfect place to stay. In the heart of the gaslamp district and close to the marina. Endless food, bars and entertainment. We loved Mary Jane's and Pinkberry! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best hard rock in the world”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: Nice and New Very cool Pool bar Most well stocked minibar i have ever seen Large well appointed rooms rooms can be noisy due to music but hey thats what you are their for

Reviews.Title: “Uber Trendy Nightclub Ambience - Felt Out of Place as a Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: BiztravelguyNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock while attending a conference across the street. It's one of the closest hotels to the conference center which made it a breeze going back and forth. Honestly the hotel was too funky for the purpose of my visit. On the plus side, the hotel is brand new and the public spaces, my room and bathroom were gleaming. I checked in around 10pm on a Sunday night and was checked in at a little podium (the hotel bucks the trend and doesn't have a traditional front desk). The guy checking me in looked like an underwear model; they definitely hire staff who fit the concept. The underwear model and I had to raise our voices as we exchanged information because the check-in area is adjacent to one of San Diego's hottest night clubs, which was in full swing and located off the hotel lobby. If I was here with friends, or for a bachelor party, or looking to whoop it up this would have been the place for me. Because I was in town for a conference and I had to have my corporate face on I felt out of place. My favorite touch was the flat screen TV. Hard Rock has several commercial-free radio stations playing and the ability to plug my iPod into it was great when working on my laptop (they supplied all the hook up wires). Pool was beautiful. Highlight was having drinks on the rooftop bar, sitting on long outdoor couches with coworkers, low to the ground with our feet up on the ledge of the fire pit getting toasty warm. Don't get me wrong, this is a great hotel, but it was awkward as a business traveler. It was like going to a hot night club with my boss to talk shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-Scummy Club and Rude Staff.”
Reviews.Author: abellcr3482
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. My room was great and very clean. I wouldn't have had anything bad to say about this place until last night. When I pulled up to the hotel last evening after being out for the day there were police everywhere and they were putting up crime scene tape. There were no staff adequately prepared to handle the scene. No one came up to my car to tell me that I should pull around to another entrance. I had to make a passenger get out of the car to chase down an employee and ask him where to go. He was very rude. He gave a quick answer and disregarded us like we were some drunk bar patron. After having to honk the horn several times to make him come to the car he finally explained where I should go. Then I drive around the building which took 10 minutes cause of traffic, and I pull up to another entrance. The valet people were all rude, except for one women. They were all telling me we had to walk around to the complete opposite side of the building to enter when there was an entrance right there. So after some complaining they pointed at a door and told us to go there. Then the door person was very rude, treating me and my friend like we were some wasted person attending the club there. I understand that the hotel is not at fault for the person who got killed there, but management needs to over haul there training of employees and there own skills. I will never stay here again. This place is beautiful but I refuse to stay at a place where staff is rude to you until you flash your room key card at them. They dont have enough staff or security at night to handle the influx of drunk people.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get!”
Reviews.Author: sharpee2
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock was cool. Best location ever for the convention center and Gam Lamp Quarter. 4th floor patio is a hidden gem. I had lunch and many drinks up here all alone. Great view and great service. Room was small but modern. Free internet and great TV. Toilet seat was extremely uncomfortable. Shower absolutely ROCKED! Staff were great and customer service is obviously key at this Hotel as everyone was friendly and treated you like a rock star. I loved it and would go back any day

Reviews.Title: “Let the Good Times Roll at Hard Rock Hotel San Diego Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: TravelingABroad410
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is the only place to stay in San Diego. Situated in the heart of the Gaslamp District, the hotel exudes the trendy pace of downtown San Diego. There are restaurants galore. Try Spanish Tapas at Sevilla on Fourth and island and a wonderful made to order meal at Panevino on 5th. There are so many restaurants, I can hardly mention them all. My stay was to be from 2/6 to 2/10. The snow storm in New York, interrupted return flights. Gaby the Chief Concierge, who is a wonderful mix of sweet, bubbly and professional accommodated my friend and I until Saturday 2/13. , Luke, in reservations, was also warm, friendly and professional. Both of them made our experience amazing and a pleasure. They should be promoted. The Hard Rock Hotel is fun, a great place to stay for business, a great place to stay for rock and roll families and their little rockers. I luv, luv luved it. I cannot wait to return. At the Hard Rock, they really make you feel like a Rockstar. It is not just for kids. I am 44 years old and would not have stayed anywhere else.! Oh and by the way, the beds and bedding is amazing. You will get the sleep of a lifetime and as they say - YOU'LL SLEEP LIKE A ROCK at the Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “If it weren't for my business meetings, I would have never had a reason to leave the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emceeluna
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I had some work to do down in San Diego over the weekend, but also wanted to stay somewhere where we could enjoy the nightlife after our work was done... the Hard Rock had it all!!! After our work was done, we enjoyed ourselves at the pool bar in some unseasonably warm weather. After a few drinks at the pool, we headed back to our suite with a balcony overlooking the main street and rested up a bit while enjoying our iPod music through the room's speaker system. The shower and bathroom were separated which made it easy for me and my colleagues to get ready quicker than usual. Although we decided to eat somewhere else (many restaurants walking distance from the hotel), the hotel has a Nobu Sushi Restaurant downstairs as well as a late night diner for those after hour cravings! After a quick bite, we headed to the Hard Rock's multi-level club and enjoyed some of the amazing San Diego nightlife that we had heard so much about. Aside from the cutting edge design features and amazing amenities the Hard Rock San Diego has to offer, the staff was as friendly as can be from the concierge all the way up to the GM, Craig Martin. I will definitely stay here again next time I'm in town and urge anyone that wants to experience all that the San Diego Gaslamp Quarter has to offer, to stay here as well.

Reviews.Title: “An ok place but nothing too special”
Reviews.Author: Me9247
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock for a work conference. I believe it is a newer hotel. The décor is like you would expect for a Hard Rock; modern and sleek. The layout of the room was nice. I will point out a few of the issues I had while staying there. First, I was only on the 5th floor facing the convention center. I know my entire company was at the hotel so I know it was full. The issue being on the 5th floor is the club noise from the bar in the hotel named 207. Every night there are a ton of people at this bar and they can not smoke indoors. Hence, they stand on the sidewalk right out side my window. Additionally, there is a train that goes by about every hour. After one night I went and got ear plugs and the noise was no longer an issue. Most of my company meetings were on the 2nd or 4th floor. However, I could not find a stair well to take me down just one flight of stairs. They all appear to be fire stairwells. The first day before I knew this I had to walk all the way down to the ground floor and then ride the elevator back to the 4th floor. No big deal but a bit annoying to be forced to use the elevator. What distributed me more was all the clutter on the 2nd and 1st floor in the stair well. If they are truly fire stairs they should be clear. Overall the room was clean but the bathroom needed to be scrubbed a bit more. There was stray hair in the shower and water rings on the counter. Again not a huge deal but it does make you wonder why they are cutting corners. I also know for some people stray hair in the shower is a big deal so I thought I would mention it. For those of you planning a meeting here, hire an outside vendor. Do not use the in house crew. The general sessions we had were terrible. They were 1-10 getting the mics working on the first try. It actually became a joke with the presenters. I go to a ton of these things a year and this was the worst production I had seen in a very long time. Additionally, they were 0-3 getting video to work successfully the first time. Overall, it took away from the presentations. The things I liked. The bed was extremely comfortable and the sheets were the white 500 thread count. I also enjoyed the towels after the first day. They were thick and comfortable as well. It appears the first day I was given older non branded towel. Again, I know how booked the hotel was for the conference. The second day I had newer branded towels and they were wonderful. The shower has a rain shower head and a normal one. A bit of a luxury. I would also complement the catering staff. All the food in the breaks outs were delicious and healthy. The food that was served during lunch was good as well. One day we had a sit down family style lunch and the next a buffet. Breakfast was always a buffet and always stocked. For those not traveling on your company’s dime be aware that WiFi is $15 a day. Additionally, the only parking at the hotel is valet at $25 a day. I did hear some peers parked down the street on their own at $15 a day. Overall I am glad I got to experience the Hard Rock. However, if I was going to travel to San Diego on my own dime I would stay somewhere else. I will never suggest having another conference in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: NewDawnFades
Reviews.Content: I hosted a number of clients on business at the Hard Rock. They all remarked on how fantastic the hotel and rooms were -- I believe it really made their experience in San Diego. If you're looking for a place to win over your clients, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: tryonemoretime
Reviews.Content: This hotel is "where it's at" in the Gaslamp. We've stayed here both in the summer and the fall. In the summer the rooftop bar is a great place to hang out with plenty of people watching. Word to the wise - this hotel is definitely not for kids or families. Petco is just a block away for Padres games. In the Fall it's easy to ride the trolleys to the Chargers games. The Gaslamp area is easily accessible from this hotel. Love the rooms, the ambiance and Mary Jane's cafe is really good place for breakfast. The HR spa is also really nice although there is no hot tub. One other tip: If you valet park it is VERY expensive (approx. $30)! If you ask the valet people about a place to self park, they will not tell you about the parking garage that is right next to the hotel which is only about $8/day. Another restaurant close by "Toscana Cafe Wine Bar" is terrific place for an inexpensive dinner with lots of wines to choose from. My husband and I had a small bowl of crab bisque and wished we had ordered it for our entree.

Reviews.Title: “It was hip and a very cool place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: GreatGetawaysInCA
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a blast at Hard Rock Hotel San Diego. It's very hip, fresh and so 21st Century. We loved the decor, the SERVICE, the spa, the bars and of course the restaurants. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, once you park you never need your car, walking distance to the Convention Center, shops, restaurants, clubs and much more. Can't wait to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Like the name says, it Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinVince
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a few colleagues for 2 days then my wife caught up with me over the weekend. We had a blast. Very nice city and the Hard Rock was in a perfect location to tour the Gas Lamp. If we didn't want to look around the city, we would have been very content hanging out in the hotel the whole time. The Hard Rock meshes a hotel and entertainment very well.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in downtown San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Barrfly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hard Rock one night with my wife and had a great experience. Very friendly staff, nice modern and clean rooms, amazing location. My wife was on crutches due to a knee injury and the staff went out of their way to take care of us. We will definitely return and highly recommend Hard Rock San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Never again at the Multi Platium Suite”
Reviews.Author: MCM2
Reviews.Content: So when you pay 1000.00 for a room that states on the website that it has a terrace you might think that you would get a terrace right? Not here! Pay attention to the details. This has got to be the most overpriced and poor quality hotel I have stayed in in SD. THE IVY is a million times better. The pice for the same type of suite is the same at the IVY but the IVY gives you so much more. Example- The mini bar at the Hard Rock sucks. Not what you would expect for a 1K room The fact that they did not give me a terrace room bothered me because it was misleading. When I asked them about it they 20 yr old on the line was pretty nonchalant. I was staying n one of the most expensive rooms they had, but it was no big deal. They tout the 270 degree view- again be careful! Mine was on the 6th floor! Not a lot to look at there. The bath gels etc are Aveda, but they do not have the personal touches like the IVY or W The only good thing...THE SHOWER was amazing. Buyer beware. La Valencia, IVY or W are much classier, well kept and the staff is much more accomadating. I can understand wanting to go to Hard Rock for teh "experience" but I would rather stay at the IVY and walk down.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: tosuperfly
Reviews.Content: Very cool hip vibe and feel. Great bars'. Stayed in the one bedroom suite which had a king size bed, in a bedroom as well as a seperate living room with another flatscreen, couch, chair, and bar. It was very nice and worth the price! The location is right on Gaslamp and close to the Ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled service at every level!”
Reviews.Author: JCooter
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel through and through! I was promptly and genuinely greeted by the valet and front desk staff. I have been coordinating meetings for my company for 5 years, and this meeting was superb compared to all other events held at hotels. I can't say enough about the attentiveness of ALL staff! The food and beverages at our meeting was excellent - I would never have guessed that it was "hotel" food. The hotel is in a great location and walking distance from a lively nightlife scene. Everything is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “HIppest Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: agregg
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego has a hip edge to it that reminds you of a much larger city. Throughout the hotel is original rock memorabilia, photos, costumes, and notes from everyone from Bono to Madonna, which makes it fun to just wander around the hotel. Float, their rooftop club, has great views, service and drinks. Rooms are comfortably large, with cool modern decor and awesome city views. It's also right next to the convention center so it makes a great choice if you're there for business.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: hittingupthehotspots
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent experience staying at this hotel. There room is decked out with cool designs and the location is second to none. Hard Rock Hotels are definitely the best way to go on any vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel, but kind of overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Xabbu
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego is a stylish hotel in the Gaslamp Quarter. The rooms are nice and large. The bathroom was very large and very nice. There is a bar in the hotel, but during our stay it was pretty empty. Overall it is a nice hotel, but it's kind of overpriced for the value it offers.

Reviews.Title: “It really rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Basballdude
Reviews.Content: Since we were on a baseball trip we wanted to have a hotel right next to the park right. so when we saw this was so close to the stadium we could see a vending machine in the stadium we knew it was right. The hotel itself is awesome for any classic rock fan because of the pitures, old guitars, and album covers all over the walls it is the life.

Reviews.Title: “It was one seriously incredible birthday celebration!”
Reviews.Author: sdchick12
Reviews.Content: The Rock Royalty Crew were an absolute pleasure to work with - Christian made sure that my friends and I were taken care of the entire night and worked with a local restaurant to get us in for dinner. I was expecting a good time as always at the Hard Rock, but to know that everything was taken care of and having a drink waiting for me when I arrived was awesome! I will definitely be visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Living Like a Rock Star at The Hard Rock San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Nokidshavetwolabs
Reviews.Content: Our Thanksgiving plans feel through this year, so we decided to stay downtown with some friends at the Hard Rock in downtown San Diego. We all have been there before, but never had the chance to stay. We arrived Thanksgiving afternoon and things were quite, so we settled in and headed out to find some food. Some places were open and were able to have a wonderful dinner and drinks. The next day, we planned on attending the Charger's Block Party that was only a block from the Hard Rock. The energy was building as fans started to arrive... The Hard Rock was becoming ground zero! We discovered some problems with our room's sound system and called the front desk. Two sound technicians were at our door in minutes and quickly found the loose cords! They were also Charger fans attending the block party later that night. My girlfriend and I stayed in a "Rock Star" suite and our friends in a "Regular" room. Both rooms were awesome with all toys for an adult's night out. We did see some families with children out for the holiday weekend, but we all agreed this property caters mainly to adults. Drinks at the two bars are a bit pricey...$10.00 for a cocktail??? No thanks we "Brown bagged ours". The Charger's Block Party was a blast, and later it seemed that everyone ended up by the pool at Float to continue into the night. All guests of the hotel can get on the VIP list to both clubs at the hotel. That will save you the $20.00 cover they try to charge... you'll need it for the drinks! That's downtown I guess. Over all, it was a blast! Good food, location and a terrific staff maked the Hard Rock a favorite for the San Diego local! Go chargers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent party hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdotwilson
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of 8 friends for annual Football trip weekend. We stay in two of the hard rock suites. The hotel staff was awesome, they treated my entire group excellent and the environment of the hotel set the perfect mood for an all out party weekend. I would recommend this hotel if you are staying in San Diego and planning on having good time and enjoying the downtown scene. Would not recommend , if you were just planning on relaxing. It would be a waste.... the hotel has so much to offer. But the beds are extremely comfortable, especially if your a little hungover. Can be a little pricey, but the 207 Bar has drink "buy backs", which I thought was great for an upscale club/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very fun room nice view cool furniture and martinis”
Reviews.Author: StetsonBob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend while traveling Southern California. They room we rented I think is also used as a time share the furniture was heavy and very high quality and very trendy. The art was a backlit large photo of a close-up of a Gibson electric guitar. The bar had a shaker with Bong Vodka and a sign saying Drink Me while next to it was a mixer with a sign saying "Mix Me". Very creative. Downstairs was an excellent Asian Fusion restaurant and I cant recall the name at this time. The staff was friendly and attentive. If you are a fan of the rock music era you'll enjoy the Hard Rock Hotel. Just the memorialbila on the walls is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel ROCKED!”
Reviews.Author: Reggieroosmom
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel has exceptional customer service, excellent rooms, excellent atmosphere. Every company should model their customer service after how the company does!!!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service!”
Reviews.Author: dctravDc
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel was great. The rooms were modern and clean, as were the facilities such as the lobby, the gym, and the spa. We visited one of the restaurants and one of the clubs at the hotel, and were impressed by both. But the most noteworthy element of our stay was the graciousness of the staff and their eagerness to make our stay as enjoyable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for the bathtubs....”
Reviews.Author: Iwantmytub
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. However, they have a bait and switch scheme going on where they offer you a great rate for a suite but then it does not have the ammenities promised when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “very cool room - not necessarily pratical”
Reviews.Author: krisspy
Reviews.Content: Travelled to SD for a few days - stayed at the hotel and got the king suite room. It was really nice and modern in there - what you would expect for a HArd Rock. Based on the reviews on Trip Advisor - we requested for a room AWAY from all the club noise - and we got what we asked for! The room was great - but a bit unpractical. The bathroom was cool with rainforest headgear but just not very useful. The bathroom was separate from the shower with the sink in the middle - everything will be heard when you use the bathroom! And there was no place to hang your face towels , towels etc.. ANd lastly, since there are clubs in that hotel - expect alot of club goers walking in and out of your hotel at night. Oftentimes they will wander towards the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Zoezer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference at the Convention Center. The location could not be better! We loved the cool modern decor and tastefully displayed memorabilia. Our Rock Star Silver suite was really great - floor to ceiling windows on 2 sides, beautiful decor with multi-head shower and whirlpool bath, great video and audio system. Though very spacious, the storage space for clothing was surprisingly limited. The staff were helpful. We enjoyed meals at Nobu and Maryjane's. Will be my hotel of choice in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “22 of us partied like Rock Stars ... the Hard Rock Staff was great to work with.”
Reviews.Author: californiadreamer_9
Reviews.Content: Great place to host an event - everything went off perfectly, couldn't of asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, but no Rock Star treatment”
Reviews.Author: hsblendo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for a girls' weekend and I dubbed this the Pop Rock hotel. Like Hard Rock Cafes everywhere, there was a rock and roll facade without much authenticity to back up the experience. The decor is fun and fashionable, and the room had some nice touches like a rain shower head and balcony overlooking Petco park. But the little touches weren't there - the toilet got clogged for no reason (although engineering promptly responded and fixed it) and the shower didn't drain when we used the rain shower head. We ordered a bottle of red wine and got white (and late). We were told the $17 internet was an optional charge and at check-out found out it's not optional. (Just add it to the room then!) The hotel touts that guests get on the VIP list at their two clubs/bars, but you have to check in by 10. (That's *not* VIP, that's just a comp for early birds.) The pool seemed very "meh" (we had drinks at the pool bar so didn't see the pool scene during the day, but the space was pretty unimpressive). The pluses: great location right at the gaslamp, Petco, and across from the convention center. I thought the breakfast at Mary Jane's was great and loved the hip retro-diner feel of the place. Overall the room was very comfortable with good linens (but needed a blanket or two). And we had a really great time. Good place for bachelor/bachelorette parties and the like. If you're going with a family, romantic time, or looking for a luxurious resort experience, you might be able to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for business (or comfort!)”
Reviews.Author: TKasper2009
Reviews.Content: Our company booked this hotel for a large annual conference. The hotel is visually very stunning but to actually have to live in one of the rooms for four days was not pleasant. There was no desk or place to put a laptop (or get ready). The bathroom did not even have one electrical plug, I crawled around for several minutes looking everywhere before I realized they really didn't have one (but they did provide a hairdryer!) the bathroom area was very modern and placed right in the middle of the room with very little between the toilet and the rest of the room (a very thin frosted door that doesn't lock). I ended up on the very extensive bar that dominated the living area on a very modern backless stool hunkered over my laptop trying to return emails. This was also my location for blowdrying my hair and getting ready. They didn't even supply a courtesy bottle of water. The 'Flat' water available was something like $12. I will never ever be back! I never missed the Hilton so much.... I will say that the staff was very friendly and helpful but it didn't make up for those rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, great nightlife, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel85
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to stay in San Diego. The location is ideal as you can walk to anything including the marina, the Padres stadium, restaurants and the trolley. It is in the heart of the Gas Lamp quarter, which is where you want to be when staying in downtown San Diego. The atmosphere at the Hard Rock is exactly what you would expect. The incredible staff will treat you like a rock star. From valet parking to a relaxing check in process, all of the details are taken care of. You also feel immediately energized when walking into the lobby- the decor is trendy modern and there is always a great song playing. The music of your choice is playing in your hotel room when you enter, which is a great personal touch. If you want to be part of the downtown San Diego nightlife, it all happens at the Hard Rock. As a guest, you have unlimited access to the bars, restaurants and clubs in the Hard Rock. In summary, this is the only place I will stay in San Diego. It has everything.

Reviews.Title: “rock & roll style business class”
Reviews.Author: amiloryan
Reviews.Content: I had a mid week stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego and it was fantastic. My suite was perfect and the staff was extremely accommodating. I forgot that I was on a business trip as soon I checked in. Dinner at Nobu, which is in the hotel could not have been better. If you are going to be in SD then you need to check out the Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Very Modern Rooms”
Reviews.Author: FromCA
Reviews.Content: Did not use Hotel parking but decided to save some money and parked directly behind the hotel. Staff was friendly upon arrival. Room was very modern with great views of the Gaslamp Quarter. Within walking distance to many bars, clubs and restaurants. In the evening went to 207 lounge and no cover charge for hotel guest. Overall great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kick azz...”
Reviews.Author: worldtard
Reviews.Content: Hard-core fun at the Hard Rock, what else would you expect? Killer bars, great atmosphere. Central to everything in the gaslamp!

Reviews.Title: “Rock Star Treatment at the Hard Rock Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jen019
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! From the great location in the Gaslamp Quarter to the fabulous concierge service, we had a great stay at the Hard Rock. The rooms were swanky, and the rainwater shower was awesome. No need to rent a car when staying here..we were within walking distance or Trolley ride from everywhere we wanted to go. In fact, I definitely recommend buying a day pass for the Trolley (there is a stop just across the street from the hotel). We also took the Coronado Island Ferry (it leaves every 2 hours from the pier directly behind the convention center..again, across the street from the hotel) over to Coronado Island and spent the day hanging at the beach. My only complaint about our stay was that the hotel was renovating 2 rooms direcly above our room, and the workers started hammering at 9AM one morning. A call to the front desk stopped the noise, but it still woke us up.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastoc Design hotel at perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: robtk
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful design hotels we have stayed at. We stayed in one of the suites. It was large, clean, comfortable and wonderfully decorated. We loved this room, which has a different layout from most hotelrooms we have seen. The entire hotel is really a design hotel, and does not look like the Hard Rock Cafes you know. In fact, there isn’t even one in the hotel (a few blocks down the road you’ll find the HRC). We didn’t have dinner or breakfast so I can’t comment on that. The pool is a bit small, so when the hotel is full the pool is probably a very busy place. When we visited the hotel it was quiet. BTW, while we had a nice lunch at the bar next to the pool, we watchedMatthew McConaughey giving some interviews! That explained the security around the pool and poolbar :-) The location of the hotel is also perfect: downtown San Diego, in the gaslamp quarter with numerous bars and restaurants within walking distance. Also, the Padres stadium is 1 block away. All in all: you don’t have to be bored when you stay here. Was there nothing negative? No, although the hallways in the hotel need some new paint: many scratches on the walls. But once you’re in your room: wow!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but noisy on Saturday”
Reviews.Author: fishr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a convention at the Convention Center. The location is great. It's acroos the street from the Convention Center and the area is full of restaurants. My one complaint is that between the street noise and drunken idiots returning to their rooms at 3 AM I didn't get much sleep on Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best ...”
Reviews.Author: AssociatedPress
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HR Hotel this past weekend (Oct. 2-4) for the Giants v. Padres series. First, the location is primed, a short two block walk to the ballpark, and at the corner of the famed Gaslamp Quarter District. Second, the hotel itself is sweet - this is not your typical hotel - it emits cool where ever you go. The rooms are nicely appointed and fits in with the rest of the hotel. I also had the chance to use the gym, and it had just enough equipment to fulfill my workout routine, also the bars at the hotel (207 and Float) were equally as cool and inspiring. In fact, after Saturday's night game, half of the Giants team came into 207 for drinks. The only downer, and yes, no hotel is perfect - was the check in process, only one person was working the desk, and the line was about five deep. Thought they could have brought someone out then. Also, I would not suggest this hotel to someone that is, ummmm, you know, OLD. This hotel really serves and caters to a younger crowd ... so if you like walking into a quiet lobby, then you might consider another property.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you wear Ed Hardy T-shirts and party all night”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego for a conference and overall had a good experience. Staff: Very friendly and professional staff. They are consistently trained to provide a high level of service, although you do notice that many of them, if they are not providing service, have their heads down looking at their phones as they furiously text message their friends. If they looked up more, they might see more service opportunities. However, still, very good service. Facilities: The design is very interesting and engaging. Great use of videos, lighting and neat furniture. Of course, the memorabilia everywhere is great and you’d often see people stopping to look at displays on the wall. The bed was comfortable and I loved the shower! Only issue with the bed is that they are on platforms that stick out, and although the corners of the platforms are padded, I bumped into or tripped over the corners all the time. The pool area and party deck on the 4th floor are really neat. The gym is a decent size. I didn’t use the spa but it looked nice. Highlights: The location of this place is great. Right across from the convention center, a 10-15 minute stroll down the marina promenade to Seaport Village, a block from Petco Park and right at the entrance to the Gaslamp Quarter. Derrick, the guy who checked me in, was terrific and the housekeeping staff did a good job of cleaning up after me and the party animals who ran amok. Areas for improvement: The signage in the hallways is very hard to read. The lighting is dim and the signs are very small in dark metal tones set against brown walls. My eyesight is pretty good, but I still had to get up close to read which way to the gym or verify the room number. I also had two different young people ask me which way to go in the hallway because they couldn’t see the signs. More direction at the front desk would be helpful when there is a crowd because it’s not always clear which of the little pods that serve as the front desk is open. The biggest concern I had was the noise level late at night. After the bars closed on two nights, it sounded like the party moved into the hallway right outside my room. That was confirmed the next morning when I saw a lot of feathers and other detritus outside in the hallway. There’s not much you can do when 10-15 drunken youngsters are yelling, singing, smoking and carousing in the hallway. It didn’t last long so they would have been gone by the time security came up to investigate but there were numerous groups of them coming in over the course of a few hours and the combined effect added up to about 2 hours of lost sleep. Overall impression: The Hard Rock has a great setup and a true focus on the customer experience. The facilities are nice and the staff is very professional. If you like a place that is very much a “scene”, you will not be disappointed. If you’re staying here on the weekend and you go to sleep before 3:00 am, you may think you’re in the wrong place. I’m in my early 40’s, and looking at the people who were walking around the hotel in bikinis and swim trunks who were young enough to be my children, I just don’t think I’m the target demographic. I like to sleep at night and this isn't the place to do that. Nearby transportation: There is a trolley stop right outside the hotel that can connect you with downtown, old town or even Tijuana! Additionally, the city bus (#992) stops at 4th Avenue and Broadway, just a 10 minute walk from the hotel. That ride takes less than 20 minutes and is only $2.25. There is also a luggage rack on the bus. If you’re carrying on, it’s an easy way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Whoa.”
Reviews.Author: BDogTravels
Reviews.Content: I spent one day/night at the Hard Rock on my trip from home to San Diego then to Los Angeles. I must say I was extremely happy with my stay for the brief time that I was there. First thing that I noticed aside from the cool contemporary architecture and digital signage was the staff. They quickly got me setup with my room at 11:00 AM. Beyond that, they were very courteous to me. The room was awesome. Bed was incredibly comfy. Minibar, stocked fridge and snacks, any alcohol you could ask for. Great view of the poolside from my POV. Chair was interesting looking, but more decorative than practical. Shower was big with glass windows, and rained down on you versus your typical shower head. Breakfast was delicious. Only downside was although they had an HDTV, there wasn't any HD programming. I kind of expected more from that, but they also had a ton of connections to hook up your computer, iPod, or gaming system, which was a nice addition. Hotel's location was also a big plus. Right across the street from the convention center, minutes from beaches and the bridge to Coronado. At night when I returned, my bed was lit very elegantly with LED lights, the rest of the room darkened. Flick of a light switch highlighted just the right spots in the room. If only I had a date! This place would be a perfect little spot for some.. you know.. that "romantic" stuff :) (the hotel also provides some goodies in this area, which I'll leave to your imagination, but I will say the scented candles are a nice touch) *Sigh, if only I had a date... Best night's sleep in the longest time. I sincerely wanted to stay another, but if I return to San Diego in the future, I know where I'll be staying. Thanks Hard Rock :D

Reviews.Title: “Rock out at the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: 1connection
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day, three night stay at the San Diego Hard Rock Hotel. The weekend can simply be summarized as, well....fantastic! I normally don't give reviews 5's across the board, but this place deserved it. Check-In - fast, courteous, and very friendly check-in. Derek did an awesome job at making us feel welcome from the moment we reached the property, and remembered us even the next day. Great customer service! Rooms - we had two studio rooms. One overlooking the pool and the other overlooking the Padres's stadium. 10th floor was nice and our room had a small patio on it with two chairs and a table...great place to hang out while getting ready for the evening and watching the action at the pool. Clean, contemporary, straight lines and soothing color scheme. Great shower and Aveda products to boot. 50" Hi-Def TV with about a dozen music channels to listen to. Room service is complete around 3-4 PM. On-premise food / beverages - MaryJane's is a diner on the first floor. Great food at reasonable prices. They have an awesome happy hour with drinks about 1/2 price as compared to the other bars on-premise. I also ate some appetizers at Float / pool...the humus and pita chips was the bomb! At $9 I was a bit nervous, but there was enough for 2-3 people and was very fresh...the pita chips were served warm and just grilled. Drink prices at the pool / Float during the day were what I expected...about $5-7 for a beer. Mixed drinks were more. Specialty drinks at ~$14. Bars - Multiple, awesome choices. As a hotel guest, call down to the concierge before 8 PM to get on the lists for both Float and 207, then show up to the bars before 10 PM and have your hand stamped for access to either all night without having to wait in line; and let me tell you, the lines are long! So utilize this comp. Float is a chic outdoor patio club/lounge on the 4th floor adjacent to the pool and they tend to play techno / house music at night. On the first floor off of the lobby is 207, its a dimly lit, deep woody vibe to it and they play hip-hop. You can get bottle service at either...entry bottle at ~$325. Float stays open and plays music until ~1:30 AM, so if your room faces the pool, just realize that its hard to fall alsleep early, but that said, if you want to go to bed early, then this probably isn't the place for you anyways. In general we spent more time at Float, as we liked the outdoor vibe a bit better, but they are both great and both are open during the day on the weekend for the sports enthusiast who needs a place to watch a few games. I also want to give a huge "job well done" to a few of the Float staff members who made the trip and visit worth while - Erica, Danielle, and Natalie! Thanks to the three of you for being so nice and providing some of the best pool / bar servicing that I've seen in all of my travels around the world. Hard Rock staff, you have some great employees! Location - simply perfect. The HRH is located at the cap end of the Gaslamp Quarter right in front of the convention center. Nobu is connected and there are multiple restaurants to try in the area. Venture out and sample a few things outside of the hotel...it will only make you appreciate even more how great the HRH can be with the right, open, and carefree attitude. $17 facility charge - yes there is a $17 resort charge, but it covers your internet / wireless connections and fitness center. Not a big deal, and honestly, I didn't mide it at all. The fitness center had great, new equipment and I even got in 2 great workouts during my stay. Didn't try the spa, but one of my friends did and had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with a great vibe”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoTrvllvr
Reviews.Content: I came to stay in the Gaslamp to enjoy downtown with my girlfriends the night before searching for a place to move in the San Diego area. This hasn't been my first stay at the Hard Rock hotel and it won't be my last. From the moment you arrive at the hotel, the staff is eager to greet and help you with anything you need. The hotel is in the heart of the Gaslamp district and it is extremely easy to walk to any other restaurant, hotel, restaurant, or even the convention center. It is also less than a block from Petco Stadium. The rooms are a good size and decorated very nicely. Once night came, the hotel's life became even more apparent. The two lounges/bars located within the hotel were filled with people enjoying their nights. The staff was very helpful in directing us how to get into the bars (no line and no fee for guests). I would highly recommend the Hard Rock hotel to anyone who is interested in having a good time, both day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a fun evening, not so much for a romantic evening.”
Reviews.Author: noahsmarine
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun at this hotel. The rock royalty staff, especially Amanda were so helpful. They took care of our dinner reservations, as well as our guest list access to the clubs. We ate dinner at the hotel's premiere restaurant, Nobu, and they have the BEST yellowfin tuna sashimi I've ever eaten. We asked our server what her recommendations were for us to try for dinner and everything she recommended was really excellent. The only down side was the restaurant was so loud, like a club. We were there for our 10th wedding anniversary and it was kind of a bummer to have to yell over the table to hear each other, but you may just want to deal with it for the good food. I would recommend ANYONE to stay here if they are looking for a great Gaslamp location, just maybe not for a really romantic time. Thanks Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “They really know how to treat people well...”
Reviews.Author: PiratesSayARRR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in late August for our wedding night. The day before I had gone into see the concierge about a possible upgrade and also getting 30 people into their 207 club. I was eventually called back by a service manager to which he assured me everything would be taken care of including a complimentary upgrade. The suite was outstanding. It had a separate bedroom and livingroom and a wrap around balcony. Absolutely superb. I brought 30 of our friends from the reception to Club 207 to which I had a guestlist of plus 30 at the door. No problem getting everyone in and no pressure to purchase bottle service. Fantastic Hotel and Fantastic Staff...this is what the service industry is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel guests should come first”
Reviews.Author: gbv2112
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from the Hard Rock and I was not very impressed. It was our first time to ever experience the Gaslamp and chose Hard Rock for it's location. As soon as we checked in, we turned on the TV, so we can listen to the music channels. We tried both TV's and neither one of them worked. I kept hearing about people hitting there ankles on the bed corners and I'l be damned, I did it three times. What also pissed me off was that they charged me 17 bucks to use their facilities, which is horrible. I was there to relax and not work out. They shouldn't be charging you unless you use them. The one thing that really ticked me off was, we decided to go to the pool to relax and have a drink around 9:30 and were not allowed in because we didn't have club attire. I told him we were guests, but he said that doesn't matter. Either you change or you don't get in. So, what is the 17 dollar charge for again? I can't even get into the pool. I didn't even bother wih the downstairs bar. They would have denied me there too. I understand that San Diego/Hard Rock brings in a younger crowd, but to put the party goers first, before their guests who want to be leisure, is absolutely wrong. We had to walk down the street to have a drink and when we got back, I must of had about 5 peope fall on me because they were drunk. I am in my 30's, so I know how to have fun, but when I fork out hundreds of my hard earned dollars to stay somewhere, I should be able to go where I want within the hotel, without being told I am not dressed for the occasion. They could of at least told me in advance, but that must be their marketing scheme. Thanks for listening.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: UNLVforme
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Hard Rock Hotel - San Diego when I visited in July 2009. The room was a great size. The decor of the hotel was fantastic. The hotel is in a great location to the Gaslamp Quarter. It is extremely convenient coming from San Diego Airport. The service was great - everyone was so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hot Spot - Best of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: pico18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock San Diego for a quick trip this past weekend. We are return visitors to the hotel and our stay couldn't have been better! We had an amazing couples massage at the Rock Spa (really, one of the best massages I've ever had and such a cool spa - small and intimate with a very cool vibe). Later, we dined at the always-perfect Nobu and ended our evening with a couple of drinks at the very popular rooftop bar. The next morning we had a quick brunch at Maryjane's - also in the hotel. Our stay was excellent from start to finish. The rooms are great too - extremely comfortable beds (in fact, I am trying to figure out how to order one). We will always stay at the Hard Rock when visiting San Diego. Can't wait to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Seeker64
Reviews.Content: Arrival and check-in was a breeze. Staff added to the experience by being professional and efficient while adding a bit of irreverant rocker flare. Perhaps the best guest room I have ever stayed in, very comfortable. Have never seen such a cool bathroom. Enjoyed late night meals at Mary Janes. The hotel was very busy and the bars are obviously "the place to be" in San Diego. The staff did a great job of taking care of hotel guests and ensuring that the bar scene didn't interrupt your hotel stay. Make sure you allow enough time for valet parking car retrieval on Friday and Saturday nights. Front door can get hectic with the nightlife scene.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: skeeteratredhouse
Reviews.Content: While in a great location (gaslamp district) with decent rooms, this place was not worth the price--espeically when you add in the $17 per night "fee" and the $35 per night parking on top of the quoted room price--you're not gettting much for what you pay for compared with deal you can get on priceline at nicer places in the same area. We should have known better traveling with young kids staying at a place like this, but the website does specifically say "families warmly welcomed" The kicker was the number of times we were woken up each night by 20 somethings having parties in their rooms...a policy the hotel says is prohibited, but was in no way enforced. When we complained and asked to check out one day early (giving them 24 hours notice before we intended to depart) we were told we would be required to pay a early check out "fee" which equalled the full night stay. So, we stayed, enduring another annoying evening of squealing bachelorettes and drunken bachelors. After being out of the room ALL DAY, we returnd at around 3:00 for "nap time." Annoyed as we were that our room hadn't been cleaned, we decided we would be fine for the night. We put the "do not distrub" sign up and put the baby down for a nap. No sooner had he fallen asleep than housekeeping CALLED the room to inform us they were going home for the day and if we needed anything we should tell them now. How nice of them not to disturb us. So much for nap time. Between no naps and all the noise at night, we were a tired, cranky family. If you're in your 20's and looking for a drunken hook-up--by all means, this is your place. Everybody else....stay away! Far, far away!

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway for the weekend but watch out for "charges" along the way”
Reviews.Author: crabfish29
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, 4th floor is quiet. Stayed mid-week so avoided the noise problems and crowds. Watch out for the mini bars inside the room! I opened up what I thought was a refrigerator and a light and buzzer went off. I quickly closed it. Sure enough, when I checked my credit card charges, $11.50 had been charged! I called and it was a mni-bar charge. I am in the process of getting it taken off. It's a racket. Next, be careful in the hotel eatery. The waiter seemed "high". HE insisted the bill be put on the room tab. He inserted about a 100% tip written in for himself on the check. If that wasn't enough, he got the order wrong and had to ask again and again what we had ordered. All in all, I'd say the place is set up to catch the customer unaware and put extra charges on the tabs.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is an overpriced and over trendy hotel with nothing to offer”
Reviews.Author: Costanza33
Reviews.Content: Where to start? I would not recommend staying here unless you wear Affliction or Ed hardy t shirts. It is that trendy hair gell, sun glasses in the club kind of place. People think they are better than you because their t shirt with rhinestones in it costs more than your life. The place is run by kids. I didnt see one person over the age of 25 there the entire time. When checking in, there was only 2 people working the counter which took about 35 min to finally get checked in. The Valet is 32 dollars a day, The rooms are incredibley small for the large price you pay. And Im still putting ice on my shin from the 10 times I hit it on the sharp protruding corner of the bed. There is no bathroom door, just a see through sliding glass door where people can easily see you defecate or get out of the shower. There are only ice machines on about 2 or 3 floors of the hotel, so you have to hike up a few floors to find ice. You can also hear the music from the club all the way up on the 4th floor when you walk out of your room. at 2am Then lastly : I WARN ANYONE THAT EVEN THINKS ABOUT STAYING HERE : MAKE SURE YOU GET PROOF OF YOUR CHECKOUT TIME. THEY CHARGED MY CREDIT CARD 115 DOLLARS AND SAID I DIDNT CHECK OUT UNTIL 215 WHICH IS TOTALLY BOGUS! I GAVE THE VALET MY TICKET AT 1145AM AND HE ASKED US IF WE WERE CHECKING OUT WHICH WE CONFIRMED. THEN 2 DAYS LATER I SEE A CHARGE FOR AN EXTRA HALF DAY! THEN TRYING TO CALL THE HOTEL IS LIKE A MAZE. YOU JUST KEEP GETTING BOUNCED FROM VOICEMAIL TO VOICEMAIL. THERE ARE NO ADULTS TO TALK TO. ITS A SCAM. This hotel is shady as hell. And I am not some elderly adult who hates young people and parties. I am 25 years old, and like to drink all that fun stuff. But unless your a conformist who wears graffic t shirts and watches MMA and UFC, stay away. Save your money and goto the Marriott. This hotel should be bull dozed and forgotten

Reviews.Title: “Rock royalty!!!”
Reviews.Author: jessicac411
Reviews.Content: I had my 21st bday at the hard rock hotel in san diego and i have to say i had the best night! The moment we checked in the staff were very friendly and helpful! the room was amazing the decor was modern and super clean! We went to float which is one of the clubs outside, it was alot of fun and had a very cool atmosphere! I definitely go back again and I recommend the hard rock hotel to all my friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “You can be ANY age & enjoy the HARD ROCK!!!”
Reviews.Author: cincostar
Reviews.Content: I've read numerious reviews on here saying that if your over 40 this place isnt for you. I think that is just plain crazy!! I took a trip with my 57 year old parents during 4th of July weekend. So you know it had to be crazy busy with tons of people/noise/partying. They absolutely LOVE the hard rock and now everytime they are in San Diego they don't want to stay any other place. We had a great 2 queen suite and an awesome balcony. We are from LA and of course Dodger fans so we got to see all the fans walk into the stadium and had a great time chanting "LETS GO DODGERS" out the balcony with a bunch of other dodger fans. Also got to see the awesome firework display. My friend and I also ate at Mary Janes. They gave us undercooked pancakes but brought out cooked (very yummy) ones right away. if you a guest at the hotel its so easy to get in and out of the clubs. Went to the pool club on Friday night and partyed with Dodgers catcher Russell Martin. I love this place! One thing I was dissapointed on...they didnt have a rolling stone in the room! :( Other then that I looooooved it and will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard rock suite was awesome! Ask for room 643”
Reviews.Author: racecargirl911
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a hard rock suite, Room 643. We loved it! It was close to the elevator ( no noise, very quiet actually) It was very spacious and had a great view of the Woodstock deck that the pool is on, so this room is great for people watching. If you dont want to people watch than just close the curtains and doors and "poof" it like its not even there.The good thing about this room is although it doesn't have a full balcony it still has a "french balcony" with sliding doors so you can feel like your outside in the action or not, its up to you and from what i can see alot of the rooms don't have sliding doors that even open to the outside. The Room Has 2 large flat screen TV's, one in the living and one in the bedroom area as well as a couch,wet bar, separate bath and shower and a really cool chair that I loved. This hotel is close to everything, we walked to breakfast,lunch and dinner.It is not as expensive as you may expect, if you are gonna stay here, is a great value. We will be back! Also,The Bed is very comfortable and the bath products Aveda ( my favorite) are definitely a luxury at hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Star treatment in the Hard Rock Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nursjj18
Reviews.Content: I did a build your own vacation through www.seaworld.com and stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in the Gas Lamp District of downtown San Diego. The hotel is rockin to say the least! Its decor is modern and swanky. The service was beyond excellent! Upon checkin we were asked which music we would like playing in our room, a bellman took our stuff from our car stayed with us through check in and set us up in our room also getting us ice. Our room was spectacular! Two large flat screen TV's were playing our music of choice, the decor was ultra modern and the room was super spacious. We had a King Suite with a fabulous rainfall shower and an very comfy bed. The pool and its bar were also great! The lobby bar and the diner in the lobby area were also jammin'! We of course did the tourist thing with sea world and the san diego zoo. I recommend both if you are visiting the area! We had a great time walking down the gas lamp district and exploring our large choices for dining and cocktails. We also did a hornblower dinner dancing cruise in the bay. It was great! The food was good, service was good and it was a relaxing way to see the bay, Coronado Island and the bridge at sunset. The parking is minimal on the street but I would recommend vallet parking with the hotel for $32/day with in & out privileges. It made our trip much less stressful and the vallet staff were excellent and helpful with directions. Overall, our experience at the Hard Rock was amazing! It was even better than I had hoped it would be starting with the location, its decor, service, and fun atmosphere! I would recommend this for couples and friends. Its Rockin'!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock is the hotel to stay at in the Gaslamp for Bachlorette parties.”
Reviews.Author: sprinksSiliconValley
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hard Rock with a group of friends for a bachelotte party. We had a fabuolus time, were treated like Rock Royalty and were able to relax while there. The staff is wonderful, the pool is beautiful and the rooms were cute and boutique but not over the top with Hard Rock theaming. I also visited the spa for a massage and facial, and would highly recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: abenitaj
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very clean, convenient, and comfortable. The decor in the lobby, the hallways and the rooms was fashionable. The lobby bar and the poolside bar areas were cool and "funky". The bathroom was spacious. Mall shopping, resturants, and public transportation was within walking distance. The baseball stadium was right across the street. Our room overlooked the stadium and the train track however, we did not hear any noise from either. We would definitely stay here again as well as recommend to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “If your bedtime is 2 AM and wake-up time is 6 AM it might work for you”
Reviews.Author: LAWheelsUp
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with chic, boutique-style decor. Stayed in a suite. Well laid out room with plenty of storage. Fluffy towels but robes had seen better days. Both flat screen TVs were not working properly. Room service prompt with serviceable food at correct temps. Gym was clean with decent equipment. The problem was the noise. From a raging party at the hotel one night to street noise on other nights and garbage trucks at 6:30 am, you will not get to sleep early and you will not sleep late. Hotel actually brought earplugs to my room on request. They keep them on hand. They should double-pane windows instead. Staff well-trained in being extremely polite and gracious -- as long as they didn't have to perform under stress. I had to get my room keycard remagnetized at midnight and the desk clerk was so consumed with explaining to the two men ahead of me why they could not check in and pay all cash that he made me wait an eternity for a simple remag, telling me curtly, "We can only deal with one guest at a time." It didn't occur to him that they weren't actually guests and I was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good staff, Great for Party Time!”
Reviews.Author: GetOutThereSD
Reviews.Content: We have are San Diego locals, and have been to the Hard Rock a few times. The decor is very hip and modern. The hotel staff courteous, young and attractive. Most staff members are college students who do not have a long term investment in the job. This type of staff is fun and energetic, but has little interest in the job of solving guest issues. Every time we were next to the front desk, multiple parties were having room and service issues. It seems that a manager is very hard to locate. This is a very nice new hotel if you are looking for an All Night Party. The hotel floors are always full of guests on party nights. People book a room hand have large groups pack in to the rooms. There are rules about how many people and limits on outside alcohol, but these are not enforced by the staff. Do not get me wrong, this place is fun, it feels like Las Vegas. It will keep you up all night. Lucky for us locals, we can just go back home and get some sleep. I did feel bad for other guests from out of town who selected this hotel for a vacation and not a bachelor party. There are much better vacation spots in the same area. I have to give it a poor rating as a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “love love love”
Reviews.Author: saraOakland
Reviews.Content: Im very pleased with my saty @the hard rock before i decide to stay in this hotel i check tirp advisor review and it was not look good at all , so i took the chance to find out my self and it was the most incredibe stay in SD professional staff we were so happy with the every think .I had the pleasure to meet the assistant director BRYIAN GADD when my flight was cancelld so i wont to stay later than my check out he was so nice that he did every thing he could to make his gust happy and pleased thank u bryian i really appreciate it from the housekeeping to the valet parking .I will definitely go back all the time i dont have to look for another hotel lool i know where to stay ,

Reviews.Title: “Most fabulous stay at this incredible property that offers it all!”
Reviews.Author: Lailastar
Reviews.Content: Myself and 13 other girlfriends heading down to SD for some fun in the sun. Everyone at the Hard Rock made our stay enjoyable. Located perfectly within walking distance to all the action plus offers their own yummy food and hip clubs, you can not go wrong. The poolside cabanas are a must and don't worry if you stay up too late the beds are so comfy you will be able to sleep until noon. Overall at 10+!

Reviews.Title: “Simply awsome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jez200London
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great vibe, great location! Loved the Hard Rock hotel in San Diego. Stayed 3 nights early July, first day was Sunday so caught the Intervention rooftop party that happens every sunday in the summer.. one of the best parties i've ever been to! Highly recommend this. The bar / club in the hotel is also a very cool place to hang out in the evenings and when your done there is a whole host of other places to visit just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “A classy hotel with professional staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: jaxzibit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock twice: once for 3 nights and once for 4 nights. The staff are professional, friendly and prompt - from the check-in desk, to Ground Control (Operator), to the valets. The rooms are very modern and the beds are soooooooo comfortable - I am almost fraid no other hotel I go to will live up to that anymore. And I've seen quite a few hotels both on business and leisure. They have extra high thread count sheets and excellent mattresses. Flat screen TV was great, with good sound system. Especially like the little reading lamp on each side of the headboard - very effectively focused light. It was great to be able to just walk out any night and be in the Gaslamp Quarter for our evening's entertainment. And whenever we drove, the valets put 2 bottles of water in our car and offered directions to wherever we wanted to go. The staff got stressed out during busy times like their summer pool party, but even then remained very accomodating and professional - while waiting for our room they allowed us to freshen up in the spa, and catered to many other requests. Their pool bar area is really well done - breezy and well appointed with couches / lamps / stools. The bartenders are friendly and know their cocktails. I live in Geneva, Switzerland and the fancy rooftop bars here pale in comparison. And the Hard Rock is definitely better than the W any day - the decor is much classier and there is actually a pool at the pool bar. Definitely a great place to party and for those on business travel, right in front of the Convention Center so extremely convenient..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, the staff made the difference”
Reviews.Author: PLTRIPPER
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock for a business seminar and had a great stay. I arrived late and was warmly greeted and check-in went quickly. My room was non-traditional and unique, but a great hotel room none the less. The meeting space was good and we were well attended to. The group meals were excellent. The bar was fun at night and I ate in Maryjane's a few times. MJ's has a great diner setting and menu and Merv at the bar took good care of me and everyone else. My only critique, there is no stopper in the cool sink which makes shaving a pain.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate in service, style, quality and overall perfection”
Reviews.Author: leaveOxnard
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice of a hotel for gaslamp district of San Diego

Reviews.Title: “For those who wish to party, the Hard Rock is for you...”
Reviews.Author: lambtronic
Reviews.Content: Pros - Nice hotel, great singles scene, great bars, great service, well designed Cons - Studio rooms are small, drink prices are way too expensive, valet is expensive We stayed at the hotel for a bachelor party. The entire hotel has a very "outgoing" vibe. Everyone who stays there seems to be on the same page in terms of their definition of fun. NOT A FAMILY HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas vibe and the price tag to go with it”
Reviews.Author: kg32
Reviews.Content: Modern, trendy, cool and rockin' are all accurate when describing the Hard Rock San Diego. This place screams "look at me" with two great bars, a great pool deck and rock music blaring throughout the hotel. The weekend pool and bar scenes mirror that of Vegas with lines, bouncers and trendily dressed/barely dressed patrons. The rooms are very modern and cool with HD flat screen TVs, audio and video inputs for iPods and cameras and a great mini bar with seating. The "Rock Star" suites are incredible with private balconies, a living room and full size bar. The front desk service is fine...unless you need help at 2:00am when there is no one to be found. The Valet staff was very quick and friendly. The location and vibe are the two main reasons to stay at the Hard Rock. Located next to Petco Park, everything within Gaslamp is within walking distance. If a Vegas vibe and Rock Star feel is what you are looking for, the Hard Rock is your place...just be prepared to pay the VIP pass premium.

Reviews.Title: “Why go to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GCNLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to San Diego for the Rock n Roll Marathon and had a blast. The hotel has two great bars. However, you need to be able to deal with loud music in the bar areas. Rooms are comfortable, and the staff was very helpful. Great time to go with friends and its a lot closer than driving to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - Chic look, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Blink123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel and were quite disappointed. The decor was very trendy with plenty of eye candy. The amenities were good, nice pool, nice spa, nice restaurants etc. However, services were ridiculously overpriced and tips and handouts were requested at every corner, depsite the fact that 20% was automatically added to everything. Not to mention the service being terrible - several times I wish I wasn't forced into tipping because they sure didn't deserve it.
