Several staff were very nice, but most were very unfriendly and distant. The also room came with tons of hidden taxes and surcharges which dramatically raised my bill come checkout time. While overall, the hotel was clean, the housekeeping staff did a terrible job with the upkeep of my room and would not replenish soap and shampoo without specifically requesting to. Overall, for the price, I was very disappointed in just about every aspect of this place.

Reviews.Title: “We fell in love with the room – and then Maryjane’s.”
Reviews.Author: tuckerdog08
Reviews.Content: We went down to San Diego for girls’ night out and chose the Hard Rock since the previous reviews said such great things. We had a Hard Rock Suite with the separate living room which was great for getting ready and we could play our iPods through the huge flatscreen TVs. The beds were really comfortable, but the shower takes a little figuring out (at least for us it did). We hit the lobby bar, 207, which was crowded and fun. We then went to The Fleetwood for a few drinks at the recommendation of a co-worker. Famished after a night out, we stopped by Maryjane’s which is thankfully open late. The hash browns and biscuits were AMAZING! The place was really busy, but our waiter was attentive and the food was fast. Our last girls night out was in Vegas at The Hotel, so we had high expectations. The Hard Rock did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “worst birthday i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: lisa01602
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed the hard rock hotel and i was so dissappointed by the staff. they were rude, unhelpfull and they charged me twice for my room. when i noticed they told me it was sunday and there is nothing they can do about it!!!! i have a new baby and this is extreamly hard for me as a struggling mother. i stayed at the hard rock for my birthday and i left in tears, as the managers brushed me off and told me that they hope my next stay there would be better. trust me there will never be another stay, which it is very sad because i love the hard rock in chicago and las vegas. my only point is the service was so bad i will never return agaim or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mozchick23
Reviews.Content: A few girlfriends and I were planning a trip to San Diego for a concert. I was a little hesitant at first because i never stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel before. When we got there we were greeted by the valet parking attendants who were very kind and helpful throughout our whole stay. If we had any questions or concerns they would gladly help us. We walked in for check-in it was pretty fast. I didn't know what to expect because apparently someone was checking in at 530 and their room wasn't ready yet. It was barely being cleaned. I hoped that wouldn't happen to me and it didn't. We got our keys they asked us what kind of music we preffered, til this day i dont understand why they asked us this. Anyway as we went up to our room the halls were decorated with rock n roll memorabilia it was very beautiful. We get to our room, (by the way we reserved a double queen bed hard rock suit), We were so amzzed by the decoration it was very chic, a couch, a lounge chair, 2 flat screen tvs, a fully stocked mini bar with two bar chair facing a large mirror, a blacony with a mid view of the surrounding shops. I loved that we turned up the music on those flat screens as loud as we could without being reprimended for it like other hotels do. I didn't really get to see the pool and the cabanas. By the way we arrived on a Wednesday so it wasn't a big party ambience. The hotel was near walking distance from everything from coffee shops, bars, lounges, ice cream, restaurants, to cigar shops. Checkout was quick you ould check out from the guest services on the flat screen tvs. Overall it was a very good experience. I thought the concierge attendants could of been a little more enthusiastic and helpful. Instead we relied on the valet attendants!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: travelinman619
Reviews.Content: I was planning my wife and I seven year anniversary and I'm glad I never stayed at the Hard Rock. Tues: The personnel at the reservation desk were not only unknowledgeable about the differences between suites; they never actually made my reservation! Thursday morning: When I didn't receive my confirmation email, I called to double check the reservation and it hadn't been made! I made my reservations again, where the reservationist tried to butter me up my asking, "Why are you staying at the Hard Rock? Business? Blah, blah?” I reply, "I'm celebrating my wife and I 7 year wedding anniversary". Not 30 seconds later she asks me, "How long have you been married?” Now I know she is not paying attention. I let it go and later decide I would like to have champagne in the room when we get there. She transfers me to the Concierges desk, which is too busy to take my call. The reservationist gets back on the line and says,” The Concierges desk will call you back and I will email you pictures of the difference between the Hard Rock Silver and Gold Suites”. I reply, “If they are different from the photos on the website?”. Of course, when I get the email they are the same exact photos from the website. Thurs afternoon: I get a call from the Concierges desk and she is talking so fast I can barely understand her. She asks, “Have you been taken care of?” she is obviously busy, (I’m thinking, aren’t you looking at my reservation where it says that I haven’t ordered anything and it’s my 7 year anniversary!?). I reply, “I guess so”. She hangs up, I guess I’m not buying champagne. Fri afternoon: I decide I’ve had enough and call the desk to talk to a supervisor. I get transferred to Luke, the head of Guest Relations, who of course isn’t in. I leave a nice message saying that I I’m considering canceling my reservation and would like to talk to him. When I don’t receive a call by Monday at 3:00pm, I decided to cancel. I’m still waiting on that callback Luke! This hotel has the worst service I’ve ever had across multiple employees at the reservation desk, the concierge’s desk and even the manager of guest relations. Don’t chance it; go to the Ivy, La Valencia, or Hotel Del Coronado if you plan to do something special. The rooms are comparable in price and the service is 10 times better!

Reviews.Title: “We felt like VIP's our entire stay”
Reviews.Author: ccsauce
Reviews.Content: On a scale of 1 -10, we would rate an11! From beginning to end we were treated like 'Rock' Stars. The room was clean, comfortable and had everything we needed. Maryjanes breakfast was excellent. Everything is in walking distance. Concierge recommended the perfect restaurants. The valet remembered us and even washed the bugs off the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel all around”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: Hip and modern hotel but very comfortable. Rooms were clean, bright and comfortable. Of course, a rockin' bar downstairs. I would stay there again. Try to avoid a room right above the bar due to the music at night, though most of the noise is blocked out.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmed with my feeling of satisfaction!”
Reviews.Author: emtchl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hard Rock. Our original intent was to stay there for the evening because we had an event to attend in the area and figured it would be nice to just go to the hotel after the event. From the moment we arrived we were completely impressed with the courteous staff and the enviornment of the hotel. We checked into the hotel and the young lady helping us (Jackie) was delightfully engaging. Upon arriving in the room we were amazed at the size of the suite first but we were completely amazed by the comfort of the suite. The room was bright and chic. My wife is not easy to impress when it relates to hotels. That being said, she was so impressed by the hotel that 45 minutes into our stay, she convinced me to skip the event (which is why we in the area and to enjoy the accomadations instead. We ordered room service and the young man that delivered was funny and insightful as he described our oder and editorialized about the choices that were his favorites ont he menu. Again, my wife is not one that is impressed by hotels and Hard Rock San Diego won her over. After a wonderful evening of relaxation we enjoyed the wonderful offerings of Mary Janes the next morning. When it was time to check out we reluctantly packed and went to valet. I think I heard a sniuffle from my wife as we pulled away. At that point, I realized that we definitely must return for another relaxing stay at Hard Rock San DIego. My kudos to the entire staff there for a job well done. The vibe, the comfort and the hopitality of the place makes it a great place to hang out when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ggutierrez8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed the weekend getaway in San Diego and found the HardRock to be a perfect weeked of relaxation and fun. The hotel is less then a year old and shows really well with the rooms having every upgraded amenity a traveler could ask for in 4+Star hotels. The staff are simply the BEST!!!! A great location in the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, fun and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JoeOH
Reviews.Content: I spent five days at the Hard Rock in mid April and had a great time. The hotel is, as you might expect, high on concept and committed to putting on a very stylish show. This works very well but never becomes overwhelming, largely due to the excellent staff. I have to admit that I was won over immediately on arrival when I was upgraded to a suite but even without this, I would have enjoyed the place. It is perfectly located for anyone wishing to explore the Gaslamp area, it is yards from the convention centre and what seems like inches from local public transport. Food is excellent. I ordered room service one evening and quite honestly couldn't finish it such was the amount of food. Arguably prices are slightly on the high side for certain things (e.g $9 for a bottle of mineral water from the mini-bar) but if you are careful you can avoid the obvious problem items. Great place. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Hard Rock San Diego...”
Reviews.Author: lamontsocal
Reviews.Content: Our most recent stay at the Hard Rock was a combination of business & pleasure (6 nights, including a weekend) - I came in for work for a few days and then my wife and daughter (2.5 yrs. old) joined us. The service is tops - they really take care of you from the second you pull up to the moment you check out and everywhere in between- I travel every week for business and this team is impressive. In addition to the service, the hotel has great modern rooms and amenities, an excellent choice of food fare at/in the hotel (Maryjane's diner, NOBU, Pink berry) including good room service and plenty of social activities (bars, pool, club, fitness club). Choices - that is what we loved and whether you are single, couple, with kids or on business or pleasure - you have choices. If you cant find what you want at the hotel - they will help you find it and the location makes that very easy being right in the gas lamp district. The hotel does transform on the weekend as a hot spot (great people watching...) and it does get louder and "later" BUT - the staff knows it, warns you about it and unless you are sleeping with your window open - it is not that bad... I know I will stay here again for business and will bring my family again - great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in SD!! Hard Rock was the Place to be!!”
Reviews.Author: Kirbear
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock San Diego was beautiful and in the perfect location. My husband attended a conference and I just went along because I had never been to California. The hotel is in the heart of the Gaslamp area downtown and right across the street from the convention center. There was so much to walk to, you really don't need a car at all. The room was clean and very nice (we had a studio king). It was also the place to be on the weekends. Both of the bars turn into clubs at night and the lines to get into the clubs were insane. If you are staying at the hotel you get in for free and can skip the line. They also had a pool party on Sunday called Intervention, which is like the Vegas hotel's Rehab. The restaurants in the hotel were also great- Nobu and Mary Janes. The only thing that I thought was a little odd was that they immediately charge you $250 per night for "incidentals" on top of what your room rate was. No one at the front desk told us this and we used our debit card to pay, so the next day, I noticed $2700 was taken out of our account from Hard Rock. I called the front desk and they were very nice about it and explained that they immediately put a hold on the entire amount of your stay plus $250 per night for incidentals and then at the end of the stay, they actually only charge you for what you charged to your room. We were fine with it, but i couldn't help but think about people who used their debit card not knowing how much would be charged to it and then been totally screwed if Hard Rock was holding $2700 of their cash until the end of their trip when their room stay would only have cost them $1200. Anyway, so the point is to use a credit card if you don't want your cash tied up. All in all, the hotel stay was great!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel that truly "ROCKS" in the Gaslamp!!!”
Reviews.Author: jfinley
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hardrock Hotel with friends in downtown San Diego. They hit every aspect of the stay perfectly! From the arrival - Valet parking right at the front doors to the seemless VIP check in process where we were served cocktails of our choice to the personal escort / tour of the hotel and our room. Once checked into this beautiful suite with all the ameneties and then some - we headed to "Moonstruck" the pool bar and had a few more drinks and enjoyed the city views with a friendly social crowd of beautiful people! Dinner in Nobu - phenomenal sushi with a fun atmosphere and 1st class service!!! Back to the hotel room - huge with big screen TV's with HD for the sport lover which I am... The Master's (Augusta National) never looked so beautiful, which I why I stayed in the next day and ordered my own private feast from room service which was spectacular. Overall the Hardrock Hotel is the only hotel I'lll stay at in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: mommy3x
Reviews.Content: I realize my stay was almost a year ago, so I don't know how relevant it is now. Maybe things have changed/improved. I've visit SD every summer for 4-5 days and have stayed at many downtown hotels. I wanted to try HR since it had just opened and looked nice. I booked a Hard Rock Suite and for the price, expected a lot more. The previous occupant must've had great time - huge gouge in the wall, red paint(?) on curtains, missing privacy curtain (separating bedroom/bathroom/LR), lights didn't work. Glad I only stayed 1 night. Pros: great location from conv. ctr; trendy decor, nice bathroom/shower. Cons: staff didn't seem to care about addressing/fixing room defects. Same response upon check-out. Valet parking only. Given the other nice hotels in the area, I'd *definitely* stay somewhere. And, I will be, come this July.

Reviews.Title: “Way too much fun”
Reviews.Author: AliceHang32
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed there and had a great time. The concierge was very helpful with whatever we requested. There was no problem getting into the clubs and everyone had a great time. It was really easy to check in and out and I appreciated the special service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a Waste of Time and Money - DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: trav3715
Reviews.Content: The customer service, ambiance, air & arrogance at this hotel is completely horrible. My suggestion would be to absolutely not stay at this hotel unless you want to throw your money away.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty at this fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: redoakiowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 746, a one bedroom suite with a balcony facing Petco Park. From the seamless check in, to the instantaneous arrival of anything we requested from housekeeping or the front desk, this hotel is run as efficiently as any I have ever stayed, and I live in Las Vegas. Nobu was fantastic as the Vegas or NY version. The bar in the lobby was great and the workout room and spa are immaculate. Within walking distance from everything. Stay here and you will not regret it. The lobby and hallways are riddled with rock and roll memorabilia including handwritten lyrics and notes from famous musicians such as John Lennon and Bruce Springsteen.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock was Fun and Nice”
Reviews.Author: hiljayc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hard Rock San Diego last summer. We both work in the hotel industry (at 1of the winners of a 2009 Trip Advisor Traveler's Choice Award). I felt that our experience was all in all a good one. We are both in our mid twenties, and were looking for a place which we could stay and be close to old town. We went to a baseball game the first night which was about a 3 minute walk from the hotel. It was so convenient that we got tickets for the second night as well. I loved that we didn't have to move our car for the enitre two nights at the hard rock. Everything we wanted to do and see was withing walking distance. The room was nice size, and very modern, not to mention clean. We ate at Nobu one of the nights, it was good food, yet the portions are small. If you are into haute cuisine you will enjoy it. All together I would recommend the Hard Rock, and am currently planning our next vaction there for the summer of 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Change of Pace”
Reviews.Author: Timewind
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the HRH San Diego in the past year. Normally I stay at Marriott properties, and the HRH has always been a nice change of pace. Rooms are unique and relaxing, bathrooms clean and showers very enjoyable. The location is excellent, and the staff attentive and good natured.

Reviews.Title: “Warning --> Avoid HR San Diego at all costs!! It is MISERABLE.”
Reviews.Author: progolfCA
Reviews.Content: Was initially excited to stay here for a local golf tourney. I am not an overly finicky traveler, but once I got there, I regretted every minute of it. First of all, it was past 5pm and they said my room was not ready yet. I can forgive that. But then, when I finally got my room cards at 6:30pm, I found some unsavory characters loitering in the hallways near my room and entered my room to find an unmade bed, large stains on the carpet, and a bathroom that smelled heavily of mold. Bad. Other than the layout, the condition of the room looks nothing like you see in the online photos. I ordered room service and it took almost TWO HOURS to arrive! All the while, my "high speed" internet connection kept timing out for some unknown reason (you pay a "resort fee" of $15 per day, which is supposed to include HSIA). Very frustrating since I had some legitimate work to do that evening. But it gets worse. Next morning, no hot or even warm water in the shower (at 6:45am...can't possibly be out of hot water yet). The maid had forgotten to leave soap, shampoo, etc. the prior day, so I had to go without. Came back from golf at 4:30pm, bed was still unmade, and no new supplies. I called down to the front desk and no one seemed to care, and no maid ever showed up. Then, around 7pm, another guest entered my room! Turns out, they had double booked it. I came back from dinner around 10:30pm (on a Tuesday night) only to hear blaring music from down below (and I was on the 6th floor, not the 2nd or 3rd). It went on until after 2am and when I looked out my window, I could still see a rather seedy crowd hanging around outside the hotel. The next morning, I went to check out and they handed me someone else's bill (from a different room) using my name! Total confusion at the front desk. Whatever you do, avoid this hotel. It is NOT worth the aggravation. You will sleep a lot better somewhere else (with the same amenities) for less money. It is a shame, because I have always been pleased with the Hard Rock Orlando. But this is a much different experience, and not for the better.

Reviews.Title: “NYE at the hard rock”
Reviews.Author: heavenlyberries
Reviews.Content: i have no complaints,except the 45 mins we waited in the valet line, but it was new years eve afternoon, so i'll excuse it. i never stayed here, so when the girlies suggested nye, i quickly logged on to my trusted old faithful, yelp. i must admit after browsing the reviews i was a bit concerned...from the crowd, to the "extra" fees, and crappy cust. service, my heart sank...but i was gonna be a trooper and venture in sans expectations, and sure enough...a good time was had by all! the staff was friendly as well as pretty nice eye candy (both genders) for the most part. i wish that a couple of the valet and bell boys had actually been at the shindig! we had snacks at nobu, and a little while later ventured into the party for the open bar portion of the night...it was all good, they weren't serving popov, so i was pleased, lol! the dj kicked [--]! and there were good vibes all around. we danced socialized and i ducked out 3 minutes to midnight to keep from having to duck the kisses of a stranger...but i was a happy camper...changed into my jammies and ordered room service, the chick panini, which was quite yummy, and surprise surprise wasn't that pricey (until the portfolio at check out showed an additional late night room service charge, [--]!?) other than that i would totally stay at this place again, would love to venture back in summer and check out their pool scene, i bet it kicks!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Carla086
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at the Hard Rock! It's not worth the hassle. I will be moving my get togethers to The Ivy hotel - for sure! I booked my reservation on-line for New Years Eve. I booked the Woodstock Suite overlooking the Moonstone lounge area where the New Years Eve party would be taking place. I thought it would be a good idea to party here for New Years since I had thrown other parties here in the past and the rooms are great for small gatherings. Being that I've stayed here before I knew that some of the suites have large balconies and others have medium and small - I've stayed in all 3! I wanted a large balcony and was told to type it in the comment section of my reservation - done! I also called the reservation line 2 days in advance to have the hotel clerk make a comment - done! I ALSO drown downtown at 1pm on the day of the my stay to check in early and assure I would receive the room I requested - done! The front desk said no problem, but the room is not clean so we'll give you a call when it's ready. Great! I walked away feeling like everything was prefect! I receive a call at 3:50PM indicating that my room is ready, I arrive an hour later because there is a 45 minute wait to valet my car (first annoyance, but whatever... it's New Years Eve) I wait in line and the front desk staff keeps looking at the screen and she calls the manager. I ask if anything is wrong and she said just checking on something so I wait.... FINALLY the manager tells me all the Woodstock suites have been given away! He gives me the keys to a room that is less than what I reserved with barely an apology, trying to convince me that this room is better even though the balcony is SMALL and it's NOT facing the party!!! It's facing kSt. downtown. By this time, I'm upset my friends are on there way... I haven't changed for the party... I go back to the front desk after looking at the room and tell him I'm not OK with this room - he disappears behind the front desk for an half an hour and mysteriously comes back with an available room I reserved! Half aplogized and sent me on my way. I get to the room and the room keys don't work. Keep in mind Ive been lugging my luggage, balloons, etc. back and forth this entire time. Luckily there was a maid in the hall that let me in. Horrible, horrible management.... Don't do it... don't stay here the management doesn't care about your experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sardawg
Reviews.Content: We found a great holiday deal on the Hard Rock Hotel's website and booked for Thanksgiving night, since we'd only be in town that day. The hotel is super funky and loud - so I'd recommend it to the type of people who are into noise and music. We loved the room. Hip style. And the people - everyone from the valet guys to the concierge and everyone in between - were all very friendly and accommodating. Plus the part of San Diego where the hotel is located is just gorgeous. Beautiful Harbor walk loaded with MLK memorabilia. Our only huge gripe - Mary Jane's - which is the diner/restaurant in the hotel. Eeek. Sub par, very overpriced food delivered by terrible servers. Super nice people, but terrible at their jobs. So - enjoy your stay at the Hard Rock - but definitely find another place to eat, regardless of how hungry you are or how late (or early) it is. :)

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Housekeeping, snotty staff”
Reviews.Author: Sharkdiver28
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel, and enjoyed the lobby. When we got to the room, it was FILTHY. The previous guests cake crumbs were by the sofa, the bathroom rug was frayed, ripped, and did not look worthy of a Motel 6. Called the front desk -- they acted annoyed, but sent up a manager. She immediately saw the shabby condition, called up a poor housekeeping girl, and chewed her out in front of me. Classless. Got me a new room, which lacked certain amenities. Had to call front desk for them, (garbage pail, in-house slippers). Manager NEVER checked back during my stay to see if issues were resolved. Bottom line? Skip the aggravation and stay somewhere clean, and where the staff gives a darn!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Bachelorette Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ocbos
Reviews.Content: My bridesmaid organized my bachelorette weekend for me in San Diego and we stayed at the Hard Rock. It was perfect for what we were looking for. It is a young, energetic hotel with a big bar adjacent to the lobby. The lobby itself is really modern and there was a little diner downstairs that had kind of crappy breakfast and kind of crappy service (you had to chase down the waiter). It was perfect for going out in the Gaslamp district, as it was a short walk to restaurants/bars/clubs. Not near the beach, but they had a pool on the rooftop, which was only disappointing because it was so small. But the pool was pretty nice and very crowded! Lots of good-looking people who wanted to see and be seen. We stayed in 2 suites which were pretty spacious, considering there were 4 girls in each room. Each suite had a separate living room area and we had 2 flatscreens in each suite. Also perfect for lots of girls: There were ample mirrors so you didn't have to elbow your friends when you're all trying to get ready at the same time. When we stayed, the hotel was fairly new, so they were still working out the kinks (i.e. for some reason 1 suite had no hair dryer), but overall the staff was very friendly and we had no major issues. Fun place and pretty good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Big Party ALL the time.”
Reviews.Author: Fazeisback
Reviews.Content: I love San Diego! This is an awesome state of the art hotel in the heart of the Gaslamp District. We didn't really have any over all issues with the hotel. There was an X rated type of party at the pool on a Sunday afternoon when we were there and you could see some stuff that I wouldn't want my child seeing going on. Everything was perfect as far as the rooms and how clean everything is and how nice everyone is. Remember before booking that this is a huge party area and if you plan on getting up early for a business meeting or some other kind of event this is not the place for you. The street noise is really bad until 3am. This is the best HRH i have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, missing key attributes”
Reviews.Author: CTRS77
Reviews.Content: I visited the San Diego hotel for a conference and was there 5 nights. The first night, a Saturday, they immediately said at the front desk I had a credit card problem when they tried to get approval for $2,000 credit in advance. This issue lingered for the entire stay, it was a hassle to say the least and in the end it turned out to be their error, they put in my actual mastercard number into an Amex approval! In fact, on the last day they purposively locked me and my guests out of our room for over an hour because of this issue. We can't let him check out tomorrow because he has a card issue, so lets make sure he can't have room access or leave? It was finally resolved by me calling my credit card company (I had $30,000 credit!) in their presence and finally they noticed their error. Most important failing however beyond the card incident was two out of five nights the noise in the room floor I was staying on was unacceptably high and raucous. Partying was taking place and door slamming was constant until 5 in the morning. I slept not a wink. I called the front desk 3 times during the night and they said they were sending security up, but bit it was never resolved. Two nights I lost a full night sleep, this can really kill a trip! When traveling and using a hotel a fundamental service is a bed and quiet surroundings so a guest can sleep. They failed here miserably. When I talked to the manager the next day, he said he had this complaint from other people on my floor and on other floors and it is common. He said, ya these young folks band together and rent a room for the night so they can take the party from our bar to somewhere and then they leave at about 5am when they sober up as little. He or hotel management obviously didn't care to fix it. He was however dressed (as they all are) very cool , and looked like a real rocker...more important I guess. They did keep throwing small credits at me to appease me each time I complained, but these were severe deficiencies. Other winner features: A health club who's aerobic machines don't work, you can't control the TV or music or even hear it some times, and the spa is unattended completely. Other items: For $15/day internet access could have worked better and for $30/day, valet parking was expensive...one time I waited 30 minutes to get my car...they kind of forgot about me,,,another complaint another small credit. I'd rather get have the car retieved quickly. The hallways are a mess, not living up to the rest of the place in style or appearance and they really need to allow for coffee in the room or the lobby. The place in a great location and has potential but doesn't seem to get it regarding the small customer satisfaction items which make a HUGE difference when paying so much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: medicfx45
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock ona Friday/Saturday. Room was a Hard Rock King suite, approx $200 night plus $15/night. Overall very happy with the great room, very spacious, 2 large flat screen TVs, great check-in process, quick. Great bar in the room with all sorts of drinks available, and chips and cookies (obviously for $). This is not your average hotel and I am not sure if I can recommend it for regular tourists or older people. Especially weekends, it seems like a party place and even in the rooms there were people partying. Did not get back to the room until 2am and there was actually a fight right outside our door... Called security and they were there in seconds (still not sure where they came from, because they appeared in no time!). Great bed. Great bathroom. Great room service. Always addressed in a very polite way by all staff and very often by last name. Valet parking was $30/day. When the car was brought to us the driver addressed me by name and there was a small bottled water placed in there for me!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hard Rock SD”
Reviews.Author: krista56
Reviews.Content: Starting at our arrival we were treated like Rock Stars. When we checked in we were greeted by friendly employees who offered to make reservations at the restaurants and pool for us. When we got in our room we were impressed by the classiness of the room. The beds were comfortable and the shower was amazing. We stayed on the 800 floor facing Petco Park which I recommend. (easy to request) Check out was easy, they offered to carry our bags to the valet and valet was ready for us by the time we got to the bottom of the elevator. Sweetwater and Nobu had both great food, service, and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' stay at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: shoeboxer4life
Reviews.Content: My husband has been working very long hours lately and realized it was important to find the time to reconnect without our three young children, so he booked at stay for us at Hard Rock. We live in suburbia and wanted to enjoy a weekend reminiscent of our pre-family days. Hard Rock is really a great place for a romantic getaway if you’re looking for a downtown experience that offers more energy. Nobu rocked -- be sure to try the lobster salad. The food is unbelievable but pricey, so I had to give my husband CPR when he opened the bill. But I’m worth it and so was the meal. He really went all out and got a “Rock Star Suite” for the evening. All I can say is Wow! We are not techie people so we never did figure out how to operate the surround sound though. Drinks at the bar on the rooftop were particularly special because we got to enjoy them snuggled by one of the fire pits. We ate breakfast at Maryjane’s and again, the comfort food indulgence was worth the calories and prices were reasonable. Music is definitely part of the experience – there was a DJ in the lobby when we checked in and Maryjane’s had one on Sunday morning too. Definitely glad we didn’t bring the kids – the hotel is more of an adult playground on the weekend. The hotel also has a spa. We didn’t’ try it this time but I absolutely plan to next time my husband’s guilt overtakes him and we’re back at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Not our scene - Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: Dinamet7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a suite at the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego for Labor Day weekend 2008. The hotel's location can't be beat for fun in the Gaslamp District as you can pretty much walk wherever you need to go or hop on the trolley. There is no hotel parking. You either valet for $20 per day (no ins & outs) or you park in the structure across the street from both the Omni and Hard Rock for about $12 per day (no ins & outs.) We decided to park in the structure for our stay and take a cab when we wanted to go to the San Diego Zoo (about an $8 cab ride each way - so we saved on parking @ the Zoo and @ the Hotel.) The structure is close enough for you to carry your own bags into the hotel - no biggie. The hotel is small overall so you're not going to get lost and you'll quickly find your way around the entire place. The suite was much smaller than I would have expected. I can't imagine what a regular room would be like, but I was surprised how small the suite was. Everything was decorated in what I like to call Ikea-chic... not very comfortable, but it looked cool. The bed was excellent, loved the fluffy pillows and fantastic down comforter. The shower and toilet room offer little in the way of privacy - so I absolutely do not recommend this hotel for groups of people who might be uncomfortable with showing off your naked silhouette while showering or who need more than a frosted door to feel comfortable using the toilet with others around. Any and every noise can be heard with clarity. There's no lock or knob on any of the bathroom doors - nothing but you and a frosted pane of glass. I love my husband, but there are times when we all need a little bit of privacy, right? I liked the way the music was set up when you walked into the room, the TVs were nice and every single member of the staff we encountered was very helpful and very polite. The gym facilities are great and we used them each day of our stay. We also had a fun view of the baseball park and could hear the game from our room if we opened our window. A few stories higher (we were on the 8th) and I'm sure we could have even seen some of the game. The atmosphere of the place is a 24/7 nightclub - during the day people walk around the hotel in bikinis, swim trunks and sunglasses. At night, skimpy skirts and sleazy club attire. Every time we got in the elevator it reeked of cologne, booze and cigarettes. We're still in our mid-20's but this was just not our scene (on the bright side - we were able to get away from it and hit up Dizzy's Jazz club at the San Diego Wine & Culinary Center which was about a 2 minute walk from the Hard Rock at the Harbor Club Towers.) You can't go to the pool to relax because it's also basically a club hangout. This is not a hotel for relaxing or vacationing. This is a hotel for partying - so if that's your goal, this is the place to be. If you're here to relax, enjoy a vacation or anything besides partying all the time, I'd check out one of the many other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock, Never Again !”
Reviews.Author: Bruce1962
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hard Rock for Two days in the second week of October only because all the other hotels in that area were full because of a Convention. The Hotel lacked any life or atmosphere even though it was busy, the staf were al pretty people ( Male & Female ) but with nothing behind the smiles, the upper hallways were very drab and grubby but the rooms were very nice.All in all a very Expensive and pretty hotel but in a great location. PS the in house Caf'e was good value for money, good food and freindly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hip to a Fault, Super Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: blueyedtravler
Reviews.Content: Is this a club? No, it’s actually the Hard Rock Hotel San Diego. We arrived about 10 PM on a Friday evening. The music was blasting, the people were beautiful, the girls really dressed to impress and we weren’t sure we were at a hotel. A series of free standing podiums serve as the “front desk.” We had to lean in and yell to communicate with the staff. There was a bouncer with a red velvet rope to check our room key before allowing us to get near the elevators. Puh-leaze. The room was pretty cool, though not exactly like the photos (a bit smaller). High def flat screens in the sitting area and bedroom blast music while offering you choices of $13 pay-per-view entertainment. The shower and WC are separate with frosted glass doors. All the accents are very modern, down to the vessel and faucet. While it all looked great when freshly cleaned, it didn’t function so well. The lighting was really poor – more mood/club lighting than anything and the faucet is so close to the mirror with no back splash you ruin the effect pretty quickly. Redemption came in the form of the bed and pillows. I loved the personal reading lights and the super comfy pillow top mattress. Huge feather pillows topped the bed. We got a lot of great sleep here! Staff - While we had one nice woman that helped us make reservations at Nobu (don’t bother), there was a bouncer, Aaron, that wouldn’t even let us OUT the side door “That’s what the front door is for.” Mind you Pinkberry is right there, as is an elevator bank to another uber-pretentious bar, and a full-fledged exit – we weren’t trying to sneak out a fire exit. I thought it was ridiculous to be treated like that as guests of the property. - We left the room at like 3 PM one day and did not receive maid service or a note saying they couldnt make up our room. There is a personalized guest messaging center on the TV - why not use it? Other hotels also knock, call or slip a note under the door to let you know when it's "last call" for maid service. Final thoughts: Pretty, lots of pretty people, lots of (bad) attitude, expensive and near a main strip with lots of other bars. If that’s what’s important to you, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but............”
Reviews.Author: msvogue490
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this was a VERY nice hotel! I am a frequent traveler & have stayed numerous places. I absolutely loved the bathroom amenities and the concierge desk was very friendly. (The airline lost my bag containing all of my toiletries and they sent up some extra items to get me started.) The bathroom shower was exquisite (there are two shower heads; and one comes out of the ceiling) and the bed was breathtaking! Talk about a heavenly bed..........let's just say I missed a party I was supposed to attend because the bed was sooooooooooo comfy and I didn't want to get up. I stayed at the hotel as part of a group receiving a "special rate" of $215/nt. This was a pretty decent rate considering the regular rate was a minimum of $275. However, I don't feel the rates they charge give you the value for your money. I realize that location has a lot to do with the rate charged. But I have stayed in Vegas in a suite on the strip that charged the same rate. And it included VIP access and free limo service. I think the hotel should offer a little bit more for your money if they are going to charge over $200 per nite. A microwave and complimentary airport/cruise terminal shuttle would be nice for starters. Even breakfast if its only pastries and coffee. Give the customers something other than expensive restaurants, costly mini bars, and pay per view movies

Reviews.Title: “Great service...but loud on Sat night”
Reviews.Author: lawgalkc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock September 17th to the 21st while he had a conference at the Convention center right across the street. We booked the hotel without having a chance to really read the reviews but knew it was in a great location. After reading the reviews we tried to change hotels but none of the close hotels had any availability. Needless to say, we were expecting the worst. We were surprised that we received great customer service throughout our stay. We especially enjoyed the help of the concierge Rhiana. She was very helpful in suggesting things to do and places to eat. The Hard Rock was in a great location for the conference and for night life. Unfortunately, Saturday evening we were kept up by the constant partying. We had an early flight and attempted to go to bed at 11:00pm. There were some guys partying in the hall way and I politely asked them to go somewhere else as we had an early morning. They were very polite and left. However, other people on the floor were not so courteous. Our room was on the 5th floor, right above the pool level where there are suites with outside access. Most people in these rooms had parties outside that were still going when we left the hotel at 5:30am.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: EnglishManinSD
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Ivy or W and when they were booked I didnt know where to turn. A friend suggested the Hard Rock and I am glad I did. The room was a spacious suite and the decor was great. It had all the amenities needed. We had great views of the baseball game both nights. The location is great. The bar was cool although it was taken over by a private group we were not able to use it as much as hoped but we were told on check in. Check out lines were a little long but someone spoke to us. The spa was great although the steam room was not working and esthetician was 35 minutes late for my treatment - good job she was good or I would have kicked up a storm. If you like the ivy or the W - you will love the Hard Rock

Reviews.Title: “DISCRIMINATION AGAINST MEXICANS”
Reviews.Author: EXPLORADORA83
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and me went to their lounge, and five minutes after they brought and charged us a big and expensive bill for our drinks, they told us in a really arrogant way we had to leave. We told them to wait us a little time because we hadn´t finished our drinks and we had payed for them. Then all the waiters started bittering us and shushing us and threatening us about calling the police and stuff. Thwy included some racist and discriminatory language against us, becasue they knew we were mexicans. So if you want to support discriminmation and intolerance that place is the place to go.....

Reviews.Title: “It Is... What It Is.”
Reviews.Author: roomandbored
Reviews.Content: The place is pretty nice but its definitely geared to those who wanna party and then eventually throw up. Unfortunately during our stay we passed by 'evidence' of said partying near the elevators. The rooms are clean and stylish albeit at the cost of function. Make sure you know the person you're traveling with well b/c bathroom privacy is at a minimum. All sights and sounds are on full display with the glass enclosed bathrooms. I have never said someone has 'attitude' b/c i think its a lame description, however the girl at the front desk who checked us in definitely had it. She was just... sarcastically unfriendly. The food in the resort is excellent and the flat screen tvs are nice but... when are these hotels going to actually transmit HD signals to these devices??

Reviews.Title: “Trying way too hard to be trendy instead of offering good service”
Reviews.Author: londontravellers_8
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotels for 3 nights end August, very nice property as you would expect for the price, but it is way trying too hard to be cool! rooms quite small, drinks pricey and the pool is way too small - full by 11am - and the hotel seems to be full of young guys on skatebaords and jeans way too low! friends of ours in san diego so all the locals say it is way too pretentious place

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: SaavyL
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel is like throwing out money and paying to have a bad experience. I still feel sickened by my whole experience here. Even worse, one month after I stayed, I received a mysterious charge on my bill. Which was definitely not there when I checked out. So, if you want a hotel with bad service, a penchant for fraud, and horrible accommodations, this is the place for you! I made the mistake of hosting my sister's bachelorette party at this hotel. Two connecting king suites were promised. Guess what happened? At 9 o'clock FINALLY after waiting in the lobby for an hour, without so much as, would you like a drink? or an apology offered, we were told that we could now check into our Rock Star suite. Which sounds great - but is actually a DUMP. Supposedly, this is their nicest suite. We were not given our two connecting king suites. We were not given the rollaways we were promised. We were not given a discount - just a "the customer is upset" credit. We were lied to repeatedly, told contradictory information - from multiple managers, and made to feel completely unwelcome at a place where the staff will stop speaking to you in mid-sentence to pet the dog of one of their condo-hotel owners. My advice to anyone reading this is to eschew the Hard Suck for the Omni across the street, which is lovely. My advice to the HS is to fire their managers and provide a crash course in customer service to those running the hotel. As a side note, I was offered an apology by a maid who was aware of what was going on and shared that the management problems happened a lot in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Horrible Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: hellokitty4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel a lot. We go to Vegas at least once a month and to other cities throughout the year. I thought that it would be a GREAT idea to stay at this hotel but boy was I wrong. I never write reviews for hotels but this one is most deserving of one because I thought it would be nice to warn other travelers. Check-in was easy because it wasn't too busy but upon entering the King Studio Suite, someone from the Hard Rock Hotel staff had left us a nice present in the bathroom so our room smelled horrible. We opened the balcony door and aired out the room. We decided in the mean time to check out the pool... bad idea. You cannot bring any other bottles or even water into the pool area! The pool is about HALF the size of a junior olympic swimming pool and it was PACKED. We left and decided to head to the beach. The valet guy scanned our ticket and we began waiting for our car. We were the only ones for about 10 minutes and then another couple came and dropped off their ticket and within 10 minutes their car arrived. Our car still had not come... I approached the Valet Manager and asked him about our car. He looked confused and said that they were "looking for it" and then he ran into the back. I was so shocked I went inside and told them that I would not be paying the $30/night valet charge. After waiting another 10 minutes our car finally showed up and they apologized of course. We decided at that moment to pack up our things, cancel the reservation, receive our full money back and leave for the Omni Hotel (right across the street). This hotel is so overrated and service is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Badly, Smelly rooms, Extra Charges added after Check-out”
Reviews.Author: xcytablboy
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving I was told by the valet that they wouldn't be parking my car because the hotel had "overbooked". This after having booked my room 6 MONTHS in advance. Was told by the desk clerk my room wa not availiable, when I objected strenuously was accosted by the hotel Manager who angrily told me I was "in denial" about the fact that I was being told I would have to be put in an overflow hotel. After a screaming match in the lobby between the two of us I asked what the point ofa reservation was if they didn't honor it. Ultimately my eleven year old son and I were put in a room that had had been taken out of service because of the overpowering noxious chemical smell from their attempt to get out the smoke smell from the room. THE BEST PART: They added an extra night room charge onto my credit card that was not reflected on my hotel bill. STAY AWAY. The Marriot and Hyatt across the street are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “bad place to bring a family”
Reviews.Author: Idaho2Reepie
Reviews.Content: We had problems. Our 11 year old daughter LOVES to swim when we're on vacation. Upon arrival, Sunday night we were denied access to the pool. There was an alcoholic pool party for those 21 and over. The next day we were denied access to the pool because someone broke glass in it the night before. We were assured that the pool would be available by 8:00 AM the next morning. By 10:00 AM the pool wasn't even filled. When we returned at 3:00 it still wasn't filled all the way, but we called the front desk and were told that the pool was open. Upon arrival, it was cloudy. A friendly guest mentioned that she just saw someone dump a bunch of chemicals in it. I asked an employee when the pool would be open and he said he guessed you could go in now. It obviously was not safe and if we didn't know enough to know better he could have endangered our safety. No one was in charge of the pool, no notices posted for the glass or the chemicals. Ultimately the bar tender told us to go to the Omni's pool which we did. They were gracious to let us in. The Hard Rock pool was unavailable the entire stay. In addition to the misinformation and repeated disappointment for my daughter regarding the pool, upon check in, a couple security guards were going to take care of some disturbance. There were tons of vodka and booze, and breakaway underpants in the room for purchase, but not coffee or microwave. The fridge was jammed with booze so as to be unavailable for anything else you may want to put in. Storage is extremely limited. Our carpet was sopping wet in one spot and began to stink on day two. The personnel were professional, however their tatoos, piercings and black clothes scared our daughter. The videos of guys dancing around in makeup, corsets and fishnet stockings in the coffee shop didn't make a good impression either. The beds were very comfortable and the room very quiet however. All in all not a place for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyed our stay, but lacking on some things”
Reviews.Author: Boders
Reviews.Content: Was a first time visitor to San Diego and a bit hesitant to book a room here based on the reviews about the noise, etc. Just got home from a 4-day stay and I must say that my husband and I were pleasantly surprised and really enjoyed our stay for the most part. We are in our early 30's and don't have kids so other people may have a different perspective. This hotel is trendy, definitely filled with some people who try too hard and just want to see and be seen, but its what makes the Hard Rock the Hard Rock and we found it to be entertaining. There are two bars at this property, both of which are very popular. We had drinks one night at the Moonstone Lounge. Fun place and good people watching. The line to get in the place on Sat. night was ridiculously long though, I so I would recommend going any night but Saturday unless you get there early (I do think you can get on a list if you are staying at the property). We stayed in a King Deluxe Suite on the 7th floor and the room was large and very spacious. Full living room with a bar, 2 flat screens, small balcony, etc. We never had problems with noise as other people indicated, but the bars are on the first and fourth floors and we faced away from the pool area so we didnt have a problem. A few cons to note. Housekeeping was a little spotty. One day they didn't leave us any hand towels, we ran out of body wash and shampoo on day 2 - both of which were never replaced during our entire stay, our full length mirror was never cleaned (I had accidentally gotten some hair product on it so I know), and the open bathroom situation is a bit strange (or should I say the room in which the toilet lives). There is a glass door that swings open but it is open at the top and the bottom and really offers no privacy. The biggest issue we had was with the mini-bar and random charges on our bill. The first day we had a receipt left on our dresser for a $4 water that we didn't drink. No big deal, they took it right off the bill. Our last night there we realized we had a $155 mini-bar charge on our account (no receipt left -- just noticed by looking up our account on the TV) and we hadn't touched the mini-bar the entire time we were there. We wanted to address it that night as we had an early flight the next day, but were told they needed to speak to the housekeeping manager first who wouldn't be in until the next morning. Checked out the next morning, charge had been taken off the bill. Check our AMEX bill the next day and they had charged us the $155 without authorization. Had to call and get it resolved and we were credited back our money, but this left a bad taste in my mouth about our overall experience. With that said I would go back, just keep an eye on your bill (something I believe others have noted as well).

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in San Diego for the scene”
Reviews.Author: andergtr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice. The first time I was in a suite on vacation, and the second time I was in a Moonstone room which had the adjacent seating area/patio outdoors. Both times were fantastic if you're into a scene. Check-in was relatively painless, and the valet service wasn't bad. The hotel is located very close to the airport (SAN) and in the Gaslamp District so you could cab it there and just walk around all weekend. This is a hotel that defines a scene. On the weekends you can't even really easily get into the lobby because of the lounges there (which have guest lists). Lots of silicone-enhanced girls are around with tattooed rock-star types. There is wonderful room in the Nobu restaurant down in the lobby (on par with every other Nobu I've eaten at). Amenities and the room are great, and the place is essentially brand-new. The showers and facilities are great, and the turndown service includes a piece of rock candy and a bottle of Voss water. In my first stay at the suite, I even got a pair of Hard Rock San Diego slippers I took home. The pool is a scene, especially on Sundays when there is an event called Intervention. Imagine a bunch of pros and strippers (well, maybe they aren't, but they look like they are) in a pool that might be the size of a large bathrub, and you basically have it. The cocktail waitresses are scantily clad (whoever thought of G-string bikinis with low-rider sweats is a genius). Great place for the scene. I wouldn't stay anywhere else--unless you don't like noise and scene.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: coloradomojo
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Hard Rock while attending a conference at the Convention Center across the street. My room was on the 5th floor, above the Sweetwater Saloon, with a view of the Convention Center. Pros: Right across the street from the Convention Center. Great access to tons of restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter. Great access to running on the Embarcadero by the marina. Comfortable bed and pillows. Great shower and Aveda products. Nice turndown service with complimentary rock candy and Voss water. Cons: On the last night, extremely loud industrial dance music shook my floor from 11:00 pm-2:00 am. There was about a 1-inch space under the door, which allowed any noise in the hallway to come in. No iPod docking station in the room. I did have Wi-Fi access, but it was $15 per day. The closet was not tall enough to hang my pants and dresses without hitting a shelf, so I had to hang them on hooks in the bathroom. There is a fridge in the room, but it is really a fully stocked mini bar, so if you would like to use the fridge, you need to remove everything. The pool is very small and closes at 6:00 pm. Additional comments: This hotel would be good for young, hip singles and couples who enjoy the nightlife and don’t go to sleep before 2:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could use a few improvements to make it great”
Reviews.Author: spike13
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for the ComicCon. It was great because it was so close to the convention center. Staff: Extremely helpful and pleasant Rooms: Small but nice. Bed was too soft but pillows were superior. There was no dresser in the room. Also they had a huge chair stuffed in the corner, better if they just didn't bother since it wasn't a place you could really sit and just took up a lot of space. Closet was an armoire which was on the small side and no place to stash the empty suitcases. Big tv in room is nice. Other hotel areas: Mary Jane's in nice and above average diner. Downstairs bars are major party destinations which means it's very loud. Can't smoke in rooms and the only place is in front of the building, better if they had a space near the pool so you weren't sitting on the street at 1 am. Pool closes at 6 pm! Which means basically it's not open when you're at your hotel and you can't relax in the jacuzzi after a long day - makes no sense. Business center is awful. You have to pay a minimum of $5 to use it, then there's no way to hook your own laptop up to print from. Even if you email your documents as attachments to yourself, you still can't print because it blocks opening attachments. Total waste of time and money. Not a place for real business travelers. Prices on extras: Be careful you check your bill and watch what they charge you for. Nothing in the room is marked whether or not it's free or you have to pay. They leave tons of water bottles out but some are complimentary and some you pay $10+ for. Also internet pricing is very vague. On the startup it says you'll either pay $15 a day or it's included in your room rate. When I called downstairs to ask they said it's included, but on checkout I was charged. When I pointed this out they removed it, so it turned out ok, but still very confusing. Also, watch your mini bar charges. I found that we were charged for random things and also had to get bill adjusted at checkout. Overall the Hard Rock tries hard to be a nice place and thinks of many details other hotels don't. I wish they spent as much time on the standard amenities as they do their unique ones.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Cheese”
Reviews.Author: eeeeeeeli
Reviews.Content: It's what you'd expect, I guess. Prepare to be greeted by a lobby full of hot young things, less "hip" than "dipped" - in cologne and tanning lotion that is. In trying to sell a "rock" image, it ends up trying way to hard, and from the lobby contents all 5 days of our stay, it seems to attract those with the same intent. The biggest annoyance in this regard was certainly the valet boys clogging up the entryway in various poses, presumably to attract the adoration of the various Paris Hilton wannabes tittering by. That said, the hotel was clean (except for an odd damp spot that the front desk assured me would be taken care of... and an hour or so later it was, I suppose after the hot entourage action had settled a bit downstairs). The room was pretty slick, and quite modern and well-appointed for its price. We had a great view of Petco park out our window. The beds were incredibly comfortable, and the television system, though a bit clunky, did deliver numerous HD channels to the large flat screen. The location is excellent - perfect for family or single entertainment. Many restaurants, both high and low class, were scattered up and down the street right outside. (For what it's worth I'd skip "Dick's", where the canned shtick of the waiters is intended, no kidding, to embody the name. Joke was old after a few minutes). But as a first time visitor to San Diego, I was bowled over by its considerable charm, variety of interesting neighborhoods, parks, and simple beaches - Belmont park is a neat sibling to its big brother up the coast in in Santa Cruz. For its price, the hotel offered a nice alternative to the staid offerings of similarly priced hotels. Be prepared to pay for just about every extra, including a daily rate for internet service. The 6 story public parking garage across the street, with an elevator, is a fine alternative -at about half the price - to the hotel valet (it's actually what they use).

Reviews.Title: “Great location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: These_are_my_travels
Reviews.Content: My wife and 13 yr old daughter stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid July and loved it. The hotel sits at the base of the gaslamp district which gave us tons of restaurants to choose from and stores to browse within easy walking distance of the hotel each night which we loved. As with most tripadvisor users I do my research and was aware coming in of the possibility of load noise and requested a high floor which I got. I'm glad I did as a room near the pool bar area would have been very noisy, still there was an in-room party nearby going on until 6 am but this did not keep us awake. I was also aware of the turn down fee and the valet charges both of which I didn't feel were out of line. The queen suite was large, always clean and we also received our bottled water and hard rock candy early each evening provided with the turn down service. I didn't make use of any of the on site restaurants, bars or pool area. I considered going to the pool one day, walked in mid afternoon on the Sunday to check it but the area around the bar and pool was very busy so didn't stay. Although there wasn't anybody in the actual pool it did look like a great place to hang out. The staff always treated us great, the reminder and post stay follow up emails showed that they are at least looking for feedback and judging by some earlier posts I believe they are making amends. I have nothing but good things to say about our stay and would definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to shell out some extra cash”
Reviews.Author: Mrlndgrl
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to shell out some extra cash. When I arrived at the hotel, the valet parking attendant told me I would be charged 30 dollars a day for parking. (In addition the valet parking attendants expect a tip every time they park and return your car.) If you want to use the internet it is 5 dollars each time you use it; plus an additional amount if you want to print or fax something. If you want a drink from the in room mini bar you will be charged an extra 20% plus taxes. I enjoy going to nice hotels and don't mind paying extra money but this place was ridiculous. Nothing is included. We tried to go to the pool twice but were unable to swim. The first time was 7:30 PM and one of the employees told us the pool closed at 6pm. The second time we went, all of the seats were reserved so there was no where to sit our put our stuff. Next time, I'll stay at the Omni across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Check in 9pm- Horrible Stay!”
Reviews.Author: darbabe
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. We booked two suites for the weekend months ago and when we arrived at 4pm we were told they had been sold. We were offered a downgraded room and told we could shower in the gym and wait in the lobby until 8:30PM!!!! when our room (notice the lack of plural here) would be ready. We had booked the room for a special engagement and the entire experience with the hotel was disatourous. Having been downgraded in rooms we expected a comp. After some strong words we were offered 2 bottles of champagne. It never came. Then there was the rollaway bed we needed, again since we were downgraded. We called, and called, and talked to teenagers (I mean managers). The rollaway arrived at 3am. The worst part about the experience was the inability of the staff to take care of their guest. At any hotel you would expect a complimentary room, drinks, free breakfast, etc. NOTHING! The staff are powerless fraternity brothers who clearly can't read the hotel's customer service manual, if there is one. This place is awful. Do not go here. Did I mention the couple having sex outside our window and the used condom on our patio in the morning?

Reviews.Title: “Grungy”
Reviews.Author: nerdlywed
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this hotel while attending an event at the convention center, with some friends who stayed longer. The day we arrived, the rooms were not cleaned. After two complaints to the front desk, someone was sent to clean- in our room they made the beds and lined up the minibar items. In the other room they didn't even bother to make the beds! The mouthwash provided had been previously used... The hotel seemed to be banking on a name and a nice lobby rather than good service- the diner was slow and brought out the wrong items (we hadn't received the correct food by the end of the meal, just had it taken off the bill in the end), the valet parking was beyond slow, even though they seemed to have plenty of glowering staff standing about at all times. Had to call down multiple times for bag service when we left. At a lower price, who would care about the little things, but this wasn't a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great vibe”
Reviews.Author: Groce
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by stating that this was my first trip to San Diego (w/ wife - both in our 30s/no kids) and stayed for a week. It's hard to separate the Hard Rock Hotel in San Diego from the neighborhood it is in: Gaslamp. The hotel basically anchors the entrance to the Gaslamp District (comprised of hotels, restaurants, bars and shops too numerous to mention) and reflects the general atmosphere. On the weekends, HRH is a party place - period. It is loud, crowded and energentic. During the week, it is laidback and has a lot of contemporary charm. My wife and I used the weekends to let loose and the weekdays to move about the city for some sightseeing; it worked perfectly at the HRH. Being a registered guest at the hotel gets you on a pseudo-VIP list to the hotel's clubs on Friday/Saturday and to the Sunday Invervention pool party on Sunday afternoon. These events are very pretentious but fun (probably more so with a group of friends). For sightseeing, the location at the "foot" of the Gaslamp District is perfect. Not only is Petco Park right next door, 2 very user-friendly city MTS trolleys are within walking distance. Knowing what I know now, I could easily get to every major sightseeing destination in San Diego using the trolley system and the 2 major sightseeing transportation companies (one is a trolley/other is a double-decker bus) without a car. As for general hotel service/amenities, HRH follows the general trend I felt in the city itself: a) service is average and nobody really puts forth much extra effort and b) prices are on the expensive side. We did appreciate our housekeeping crew - their customer service was the best of any we received in San Diego (including all restaurants, bars, tours, etc...). The room itself was a bit odd though. We had a King Suite (with a great balcony). However, the layout of the room is not very practical and the fact that the bathroom had sort of an "open air" concept will be off-putting to some. Finally, valet parking in too high at $30 per day but seems to be competitive with the area. I would definitely stay at HRH again and would suggest it to friends. However, it is not for everyone. The place is, again, full of energy (i.e. noisy, young crowd) and not concerned about making you feel at home (on purpose, I would assume) as some hotels do. I think if people understand what the place is about before going, the experience will be a positive one.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel - Excelelnt Hotel - With some down sides”
Reviews.Author: Woody_000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hard Rock for 2 nights after is was at a conference at another hotel for the week. On first entering the Hotel you are greeted with the very impressive, very modern lobby. The whole place just exudes "Cool and Trendy" Nothing about the hotel is mediocre in looks or appearance, the rooms are very nice indeed with large LCD's in the rooms and very nice entertainment and movie selection and some cool ports you plug you gadgets into buitl into the wall. The shower is very cool, it has a rain type shower from above and another that comes at you from the side. The pool is very nice with some cool cabana's that you can rent and some very nice seeting and some beds you can lie on and get some sun. The hotel is very busy and you have to book to get into the bars even if you are staying in the hotel but are guaranteed to get in if you book before 6pm at night with the concierge. The crowd around the bars can be a bit pretentious but if you don't care its a cool place to hangout and have some fun. We stayed on the first floor and we had an early flight but went to bed at 2am but it was still very noisy from the bar bellow until well after that. All in all its a very nice hotel and i would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hard Rock San Diego fan...”
Reviews.Author: jonmanuel
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay a couple of years ago at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago, and was looking forward to a similarly good time in San Diego with my girlfriend... How disappointed I was! This place would be fine if it was a nightclub, but it feels like the staff and management forgets they are running what is supposed to be a four-star hotel. People working inside the hotel, at the front desk and in room service were very - but the pretentious attitude of the outdoor staff was a bit much to handle. The bell boys were acting more like bouncers, and there seemed to be a number of workers just "hanging out" in front of the hotel not really doing anything. The hallways were filthy. It seemed like there were always stacks of room service trays waiting for someone to come and dispose of them. Cigarette butts littered the entrance to elevators. We had to guess which room was ours since the room numbers had been ripped off the wall. Inside the room was fine, but the bathroom was kinda weird - no locks and tempered glass - my girlfriend and I are obviously close, but some activities we like to keep private! The topper was returning from a day at the beach to find BLOOD on our sheets. I called housekeeping, and they promptly changed the sheets, but the fact that bloody sheets made it onto the bed in the first place was enough for me to write this place off for good.

Reviews.Title: “First time to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PPowell6
Reviews.Content: Wow.....What a neat Hotel. Our first impression was great. The front desk staff could not have gone better, all the girls there went out of there way to be friendly and helpful. We went to the pool bar and things couldnt have gone any worse. The staff was rude, and basically ignore us as we watched others being waited on. Being in our 50s Im sure we were thought of not being "cool". After 20 minutes I walked up to the bar to order myself to some snobby little blonde girl. We had to ask for 4 different things ( Pina Colada, Apricot Stone Sour, and Strawberry Marquarita) which she said they didnt have the mix to do either, and no strawberrys to boot. Ten minutes after we ordered and sat down we watched her making things with strawberrys...hmmmmm We were mad as you know what and after our drinks were gone we left never to go back. I mentioned our problem with the front desk staff and she couldnt have been nicer and apolojized many times. After we came back from dinner later that night we came back to our room with a nice card and a bottle of wine from Debby the girl at the front desk. What a nice gesture for sure. We got room service a couple of times for breakfast and it was always good, little pricy but to be expected. Overall it was fun, but I would doubt if we will ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Kimmberleigh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the San Diego Hard Rock for Memorial Day weekend. It was a romantic get away weekend for us. We spent two (and too) pricey nights at the hotel. I don't mind pricey if I get good service. What we experienced was anything but good service. We arrived at the front of the hotel and the lobby was very modern looking and clean. Staffing was good and we were helped right away. We were given our room keys and up we went. As soon as the elevator doors opened, it was as if we had stepped into another hotel. The hallway was filthy. There was trash and dirt all over the carpet in the hallway. Perhaps the dark color of the carpeting showed off the dirt, but a good vacuuming was in order. When we entered the room, it appeared to be clean, at least cleaner than the hallway. Very modern looking. It took about 2 minutes for my shin to find the wood base of the bed that sticks out farther than the mattress on all sides. It wasn't the last bruise I got from the bed that weekend! We did like the bathroom decor. We thought the shower with two shower heads was great! I went to pull out the desk chair to sit down and there was a stain in the middle of the seat that looked disgusting. A call was placed to the desk to get housekeeping up to clean it. Some time during the evening, the chair was cleaned. A message was left on the phone and tv that the cleaning had been done. Sunday morning, the hallways were still dirty, in fact more trash was added to the floor. We left for a day of sailing and returned at 4:30 in the afternoon to a dirty room. They had not even made the bed, let alone do any other cleaning or straightening of the room. Another call had to be made to get the room clean. I also asked to speak with the manager. I thought I would tell him about the dirty hallway. Of course, right after I ask for the manager, I hear a vacuum in the hallway! That was short lived, only about 2 minutes of hallway vacuuming, so it was still dirty. I think maybe someone else complained so they vacuumed in front of one or two doors (we were not one of the chosen few). The manager never called. We eventually went out for the evening. The room had been cleaned by the time we returned. Sunday, check out time. Still filthy hallway on our floor. Maybe we should have checked out the other floors? I am not a neat freak but the floor was so obviously dirty it really was a disappointment, especially for the cost of staying here. Normally I hear Hard Rock and think of good things. The San Diego Hard Rock was truly a disappointment. After checking out we did inform the manager of all the problems. He just said they were short staffed in housekeeping. I'm sorry but for what they charge to stay their, and to keep their reputation, the manager should get to cleaning if need be. I won't be spending my hard earned money at Hard Rock hotels in the future. They lost me on this one.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rocks!”
Reviews.Author: mad.nomad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention/congress. Very convenient. Great service, sometimes the rock theme goes over the top though. The bars are very busy on week ends and you have to book in advance if you want to get in even as a house guest. Don't go if you have a jealous girlfriend to this hotel! ;-) But I say it only jokingly. It is great even for throwing in a game of Padres too with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: christiepooh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hard Rock during a conference at SD Convention Center. The location for going to and from the center is AWESOME! The beds are AWESOME! The shower is SUPER AWESOME! The in-room music channels are AWESOME! But that is about it. It was $269 a night and didn't even include internet access! There were 8 of us staying in 8 rooms. Each of us was charged $15 a night "turndown" service which was to provide turndown, 2 bottles of water, and internet access. I needed internet so I agreed to the fee. I always had internet and turndown but didn't always get water. I mentioned it to the front desk and she instantly took a charge off. Other coworkers never used the internet or got water or turndown but still paid the fee. Some of us got various pieces of the package. The room was spot clean. Like the floors and main table areas were clean. But when you spend a week in a room you start to notice that the back corners are full of dust and even old trash! I was overlooking the pool side. On the day we checked out (Thursday), they were building a concert stage right outside my sliders. There was going to be some concert right outside my room that night. Which might have been the best ever or not. I asked the front desk if it was really going to be right there. She said yes, it gets pretty loud around here on the weekends. So note to self, if you are looking for quiet on a weekend, this is not the place for you. It was quiet when I was there (Sun-Thur). And I loved a lot of it. Just be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Pretentious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PBLiving
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HR Hotel for one night just to check it out and be a tourist in my own town. The location of the hotel is great, right in the heart of the Gaslamp District and next to Petco Park. The rooms were modern and clean and we had a good view of San Diego Bay. There is music all around the hotel which is cool. My major complaint about the Hard Rock is the bars and the cost.
